Reviews.Title: “Weekend at the Adolphius”
Reviews.Author: pantera12
Reviews.Content: We Thursday through Sunday her in early February. Concierge staff was very helpful as was the valet staff. Housekeeping was unobtrusive. Definitely a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reeeallllll Nice!”
Reviews.Author: bigcoolchuck
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a date night and stayed here this past Friday and the hotel definately met our expectations. It had a real old time feel to it, with the old room keys handing in the lobby and the wooden elevators. It was all very clean, we got a really good deal on the room, and the staff was very nice. I would definately recommend it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay for Your Trip in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Annie C
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is the perfect place to stay when visiting Dallas for any occasion. The hotel is classic, clean, very detailed, spacious rooms, and above all amazing service with such pleasant and polite people. I have been to the Aldophus for many different occasions and no matter the group they always provide the best time and a seamless stay. I would choose to stay here over any place in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea and Dinner in the French Room”
Reviews.Author: Karyn_D680
Reviews.Content: We went for a family celebration. We had afternoon tea and it was truly wonderful. We were served a tea of our choosing and had delightful cookies, etc,. At dinner we ate in the French Room and it was also delicious. The hotel was gracious and beautiful and the accommodations were superb. I would highly recommend this hotel for special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: nanski3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were staying overnight in Dallas to attend a concert at Gexa Energy Pavilion. The Adolphus is a wonderful location and convenient for any event near downtown Dallas. In addition it is a short walk to many Dallas restaurants. Check in at the hotel was as easy as I have ever experienced. I went inside to check in while my husband took care of turning our car over to the valet parking. He and I were both on the way to our room within minutes of arrival. The lobby area was very "old world" and would have been a fun place to sit and people watch if we had the time to kill. Our room was very comfortable, clean, and tastefully decorated, but was nothing extraordinary. My only complaint was that there was only one bath towel and it was a bit flimsy...... not the thick fluffy towels I would have expected at the Adolphus. When I called housekeeping and requested additional towels, they were delivered more quickly than I have ever experienced. The staff at the Adolphus was the most pleasant and attentive that I have seen in any hotel. Any employee was ready to assist at any time. I was especially impressed with the gentleman working the valet parking in the evening. Every time we went in or out, he remembered us and welcomed us back. In the morning we ate breakfast at the Bistro. Our waitress, Petra, was "The Best". She was pleasant, efficient, and made sure that we needed nothing. As a bonus to the wonderful service, we thoroughly enjoyed the Crabmeat Eggs Benedict, and the Texas Scramble. Our stay at the Adolphus was a real treat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: judy d
Reviews.Content: Overall stay the Adlophus was great and the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel was very beautiful and well kept. We stayed in a room with a King size bed with plenty of room and it was very nice and the bed was very comfortable and the view was great. I liked that it was close to many attractions downtown just walking distance. If I have another stay in Dallas I would stay here again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Guest Rooms Not to Level of Lobby”
Reviews.Author: Ray L
Reviews.Content: Likes: lobby decor and acht. Fitness club, on site dining options. Dislike: cleanliness of room, valet parking responsiveness at early AM departure. I also like that I could pay 75 bucks via hotels.com but the valet parking is 26$ plus the tipping. Way too much dust in the corners of my room, carpets are way past due and the bathrooms are very dated. Lobby is amazing, so many chairs and nooks to relax and lounge, work, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: impactnaomi
Reviews.Content: I was concerned when I read some negative reviews, but I had the best overall experience at this hotel. The staff was great and willing to make every request happen. The hotel was beautiful with the old style mahogany and brass fixtures. The room was gorgeous, although it didn't have a good view, but really- how much time do you spend inside a hotel room looking out the window? I would definitely come here again, and I hope that next time I am able to give the French Room a try!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fit for the Queen.”
Reviews.Author: tonsse
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved the history and majestics of staying at the Adolphus. Amazing services offered (although some at a price), and all sorts of things to do within walking distance. All in all, amazing times to be had by all. They truly made me feel like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: honestreviews1777
Reviews.Content: This is a great Historic Hotel. The location is great and the staff were fantastic. The rooms are large and have a great bathroom and dressing area. Keep in mind it is historic so if you like the modern, tres chic feel of the Wynn then this is not the place for you. Overall I would recommend and I would stay there again. Be away the only option for parking is valet and is $30 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Adolphus Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Char L
Reviews.Content: Historic hotel, elegant, clean and excellence service. Look forward to my next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A great Birthday visit”
Reviews.Author: Ramon P
Reviews.Content: My wife was having a birthday and I was looking for very nice location for dinner. The French Room is one of the highest rated restaurants in the area and we decided to go there. The Adolphus was also running a room special, so we also decided to stay there. It was a very good choice. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. We were provided a very nice room upgrade. The French Room was excellent. Our wait staff was very helpful and professional. It was one of the best meals we have ever had. I will return there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Building, Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Joe48713
Reviews.Content: Lovely grand old building in downtown business district of Dallas, but the service is absolutely terrible. Stayed there twice (multiple nights) - Each time left with a long list of gripes... Valet parking is probably the worst... Once waited over 15 minutes for them to bring around the car. Check-in and check-out is nearly as bad (usually, only one clerk working the front desk). On a positive note, the rooms are nice and the entire hotel is superbly decorated... But based on the need to stand in line for services, not a good place for busy travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal - beautiful hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: BadgerdenTexas
Reviews.Content: The sheer history of this hotel is fascinating. Great location for downtown Dallas events. The rooms were very well appointed and it has been literally years since I have experienced this level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful beds”
Reviews.Author: Caryn M
Reviews.Content: Hotel is older (you'll notice it by the time you get in an elevator) but some of the amenities are lovely. Excellent beds and bedding, which made it easy to sleep. Service from the doorman through registration is awesome (they make a point of knowing your name) but maid service was lacking (I didn't get consistent refresh of washcloths, the one item I need every day). Overall, a lovely experience. We had use of a club suite on the 10th floor, outfitted with contemporary decor, full kitchen and pool table. It was a great and unexpected facility. I stayed here for business, quiet rooms were a plus since we had early starts every morning. If you can't start your day without Starbucks (although the Adolphus has a coffee bar outside the Bistro), there is one just outside the lobby and at the corner. For vacationers, there's not much within walking distance (Neiman Marcus and CVS) but you're in the heart of Dallas and short drive to most points of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Had some quirks.”
Reviews.Author: worleybird98
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my two teenagers, and had the opportunity to find a good deal on Hotels.com for the Adolphus so I snapped it up. I used to live in Dallas in the 80's, and always wanted to stay here so I was very excited at my chance. We were up on the 14th floor, so had a fairly nice view. Mostly of other buildings, but a little garden or something too which was nice. We too had the issue of getting hot water out of both taps in the bathroom - but sometimes cold would come out of the hot one too. So you always had to be really careful before you filled up a glass or washed your face to make sure you had the right temperature that you wanted! Our first night we wanted to go to Deep Ellum for dinner, which is only about a mile away. The hotel has a "hotel car" that will take you anywhere in a 3 mile radius for free, up to 8pm. So instead of calling up my car and trying to figure out the directions myself, we decided to try the hotel car. Getting there was fine, and we had a nice dinner. The driver gives you his card with a phone number on it to call when you wanted to come back. So at 7pm when we were done we called and he said he'd be about 10 minutes. It was a beautiful night so we didn't mind waiting. At 7:30 we called again to see if he forgot about us - turned out he did, and was taking someone to the airport so would not be able to come get us at all. We were not thrilled at all about being stranded, especially in an area that does not get a lot of cab traffic. We ended up walking the mile back to our hotel using the directions on google maps on my phone - not exactly the dream ending to our first day in Dallas. The next morning we were up early and called for our car - it was ready in minutes and we pulled out around 7:30am to head to Fort Worth. We had several things to do early, but ended up spending the whole day there and didn't return to our room until 7pm. So we were gone for 11 1/2 hours, the hotel knew we were gone at 7:30am since they brought up our car, and yet was our room cleaned and serviced? You guessed it, no. I was too tired to deal with it, just wanted a shower so I started to take my shower. Then my daughter interrupts me to say that the maids were there (it is now 7:30PM) to clean the room. Needless to say I was not very happy about the whole thing - maid apologized for being there so late but it really didn't make things right for us. I spoke to the front desk about it the next morning when we were checking out, and I was told that they would tell the cleaning department that we didn't like having our room done so late. Really? Like there are guests that wouldn't mind that happening? Hotel was historic, beautiful, and gave my kids an experience that they hadn't had before. Just wish that it would have gone smoother.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Bryan L
Reviews.Content: Not only is the Adolphus beautiful decorated with museum quality artwort and beautiful wood paneling., the food is amazing, and the staff are beyond amazing. We had made a mistake on our reservations, but Mark and Aaron at the front desk worked hard to make sure we had a room and even up graded us to a beautiful comforatble suite. There was no snobbiness among the staff towards the clients, only a genuine willingness to make sure the stay was pleasant and rewarding. I've traveled all over the world. The Adolphus is the best I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “OK if you get a deal”
Reviews.Author: barbielab
Reviews.Content: Got this place on a weekend for $78 a night on Priceline. It made the $26 parking charge easier to take. It is an historical hotel, which was nice to look at but I thought the rooms were quite noisy. Two glasses of wine at the bar were $25. It has a good location in downtown Dallas but I would never pay the going rate to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Jayne_WM
Reviews.Content: This really is a beautiful hotel. Good location, rooms lovely, the French Restaurant was excellent - as good as any celebrity chef restaurant I have visited. Attentive staff in both the hotel and the restaurant - first class overall. My only criticism would be expensive parking and no complimentary breakfast (always a bonus). Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely lobby, Big room”
Reviews.Author: teacup610
Reviews.Content: We spent a night here while visiting my daughter who lives in Uptown a few miles away.The lobby is lovely and you can tell some effort goes into making this area an experience. Our room was on the fifth floor and we didn't have any trouble others have expressed with hot water etc. Our only complaints are the lack of view from our room and the fact that although we had booked and received a confirmation of a king size bed, it was only a queen. I was too tired to make an issue of the bed size since it was only for a night and my husband had already starting unpacking. We didn't care about a view, but it may be important to others. The room itself was very large,clean and comfortable. We had plenty of space to relax and move around without bumping into the bed like in other hotels.I would definitely go back when we visit again, just make sure when I get the keys I know what size bed it will be.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Bud56
Reviews.Content: What a really nice place! The hotel is beautiful. The woodwork is great. The service was unbelievable. They brought our luggage up and set them on on luggage racks for us. And hung up our jackets in the closet. That's what I call real service. It's within walking distance of everything that is downtown and restaurants. You have that feeling that you are right at home as soon as you walk in the front door. The rooms are really nice and a great shower with really soft towels. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “First time at the Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: boolbada
Reviews.Content: A short trip away from the big apple was made memorable by the Adolphus. Beautiful hotel, with old school European Style with a big difference--large rooms. Staff was attentive and friendly all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Monte B
Reviews.Content: This place is very old and I am sure has a great history but it is in need of some work. I had a standard room on the 5th floor with a view of puddle of water on an air conditioner unit and a wall from another building. My closet door was missing the left side. The water in the bathroom sink did not drain properly. I realize people stay at hotels for different reasons but my main purpose is almost always business and this hotel makes it difficult. The wireless internet is inadequate. The business center is a generic non-hotel owned, pay per use place that is not attended so after hours servicing is not available. The charge per fax page is $1.50 so I had to forego sending my usual 100 or so so pages that I send every week to a toll-free phone number. I am sure there are some amazing rooms with amazing view here so try not to settle for what I did. This place has a lot of character. The lobby is quite a sight. It is located very well and within a short cab or walking distance to some great places.

Reviews.Title: “top notch hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: ppgjenny
Reviews.Content: loved my stay at the adolphus. the staff was professional and friendly, very clean and elegant rooms. i would definately recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a special place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “BAD!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ben201
Reviews.Content: I would love to give this property a 5 star rating but I honestly can not.I have VERY fond memories of staying at this hotel when I was younger staying her with my mother!! I normally stay at the mansion on turtle creek but I was flying back late at night from a trip in NYC and needed a place to take a shower and sleep for several hours and did not want to spend $2000 on my normal suite at the mansion and could not beat the $100 a night rate at the adalphous!! What a mistake this hotel was a complete disappointment for the full 6 hrs I was there! NO HOT WATER was the biggest disappointment and the other was the way I was treated by the gentleman at the front desk! When I checked out he ask me how my stay was and I told him about the hot water(no hot water in my shower) problem and he just laughed and said "thatâ€™s funny most guests have been complaining about having nothing but hot water and no cold". I had just got back from a 4 night stay in the royal terrace Suite at the plaza in NYC which goes for $12k a night and might have inquired about the penthouse at the adalphous for the next time me and my girlfriend where in dallas if I was treated as a guest and not a customer renting a basic room at this property!! With all do respect to the wonderful history of this hotel if you are looking for luxury donâ€™t be fooled by this place book at the Ritz, four seasons or the Mansion or maybe even the palmor !!! I mean no disrespect to the historic property but as much as I want to love it and make it my home in Dallas it is lacking in quality and staff. I will always stick to the terrace suite at the Rosewood from now onâ€¦â€¦â€¦.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience and Value...”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBeef
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is a great hotel centrally located in downtown Dallas. The hotel entrance, lobby and public spaces are aesthetically beautiful and well-kept. The staff was very friendly and polite. The corridors and rooms could be updated to carry the same beauty as the entrance, lobby and public spaces. The only real complaint that I have is that the valet parking is $26-$30/ night; in addition, I also felt obligated to tip. I was there for 10 nights, so you could see how this adds to the overall cost of your stay. There are a couple public parking lots nearby that cost ~$8/ day, but too far to drag your luggage on the first and last night. For those that care, there is no swimming pool, jacuzzi or sauna. I was surprised that these emminities did not exisit in a hotel of this caliber.

Reviews.Title: “The lady is dying”
Reviews.Author: MarkoRamius555
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Adolphus for over 25 years and have always had a marvelous stay. This time was different. Shortage of hot water, limited towels, failure to be able to cool the room down were just a few of the problems. Rude desk clerk. The junior suite seemed seedy. The beautiful Adolphus is showing its age I guess as many of us are. Sad to see the grande dame of Dallas hotels dying. I will miss her.

Reviews.Title: “Just about perfect!”
Reviews.Author: G P
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is beautiful! Afternoon tea was wonderful! The highlight was definitely The French Room! The staff made us feel so special! I only have 2 complaints: 1. Room service - It is WAY too expensive for the quality. 2. French Room food - My risotto was undercooked and the halibut was not all that tasty. I would not recommend either. Every other food item was superb! Summary - Go to Afternoon Tea and The French Room

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Finky099
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night in early March 2012 while in town for business. It was quite affordable for the level of quality and location (like $159/night). Hotel lobby is beautiful and has the historic charm going for it. My room was quite sizable by today's standards and well appointed. DVD player, huge bed with comfortable pillows. The shower was a bit dated, but perfectly functional and clean. I was surprised to find a bidet in the bathroom too! I was on the 7th floor and it was quiet as a mouse. Staff was efficient & friendly, though the valet seemed a tad understaffed the evening/morning I was there. I would stay here again, especially for $159/night.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bengalkat
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel last minute and feel that we got a very good rate. We liked that it was an old hotel and was potentially haunted. We didn't get a room on the floor that had been noted as having 'activity'. The room we were in was nice and large and was tastefully decorated. The real only complaint we had for our room was that the beds were too soft for my husband and myself. I've had two back surgeries and need something much firmer than what these beds were. Other than that, we thought the room was great and the rest of the hotel was beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SW2202
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Adolphus was wonderful! From check-in to check-out the staff were welcoming and helpful, the decor of the hotel was beautiful, and the pianist tinkling the ivories of the grand piano in the foyer was enchanting! A stay with them is highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Treated like a King”
Reviews.Author: Edmund B
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is an outstanding experience. The staff is extraordinary. They strive to make you feel welcome and special. I attended a business meeting for two days. My room was a suite with plenty of room. The bed was most comfortable. The highlight of my stay was the meal which I had at the French Room. The srvice spectacular as well as the food. Each member of the wait staff was efficient and knowledgeable about the menu. The wine was also excellant. The French room is a destination dinning experience. Carlos was most engaging. He made you feel right at home. He was particularly sensitive to those of us who were dinning alone. I really appreciated the attention. Whenever I visit Dallas, the Adoplhus is my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Felt spoiled.”
Reviews.Author: FunFilledFamily
Reviews.Content: After spending our first night at a disappointing hotel, the Adolphus made up for that first night and more. For a girls weekend of moms, they spoiled us from valet to bringing our baggage to our executive suite which we didn't book but were upgraded to when they ran out of the deluxe double suite. What a treat for us girls! The hotel is historical and beautiful with old hotel charm.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Girls Night”
Reviews.Author: Bthompson88
Reviews.Content: First and foremost the service at this hotel is really amazing. Everyone offered to help us out and really went above and beyond. We were there for a girls night and had issues with our transportation and we had several people that helped to make our problems vanish. When our transportation didn't arrive on time we had enough cabs for 20 people in an instant. (on a rainy Saturday night at 8:30) Additionally, all of this service was able to be provided while there was a large wedding going on...they certainly do not skimp on the number of staff on hand. Check out on Sunday morning was slightly hectic but was to be expected on such a busy weekend and having many wedding guests checking out. We had the terrace suite (combination of three rooms)...while the decor is not completely updated it was VERY nice and the rooms were so spacious. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and I will be staying here again! Thanks for making what could have been a bad night turn out so well. My only wish was that the weather would have been nicer so we could have better enjoyed the HUGE outdoor space we were provided.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Orfindel
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 10th wedding anniversary at the Adolphus and ate dinner at the French Room. The hotel is amazing, and I believe celebrates its 100th this year! The lobby was amazing, beaming with charm and beauty. Our room was just as fabulous. HUGE, with top notch decor and beautiful upgraded amenities. Some on here have noted that the condition of the hotel was "run down". I disagree. The hotel is 100 years old and has stayed true to its history. If your looking for a modern, sleek, hotel with limited personality look elsewhere. The Adolphus is anything but! I celebrate the hotels richness, charm, beauty, and history! The hotel staff was attentive and personable. We even received a personal note from the manager welcoming us to the hotel and wishing us a happy anniversary! The French Room was just as spectacular. Yes, Pricey but it was our anniversary and the food was worth every penny!! The staff were amazing and attentive. I cannot say enough positive things about this hotel and its staff! I live within the Dallas vicinity and I would rate the Adolphus as the BEST hotel in Dallas. It will not dissapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Surely, the Experience you Really should give to yourself.”
Reviews.Author: Natchez6
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here only once before, perhaps a year and a half ago, and was blown away then on so many levels, of antique treasures amid the most elegant of traditions; a propriety of things far removed from our time. After checkout on that visit, I was left with a warm and lingering delight of having richly enjoyed such a truly Grand Hotel. When I arrived last Saturday, the same Doorman who was on duty on my previous stay looked me straight in the eye and said "Welcome Back." Then he asked me if I was going to need a cab to the Meyerson Symphony Hall later, even though that was on my last visit over a year and a half ago... The Adolphus is a rare example of a Great Hotel where service being executed so Masterfully, on such a pinnacle level isn't noticed because it is so fine. If you haven't yet made it to the Homestead, or the Greenbrier, or the Williamsburg Inn, then this is as close as it comes from decor, to unparalleled dining, to the quiet and seamless execution of hospitality, and most of all, to the awareness that you've enjoyed the very edge of all that First Class genuinely means. It's the reason you forget the other Hotel Loyalty programs you're enrolled in as their double points or whatever else they promise cannot touch the richness and depth of a stay at the Adolphus and the subtle rejuvenating elements that seem to stay with you long after you've left and whisper to you that you deserved this. On this visit, I had a Junior Suite exactly like the one I had last time. Very spacious, gorgeous sitting area with tables and chairs, and above all that, it's soooo quiet. I took a couple of friends to dinner in the French Room, which is a culinary delight with a divinely welcoming feeling despite the stunning decor and five star rating. Excellent beyond my realm of praise and not to be missed. And the BEST part of this is that IT WAS AFFORDABLE!!!! For all that I got to experience, a Junior Suite, a couple of drinks, and dinner for three at The French Room was about $440.00 including tips and cocktails. The one thing I missed were the Pillows from my previous stay. They were white, and had red embroidered borders and the stylized "A" logo in the center. I know the hotel has been sold and repurchased since then, and I hope the new owners restore this feature as it lets the guest know "Yes, you're really at the Adolphus." I regard this as a great value, because in every way, it was a Great Experience that I will surely repeat. I am so glad I made the decision to think for myself when choosing this instead of being persuaded by another loyalty program. It's the experience you really should give to yourself. And it's probably the one you've been secretly wanting for a long time, so go do it.

Reviews.Title: “Classy historic hotel.”
Reviews.Author: N C
Reviews.Content: Every room i ever stayed in had a different layout and it was always interesting to see what I'd get. Some rooms were bigger than others, but always well furnished and comfortable. 5 star service always, and on par with other upscale hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SarahP44881
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The room was HUGE, with a large bedroom area, large living area and big bath. Everything was first class. If you want to dine at the French Room, there is strict dress code--no jeans, no tennis shoes and jacket. I would absolutely stay there again. They have a limo service which takes you within a certain radius until 8 pm. We used the car to take us and pick us up. Nice service.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Adolphus. It is one of our favorite places to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Rwade1950
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms and lobby is one of our favorite places on earth to relax. The old world flavor of the lobby and even the elevators is great. We will make the trip again any time we can find time away from our scheduls. Thank you for your hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: slysu
Reviews.Content: The overall experience was wonderful! The staff and atmosphere are superb!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I had expected from a 4 star!”
Reviews.Author: golf4u33
Reviews.Content: The interior of the lobby was definitely beautiful with period pieces and early American elegance. Unfortunately, once we got past the lobby, things went downhill. Our room was a bit "dumpy" and although I can appreciate the historical architecture and furnishings, it had a very old (out of date) feel. On the positive side, our room was large. On the negative side, the bathroom could only accommodate one body(person) at a time. The real deal breakers for us though were: 1) We could not get ANY cold water during our visit. Our showers were scalding and uncomfortable. Brushing our teeth with hot water was not pleasant. We notified the desk and they said they would take care of it but never did. We had to wonder if they were having some major plumbing problems. 2) During our two night stay, our room was never attended to or towels changed. After being out since eight in the morning, we returned to rest from 3-6 before dinner. Housekeepeing knocked on the door about 4:00 and when I told her we would be out by 6:00 she said she would return then but no one did. I know the Adolphus has great historical significance but I don't think you can excuse the comforts associated with a four star rating because of its history. Probably will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Adolphus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ClaudiaAnderson
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus Hotel is our favorite hotel ever. Though we live in the Dallas area, we go there often for weekend getaways. It cannot be beat for service, style, old world luxury and friendliness of the staff. Dining in The French Room is a must, also. You will LOVE this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “My FAVORITE of all”
Reviews.Author: Chicoklanta
Reviews.Content: Having traveled to Dallas regularly for the past decade, I claim the Adolphus as my favorite hotel in the USA. It's like staying at a rich aunt's estate! The rooms are quiet and plush with a privacy factor not to be equaled for the price---go for the Junior Suite. The dining is superb. Everyone raves about the five diamond AAA award for the French Room, and you can drift through the lavish lounge during high tea with the aplomb of a British Duke. But be aware, there are also other less sumptuous offerings for the budget-conscious people like me. I love the location, near coffee shops and numerous al fresco eatery offerings. Did I mention the artwork? The Adolphus lobby is like a wing at the Dallas art museum. But what has made me a declared member of the Adolphus family are the people who work there (Shawnta in reservations remembers me after umpteen years!). This is often what makes or breaks a hotel, and the Adolphus never rests on the laurels of its accommodations, it employs top-notch people. Get to know them. Whether for business or a memorable romantic weekend, you cannot do any better in Dallas than the Adolphus! Hey, remember what I said about a Jr. Suite...do it!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Hillbrook11
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to stay at the historic Adolphus in Dallas, so when an opportunity presented itself, I jumped on it. The lobby is beautiful, elegant, and comfy. The Lobby bar is fantastic serving wonderful drinks in a beautiful setting. There was a long line at check in, but once you got to the head of the line, it went quickly. When we got to our room, a King Suite on the 17th floor, I was very excited. The room was very large and the bed was nice. Unfortunately there were some mystery stains on one of the parlor chairs, the air conditioning was not working properly, the room was not completely clean and about a third of the light bulbs were burnt out. We decided to make the best of it, since we were only staying two nights. The next morning we left our room at 9 am and returned at 3 pm. The room had not been made up. We called and they sent someone right away. But still it should have been cleaned by 3 pm. One thing that was consistently great was the food. Room Service breakfast was wonderful and plentiful. The French Room was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Great, classic hotel with world-class French Room restaurant”
Reviews.Author: BooVoyage
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is a wonderful, old-school classic hotel in downtown Dallas. The service is friendly and efficient. I stay in what I think are called junior suites, which are huge and well-appointed. The room prices are very reasonable. The French Room restaurant is a delight -- as good as any restaurant I've enjoyed in any city, including my hometown of San Francisco. I had what may have been the best steak of my life -- as tender as butter owing to a masterful sous vide preparation, and deliciously flavorful. The crab cake was divine. The service, particuarly waiter Carlos, was superb. The muraled ceiling is beautiful. If you eat there Sunday through Thursday, the meal is $55 per person ("5 Diamonds for $55") for three-courses, which is less than half of what such a meal would reasonably cost in San Francisco or New York. The room service breakfast is very good, too.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, in the best sense of the word”
Reviews.Author: TravelRobertG
Reviews.Content: My wife and I live in a Dallas exurb and we often spend the weekend in the city. Our usual MO is to priceline a 4 star room for $80-90. We usually get the Adolphus or the Dallas Hyatt. We were fortunate to again get a great deal on the Adolphus this weekend. Now for the review. Service- In a word, excellent. From the valet, to the check in, room service, bartenders, everyone is kind and attentive. I've stayed all over the US and Mexico and the Adolphus has a great staff. Decor- The Adolphus is stately. Nothing modern here, and that's the way it should be. If you the Joule or the W stay there. This hotel was built in a different era, and it exudes luxury of a bygone era. Rooms- The rooms always have big closets, the beds are not the best, but not bad. Each room has an huge window that can't be opened, something about the city's smoking ban. It's criminal to not be able to open up these windows. Food/Beverages- The French Room is not to be missed. We've only eaten there once, and it was amazing. Very pricey though, but worth it. There is a peanuts on the floor honky tonk bar that we always end up at. Again, great service and a good mix of hotel patrons and random downtowners. Fun place to people watch. The Bistro is ok, we've only had breakfast there once and it was allright.

Reviews.Title: “Short stay at the Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: islandview412
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful! We went shortly before Christmas 2010 and it was all decked out in Traditional Christmas decorations. The Traditional decor will disk you away to eras of days gone by. The rick woodwork and fine architectural detail is amazing considering the age of the hotel. Right downtown near some great shopping at Neiman Marcus. Also a short cab ride to uptown convention area. We decided to go to dallas just for a weekend getaway. The hotel was well maintained and the service was very attentive. The rooms were very large and well appointed. We ordered room service for breakfast and while it did not take very long, my husband was able to walk from the room down through the lobby exit the door fairest from the lobby and got a starbucks. He was back with in 10 minutes and perfect timing to receive the breakfast at the door in another 10. This hotel is English in most every thing they do. You can even have afternoon formal Tea if you make a reservation. We did not do this but saw some people having theirs. Looked like something I would like to try at some point. Like I said, Almost everything is very English right down to the photo of the queen of England and her Husband Prince Phillip. (I Think). Basically stating that the Hotel is fit for Royalty, As they stayed there on a visit to the state. However, Make sure you make a reservation and bring your credit cards or a wad of cash to there FRENCH restaurant. Excellent and hands down well worth the money. Food and service were incomparable to anything I have dined at in a very long time if ever. The room is really beautiful. Save room for dessert! While we were staying here we went downtown to the W and watch a wedding party in the lobby, while having drinks on the patio. Ultra contemporary compared to the Adolpus. We took Segways to see the sights like old town and where JFK was shot. The best think we did was to take a cab (I think it cost about $10-12) to the Dallas Arboretum. We spent about 2 hours there and had lunch before going back to the hotel. Nicely layer out and beautiful to see. Well worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: teacher050
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a three-night stay at the Adolphus. The hotel is undeniably special, with many beautiful spaces to see and enjoy. The lobby is truly gorgeous, with its dark paneling and attractive sitting areas. Like other reviewers have noted, one is transported to another, more genteel, era just by walking through the lobby. My disappointment came not from the ambiance of the hotel, but from the positively dreadful service I encountered on every front. My room, a king suite, was dirty. Not filthy, but just dirty and in need of the special attention one expects from a hotel of this caliber. The wallpaper was dingy, there were worn spots on the chair at the desk, the vents were dusty, there was dust trapped between the wood and the glass of the coffee table, and the sheets on the bed had small holes. Nothing seemed polished or shined. Admittedly, these are small things and did not detract from the comfort of my stay. They were the first things I noticed, however, and these things matter. I returned on the second day of my stay at 5:30 p.m. to find that the room was still unmade. The towels from my morning shower were still on the floor where I had left them nearly 11 hours earlier, the bed remained unmade, and the curtains still drawn. I had to phone housekeeping and ask someone to come up and clean my room. I found this unacceptable. On the third night, I called the front desk/hotel operator six times between 10:30 and 11:15 p.m. to arrange a wake up call. On each attempt, the phone rang and rang and rang. Once I was connected to someone in the garage after 20 or so rings; on another, I found myself speaking with someone from security. At no point did anyone at the front desk answer. When I checked out the following morning at 5:40 a.m., no one was at the front desk. I waited and waited, and after perhaps 5 minutes someone emerged from a back room. I worked for many years in hospitality and I understand that things don't always go smoothly in the hotel business. But for a hotel with the reputation of the Adolphus, these are important details that should not be overlooked.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice historical hotel, excellent restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: rdklomp
Reviews.Content: The French Room is absolutely fantastic and is a must. Stayed here for a weeklong work meeting and everything was first rate. The rooms are a little older but still very nice with a nice view from higher floors. Beds are not as comfortable as I prefer but still adequate. The food here has been excellent and I've eaten breakfast, lunch, and dinner here for 4 days. Granted, all meals were buffet style and set up ahead of time but very impressed. We ventured one block over to Dallas Fish Market and also had an excellent meal.

Reviews.Title: “A trip back to more elegant time”
Reviews.Author: George M
Reviews.Content: When you first arrive in the Lobby, stop, stand back and take a breath, take in the moment, observe the detail throughout the Lobby. You can relive past days of a more elegant time in our history and then ponder the grandeur of it all. The staff was very professional and gracious. The room was much larger than I expected. The Lobby Bar with the Jazz Duo on a Saturday evening was very enjoyable, sitting there taking it all in was a great way to unwind from a very stressful week. I highly recommend the Adolphus to anyone. Our only regret was not making reservations for the French Room - everyone appeared to be raving fan!

Reviews.Title: “Class Act for Grown Ups”
Reviews.Author: Cap_Hill_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Leave the flip flops in your suitcase and channel your inner elite. This 1912 hotel reminds us that we're supposed to aspire to something during our lives. Our room was large and comfortable, but the real action was in the paneled lobby where potted palms and antiques ruled. A cool jazz ensemble welcomed us back after a night at the theater, and on Sunday morning we chose a quick breakfast from the lobby bar over a full breakfast in the Bistro. Did I mention the award-winning 5-star French Room? I can't wait to return and to spend more time strolling in the center of Dallas. Neiman-Marcus awaits!

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite in-town getaway spot”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne C
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have gone twice to the Adolphus for in-town getaways, and we were able to get great room rates both times. Last year we did their afternoon tea, which was fabulous! We didn't do the tea on this latest stay...I would have liked to, but though he really liked the food, the tea, and the ambience, the refinement of it all was something hubby appreciated experiencing once but didn't feel a need to repeat. In any case, we love the old charm feel of the hotel, and the service has been superb, for the most part. Our room-service breakfast order card was not collected overnight, so we had to call our order in once we discovered the card still hanging from the doorknob in the morning, but that's the worst thing we can say, and they delivered our breakfast very quickly. The junior suite is spacious, with a very roomy bathroom and soft towels (a big plus for me!), and the bed is very comfortable. We love that wifi is complimentary and that there's a refrigerator in the room. We'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “100 years old and charming!”
Reviews.Author: Mike525
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of fancy hotels before, but there is something special about the Adolphus. At 100 years old it has all of the charm of an old European hotel and all of the modern comforts of a mega-chain 5-star. The staff were all super helpful. Only complaints were that the elevators were a bit small (or charming) and slow, and the TV system had so many options I couldn't figure out how to just watch "regular" TV. But with complimentary WiFi, I had all the entertainment and productivity that I needed!

Reviews.Title: “good but was expecting more”
Reviews.Author: thibaut a
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Adolphus while on business in Dallas. the hotel is an iconic one in the city and you can feel it when you arrive. The elevator with the original wood interior are beautiful, the lobby is very nice. My travel advisor found me a very good rate for the hotel and all together it was an exceptional value. I was just expecting a little more in term of decoration (the corridor are large and feel empty in my opinion). My suite was very large, but the bathroom very small in comparison. The service was exceptional

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is great, the staff is incredible”
Reviews.Author: Steven T
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel but what really makes it special is the great staff. Everyone we worked with was courteous and professional - always had a smile. Rooms are well done and I love the fact that they had plenty of outlets to charge all of my gadgets. Great WIFI and work space too. Location wise, it's a half a block to 7-11 if you need something quick and surrounded by great restaurants within walking distance. The Rodeo bar is a casual (throw the peanut shells on the floor kind of place), low key bar where you can just hang out with co-workers as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Ellen F
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely and the staff were very helpful. This historic property was very upscale and the decorations and accommodations were right on point. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure "it is in writing"”
Reviews.Author: IrisL59
Reviews.Content: When we checked in late on a Friday evening to join our relatives staying there for a wedding, we were told by the clerk who handled our check in,that our room rate was going to be reduced by $30 a night. The reason for this was that our cousin had been "upgraded" to the room next to ours and therefore our room rate was going to be adjusted. We could not check out in our room, so we went to the desk, and because a car was waiting for us to go to the airport, we just took the statement without looking it over. When we got home we noticed that the rate was not reduced as advised. Our 3 calls and 2 emails went unanswered and we disputed the difference with our credit card company. However, the hotel will not stand behind this as the clerk did not put anything in writing. So anything you are promised by this hotel, should be in writing!! They do not honor their word.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Business Meetings”
Reviews.Author: Jeff G
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is located near the center of Dallas in an area with a wide range of activities. The hotel has the charm and history of being near a century old, but with all of the modern amenities in the hotel rooms, exercise facilities and meeting rooms one might expect. The staff anticipated nearly every need and with minimal, if any interference. The food quality, preparation and presentations during our two days of meetings were impressive, healthful and very tasty. One of the best hotels around at extremely competitive rates. A must stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: travelinglibrarian70
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Adolphus was a very pleasant one. Easy check-in. Polite staff. Beautiful lobby, steeped in history. The car service is a wonderful amenity. Easy walking distance to many sites and restaurants as well as the convention center. I can't say enough good things about my experience there.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Dallas treasure”
Reviews.Author: travelersfromaust
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adolphus for 4 days. Every aspect of my stay was nothing short of ideal. Staff from check in to check out were helpful and courteous. It is a beautiful hotel in a great location. I can highly recommend the French Room restaurant which equaled my best Paris or NY dining experiences. I was on a discounted internet site rate and to some limited extent this made my stay even more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: 56797Dutchman13
Reviews.Content: Steeped in History (The Adolphus is celebrating its 100th birthday right now) you get that feeling immediately as you enter the beuatiful hotel. With all of its amenities everywhere, as well as the happy, friendly, helpful people welcoming you, you are truly glad you're here. Everything here is done for your comfort, your enjoyment and your return time after time. Don't be surprised if on subsequent visits some of these same peoplle will remember you by name!! In the numerous visits, we have never had a bad room, or anything that did not work the way it is supposed to. We have returned and will continue to return as often as we can and enjoy the graciousness of 'High Tea', or the sumptuous atmosphere of the beautiful 'French Room' The Adolphus is a treasure we enjoy as often as possible and can unreservedly recommend tto anyone who visits Dallas

Reviews.Title: “Room Was Burglarized During Stay”
Reviews.Author: Tracy P
Reviews.Content: I would like to be able to say wonderful things about this hotel, but I can't. We arrived at the hotel in February of 2011. It has taken me so long to write a review because it was an experience that I would rather forget. We are returning to Dallas this month for an event that we attend every year and I will never stay at this hotel again. Things started off with an inordinately long wait in line to check in. After 30 minutes, we finally approached the front desk and were pleasantly surprised by an offer to upgrade to a suite. Great service, I thought. After taking the very small elevator to our room, we unpacked and decided to go out to dinner. We used the car service to get to the restaurant, which was fine. Upon return to the hotel, we approached our room only to find the door frame in splinters. Our room had been burglarized. I can't tell you how afraid we were. We called the front desk to report it and were told that security would be on their way up. We also called the police. After waiting for about 15 minutes, a security person arrived, but did not seem to know what to do. We asked him if the hotel had any type of surveillance system, and we were told that it did not. A short time later, the police arrived, as did the hotel night manager. The police inventoried the losses in our room and provided us with a police file number. The police wanted to canvas other hotel guests to see if anyone heard anything unusual, BUT THE MANAGER ASKED THEM NOT TO SINCE HE DID NOT WANT TO ALARM THE OTHER GUESTS. Which said to me that he was not concerned about our experience at all. He told us that the hotel was sold out but that he could "probably find us a room in the hotel, but it would definitely not be a suite." It was very clear to us that we were not wanted in the hotel. He offered to relocate us to another hotel, which we gladly accepted. When we arrived at the other hotel, there were problems during check-in. Apparently the manager failed to provide the new hotel with information about our party. The hotel was unable to reach the manager at the Adolphus. I called from my cell phone, and was told that the manager had left for the evening. After a very short conversation with another Adolphus hotel employee, we were able to check in to the hotel. In short, my experience at this hotel was horrible, and was compounded by the way it was handled by hotel management. No apology was ever offered, and I felt like they were more interested in containing what happened to us that addressing our frightening experience.

Reviews.Title: “OverRATED!!!!”
Reviews.Author: gingii
Reviews.Content: I was very excited for our stay with this hotel. Based on all of the reviews that I had read about the hotel and the French Room restaurant I assumed that our stay would be excellent. Sadly my experience with the Adolphus was very disappointing. The hotel was advertised as a four star luxury hotel but in reality it felt more like a typical stay at a Holiday Inn. While the hotel staff were exceptional my experiences with the accounting staff, to get a single receipt for my expense report, was frustrating and upsetting. The hotel itself was rather nice although it felt dusty and all of the floors could have used vacuuming. Our double room was of a nice size but the beds were somewhat uncomfortable and we could hear buses as they past our room (even though we were on the 8th floor). It should also be noted that housekeeping didn't arrive until 5:45pm, just as we were returning from a long day. Seriously? I never heard of housekeeping not getting to a room by 4 or 5 at the latest. To be fair, my companions greatly enjoyed the Adolphus and they would surely rave about it but personally when I stay at a 4 star hotel I expect 4 star service and ambiance. The Hotel Adolphus did not deliver on their "4 Stars".

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: crampjd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night and had a wonderful experience. Staff was great, very clean and lots of history. Would highly recommend at least one night stay here. Plenty of local bars and restaurants within walking distance. Great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay EVER”
Reviews.Author: Suzyjenn620
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for business. I have stayed in nice hotels... and some not so nice hotels. In all of my travels, I have NEVER stayed in a nicer hotel than The Adolphus Hotel in Dallas, TX. The Adolphus was one of our conference hotels. It exceeded my expectations. The rooms were spacious ... the closet alone was larger than some hotels I've stayed in. The rooms were immaculate and tidied up in a timely manner despite the large convention in town. One of the perks was a driver and car within a 3 mile radius of the hotel. This was a wonderful perk and Dave and Tammy the drivers were absolutely the best -- kind, courteous, prompt and helpful. Paul and Anibal in the concierge area were the best. Perfectly located to downtown shopping (Nieman Marcus) and dining, the Adolphus was truly a wonderful place to retreat after a long long day of conferencing. It will be my hotel of choice if it happens to be a conference hotel in the future! Thank you do all you do!

Reviews.Title: “Simply Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: ejs22
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at this wonderful establishment from aTuesday afternoon until a Thursday morning. Believe me, it was hard to leave this wonderful hotel. Gracious service along with an incredible lobby and public spaces, this is a real find! The restaurant was just amazing! Everything was just perfect without pretention. Genuine southern hospitality! Can't wait to return this spring!

Reviews.Title: “My Dallas Market Retreat!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey S
Reviews.Content: The Adophus Hotel is a beautiful downtown hotel that I recommend to every traveller. The hotel has so much character that in the evenings I would sit in the lobby to take in its beauty. The staff were also a pleasure. Phillip, the gentleman at the entrance of the hotel, is the first person you meet to begin your fantastic stay. I must say that Phillip and I became friends and he made my stay fantastic. From knowing all the great restaurants in the area to taking care of my travel needs, he is definitely an asset to the hotel. Thank you Phillip! I must also mention Paul, the concierge, was fun to talk with and also so very helpful with all my questions. For me to come away from the hotel and know your staff says something about the quality of your hotel and the staff. Again, thank you for everything and I look forward to my next stay with you for the upcoming Market! Warmest regards, Tracey Sneesby

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: Lazesusan
Reviews.Content: This was truly an experience that personified the "exceeding expectations" for a hotel stay. I stay in a variety of hotels for work and pleasure during the year and this hotel stands out in all the best ways. April checked me in, provided me with excellent information and checked me out, remembering me and always making me feel special. The hotel is unique, has a great location and interesting dining choices. I went back to the rodeo grill twice. Thanks to all the staff for their hard work.

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus during a conference”
Reviews.Author: jbstew44
Reviews.Content: Over the years since 1972 I have stayed at the Adolphus a number of times. I like it very much but this time the experience was a bit different. While it was during a conference the things I will not were unusual for the property. Housekeeping was a hit an miss propositon. One day the glasses would not be clean, the next day there would be no bath mat left. And so it went. Several hotel venues are on a more restricted schedule. We could not host a small gathering for cocktails because the lobby bar is closed on Sundays and Mondays. The tea service in the lobby is on a restricted schedule as well. I inquired at the concierge desk about a local restaurant and got directions. When I asked if the restaurant was open on Monday for lunch the concierge without calling assured me it was. After a twenty minute drive we arrived to a restaurant that was closed on Mondays. I will continue to stay at the hotel as I have for many years, but visitors should be aware of current conditions. Also there is a great alternative for parking at Dalpark, just up Commerce street.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: alangt19
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for two nights while on a recent business trip. Our experience was fantastic . A class act in a world where there are few class acts left!

Reviews.Title: “Ultimate Comfort in Historical Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TigerHeart25
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel! Our room was HUGE - so comfortable and quaint. It is within walking distance from the Dallas Convention Center. We did have to go down some stairs in the hall to get to our upper floor room, but not a problem. Would definite stay there again if we get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “the Adolphus has seen better days”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a Worldhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: My room at the Adolphus contained a cracked mirror, poorly placed clothes closet in the bathroom and a couple very old lamps which hardly worked, a very old phone and alarm clock which I couldn't get working. The hotel had definitely seen better days. When going out for business I left the key to the minibar over the minibar and when I returned an empty beer was in the middle of the room which I mistakenly kicked. I called the operator and while she said I wouldn't be charged there was little sympathy, especially when I raised the spectre of security concerns. As I'm a male, this wasn't overly a concern so I simply told her that I wouldn't like to be charged. I ate breakfast in the Bistro and while the food was okay, it was very expensive and the decor again was not up to snuff or comparable to the French Room or the rest of the hotel. The Adolphus definitely could use a brand revitalization or say lessons from the Ritz in Customer Service to bring it back up - management, please, pay attention to what is happening to this jewel and the customer experienc. I purposefully did not even touch the minibar drinks as a diet Pepsi was listed at 3.50 which I thought was a bit steep. I had gotten a good rate for the Adolphus at 160.00/night, a big discount but even so this was definitely not an experience for this kind of supposedly upscale hotel, especially as I saw from the lobby previously in the 80's the Queen of England and Duke of Edinburgh had stayed there. If you're even paying a dollar more than 100.00 , I'd say no, probably about 65.00 would have been fair for the location if someone hadn't drank the beer from the minibar and not left it in the middle of the room when I returned from my conference that day.

Reviews.Title: “Old money hotel in downtown D”
Reviews.Author: EnergyManager
Reviews.Content: Great location and a wonderful lobby. I feel like I am an oilman from the 70s. You can tell this historic hotel has some great stories. The service was top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, but strange housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: MarvinMeister
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus was a very nice hotel with an excellent staff who were very friendly and helpful. Wifi was excellent, and not being charged for it like some of the larger chains tend to do was a bonus. The location was perfect We attended a conference at the convention center, and it was easily walkable. There are several nice restaurants, less expensive chains, and a couple of convenience stores within walking distance as well. The room had a lot of charm. The furniture was definitely of a different period , but I thought it appropriate for the age of the hotel, although there was a very nice new flat screen tv. The room and bathroom were very large. The bed was very comfortable, and the room was quiet. I only had a couple of issues with the actual accomodation: 1) the glazing on the tub was peeling by the drain, and 2) the low fan setting did not work. So, I guess I'm not the only one to post about the unusual towel situation. Check-in day the room was supplied with the traditional 2 large towels, 2 hand towels, and 2 wash clothes. The next day we received 2 large towels, 1 hand towel, and 1 wash cloth, so I had to call for extra towels. Day 3 we received 2 large towels, 2 hand towels, and 1 wash cloth. I saw the maid service in the hall and asked for a wash cloth and hand towel. She was out of them on her cart. She wasn't done cleaning the other rooms, so I can only assume that no one else was going to receive wash clothes or hand towels. Just a little weird.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice, Could use some updating”
Reviews.Author: USMuseFan
Reviews.Content: I love the size of the room. The bed was extremely comfortable. The service was stellar. I arrived after a long road trip at 1:30am and the valet wasted no time getting to my car to park it. Quick check in. I was impressed by the style of the hotel. It definitely feels nice and clean. My only bad thing to say is that the bathroom toilet and flooring were a bit dated. Not too much negative huh? I have another convention in Dallas coming up and will most likely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice, service not up to par”
Reviews.Author: NikiB5
Reviews.Content: After seeing all the problems with towels and unclean rooms, i'm happy to say that wasn't my experience, although two small towels and one hand towel is not sufficient for any room. I never saw a hotel so stingy with towels. Check in was supposed to be at 3pm. I arrived at 4:30 and was told my room wasn't ready and there were two people ahead of me. I told the front desk I had a dinner to go to at 6pm. It's really unacceptable to travel all day and not be able to change and freshen up. I put my suitcases in storage and met my group for dinner. I arrived back around 9pm. My room was ready. It wasn't the room she told me I was going to get which makes me wonder: if she changed my room, why couldn't she change it before and let me in it? I only stayed two nights and have no other complaints except for the front desk. I never experienced such lack of warmth and helpfulness from a front desk. Other than that, the other staff outside were great.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Beauty”
Reviews.Author: Patrick S
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this hotel, staff, amenities and most of all the French Room. Living in Dallas I don't have a need to stay in a hotel, however, with just the two of us we do enjoy an occasional stay here which is typically around Christmas Eve. Rooms are great, comfortable beds and beautiful furnishings. This is a very historic hotel and has one of the finest restaurants I believe in Dallas. A great place to stay and enjoy an evening out, cocktails in the bar and exquisite French Room dining!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel with lovely service.”
Reviews.Author: packardgirl51
Reviews.Content: The rooms at the Adolphus are large, with a closet the size of another room attached. Service is prompt and friendly, especially from Paul (who looks more than a little like Elvis) and Dave, the driver. The wifi is good, too, which is a small detail that many hotels overlook. Even with two people in the room on iPads and smartphones (and a hotel full of other business travelers) there was plenty of speed. The Adolphus is conveniently located downtown near dozens of restaurants, the flagship Niemans, and just about anywhere else you might want to go. Room was clean, beds were comfortable, requests were answered promptly and courteously... Definitely a hotel I would recommend to others visiting Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty old place”
Reviews.Author: awdub
Reviews.Content: It's a nice place, but it does have its glitches. I laughed when I saw the other reviews talking about towels - how difficult can it be to get enough towels to go around? Our room also had just one bath towel and one washcloth, and when I called for more towels, housekeeping asked what we had in the room, then brought precisely one more bath towel and one hand towel. Other minor quibbles: the rooms are desperately in need of an updating, and I don't mean that what is there is a bit old-fashioned in style. I mean that the furniture that was there was pretty beat up, with chipped finishes and crooked doors. The valet desk also took a long time - but while you wait for your cars, be sure to check out the insane elevator system that the valets use - it is amazing!! Now, quibbles aside, it is a very pretty landmark building in a nice location, the room was a decent size with a very comfortable bed for a good price, check-in and out was fine, and all of the staff was very friendly. I'd stay here again, but I do hope they invest in a few more towels.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PA_Razorback
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Amex Platinum Fine Hotels and Resort program. It did not live up to their normal standards. This is my second visit and my last. We could not get towels, toilet paper etc. Just unacceptable for a fine hotel...you get towels at the Super 8 Motel. It's unfortunate because the hotel has such potential, must be poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous experience”
Reviews.Author: assunda
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, comfortable rooms (best beds I've ever slept on), and really nice staff. This is where I stay when I visit Dallas, usually once or twice a year. This time around was for pleasure, but I do stay here for business as well. The conferences I attend are at other hotels that cost twice as much, but have half the charm and comfort. Cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus: Still making memories”
Reviews.Author: Alethea S
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is beautiful, elegant and historical. It is a piece of old Dallas history but it still takes the time to help make memories for their guests today! My fiancee surprised me with an evening at the Adolphus on Dec 23rd to kick off our holidays. We were warmly greeted upon arrival and entered into a gorgeous Christmas scene. I was shocked when the very pleasant young lady who checked us in told us our luxury suite was ready, but that was just the start of the surprises! The room(s) were amazing! Well appointed, comfortable and elegantly furnished with a skyline view and just the right mixture of modern and historic. I felt like we were transformed from suburbinites to posh penthouse dwellers, if only for the night! The best part had to be the amazing 400 sf outdoor terrace amongst the city skyscrapers! This is where the love of my life proposed to me that night and the Adolphus made it happen. When my fiancee booked the room they asked him if this was for a special occassion and when he told them his intentions they upgraded him into the amazing honeymoon suite on the 12th floor for no additional charge. :) You know they have a couple who will return anniversary after anniversary to this piece of Dallas history who has become a part of our history too!

Reviews.Title: “Great, grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly M
Reviews.Content: This is by far my favorite hotel in the Dallas area. For the service and amenities received, the value can not be beat. We adore bed and breakfasts, and really dislike big, generic hotels. This hotel feels like a wonderful, large B&B more than a hotel...it just has far more amenities. Rooms are large, linens, towels, toiletries, and facilities are all nice. The dining simply can not be beat. The French Room is second to none and their Bistro for breakfast and casual dining is spot on. We are coffee snobs, and their coffee is wonderful!!! Only complaints: poor (insufficient) lighting in rooms and especially in the bathrooms. Mattresses are hit and miss...one stay we will have one that is fine and the next visit we will have one that is terrible. Service is wonderful and they really do try to think of everything and assist however they can. Nothing in the Dallas area comes close in terms of character and beauty at this price!

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus Housekeeping a weak link”
Reviews.Author: Van H
Reviews.Content: This is a nice grand old hotel, with much elegance, but seems to deteriorating with time in its service. This is my fourth year staying here, but will probably be the last. The Housekeeping staff did not supply towels the second day due to a dryer issue, but I had to go to the front desk at 11:00 p.m. to get some rather than them delivering to my room after two calls to the staff number. The third day, they totally forgot to clean and service our room, again requiring calling someone after 6:00 p.m. to get service. The business office charges you to use the computer to print boarding passes. While only $3.44 (time and number of pages to print), that is not good service. The front desk did not have change for tips, and check-in was slow. Although I only parked a car for one night (from 11:00 p.m. until 9:00 a.m.), I was charged $24 per day for two calendar days. The food in the restaurant was very good, but the tables were not very clean. It is a shame to see such a "grand ole lady" of a hotel go downhill as this one has.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Adolphus Better than Ever”
Reviews.Author: Mark S
Reviews.Content: I've always loved this hotel, but it had been at least five years since I had stayed in downtown Dallas. After booking my room at a price substantially less than some of the other rates being charged by other downtown hotels, I was worried about whether the hotel had become long in the tooth. But, instead, I found the service to be excellent (as always) and, even better, that my room was super nice, very comfortable, very clean and well furnished with good linens, towels, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Old Style Charm”
Reviews.Author: lyoto
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a classic style to it. You won't feel like you are in luxury, but rather in a older hotel with alot of charm that the staff clearly cares about. Every staff member we dealt with was excellent (except the valet parking was slow, but after talking to the GM I found out that the service was outsourced). The rooms were large and the kind bed very comfy. It is in a great location for walking around with many sightseeing and great restaurants in the immediate area. Take advantage of their reciprocity deal with the health club down the street since that was awesome too.

Reviews.Title: “adolphus stay”
Reviews.Author: rivermom1
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a two night stay at the Adolphus. My husband and I have not stayed here before even though we have greatly enjoyed dinning at the French Room there. (It IS absolutely wonderful.) Based on our dining experience , we were expecting the same level of experience at the hotel. (He was at a meeting and I came to play!) Big surprise-not! The is one of the "grand old hotels" downtown so we thought it would be fun to step back to that decor, etc. It is lovely inside but that is where it stops. We had drinks at the French Room bar (NOT in the actual restaurant) and while it is pretty, the tables continued to be covered with dirty dishes the whole hour we were there. There was one server and he never came to our side of the room. My husband had to go to the bar, get the drinks, clear our table of drink glasses and then return to the bar to sign the check. Our two drinks were $25. Wine and martini. One would think that we could have had a little service sometime in the hour. The same occurred the next night. Guess we were hopeful that the previous night was just unusual but not! Ditto this night too. When we came in to check in there was only an empty reception desk-it was about 6pm. We waited, wondering if we were in the right place. Finally we were going up on escalator to find check in when a young woman came out from the back and asked if she could help us. Well duh. We are standing there with bags and looking confused. She did the minimal amount of talking, never welcomed us, never said a thing about sorry she wasn't at reception and did not tell us where to go next which was up the escalator and to the elevators to get to the room. Our room was large (had a suite) and bathroom was nice. However, several of the light bulbs were burned out and the phone by the bed did not work. (They came but were never able to get it going.) We used the one on the desk. Did not replace bulbs. When housekeeping came, she did not replace the towels (there was not sign in the room about reusing towels which is ok with me but I want to know that so I can hang mine up to dry properly) and did not even rehang our old ones. (We hang our towels but not neatly and flat if we don't expect to use again.) The towels were bunched up and still wet. There was not a concierge desk! When I wanted to ask questions I had to go to a podium near front door and speak to the man who apparently was head bellman (first day) and a man in a suit who, when asked if I could ask him a concierge type question answered, well you can. (??) He wasn't the least bit interested in what I wanted to know and it turned out that his directions were exacly backwards. He said go west and it was actually east. Well, check out was the same. About 10am there were many of us waiting to check out and only one man working. We could hear a group of people behing the wall at reception laughing and talking. Finally one came out to help (no apology) and later another came out. The cars were always stacked up outside with not enough people to move and park them. BUT the French Room is wonderful. The food is beautiful and service grand. We loved it. Too bad the management can't get the hotel staff trained in a similar way. The French Room gets A plus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: TXskibunny
Reviews.Content: Couldn't have been happier with our 3 night stay for Cotton Bowl weekend. The Hotel Adolphus is in a great location in a very cool historic building. We received excellent service from the time we checked in until we departed. The staff was warm and helpful and made our stay a delight. Rooms were great and the food at the Bistro and Rodeo Bar was really good.

Reviews.Title: “Historical Beauty and Convenience”
Reviews.Author: LeoDorantes
Reviews.Content: Beauty is many things to different people, the Adolphus has a historical perspective that has endured the hard times of this present economy. It has above average customer service, they not only make you feel as a wanted guest but as a special guest. The guilded age decor and technology seem to blend in as best as these two can with each other; however, just the experience of a pleaseant gastronomy fit for kings and queens make the ordinary overnight stay a memorable one! It has convenient access to downtown whether on business or leisure, and most of all it has the unique attribute of calling you back to the secure warmth and glamour of its halls after a long day at the office. Have a very good stay!

Reviews.Title: “Check your bedding for cleanliness before settling in”
Reviews.Author: KikiNY
Reviews.Content: I stayed here one night for a quick business trip because it was one of my company's recommended hotels. When I entered the reception area I was overwhelmed with the smell of gas fumes. Concerned there was a leak, I asked the receptionist. She replied that it came from the exhaust from the cars idling in the drive. This gas smell also permeated the lobby and could even be detected on the 9th floor hallway. The room itself was huge but tired. The carpeting and overall feel of the rooms and hallways was dreary and sad. I was thankful the bed looked big, modern and inviting. As I was getting ready to get into bed I pulled the duvet back and saw not one but many hairs in the bed. I have never experienced this in a hotel room before. I called reception and they barely offered an apology and sent housekeeping up to change the sheets. I was expecting them to be shocked or horrified as a normal hotel would be, but no. For this reason alone I would not recommend this hotel. I have stayed in hotels that have needed renovating, but it was not an issue as the level of care and attention to detail was there. This hotel seems content to put no effort into maintaining itself and it is really quite sad.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Patsy T
Reviews.Content: I suppose everyone is looking for different things when they are staying at a hotel. For some it is service, cleanliness, or just a good nights sleep. I specifically was looking for history and grandeur. The Adolphus did not fail. It took my breath away. The beauty and grace of the building both inside and out is a sight to behold. The service was very good, the employees were efficient and gracious. It was a very exciting stay, I explored the hotel and was awe struck with every bit of the almost museum like quality and stature of the entire building.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service all around”
Reviews.Author: okbart
Reviews.Content: I can only add my voice to the chorus of displeased (and rightly so) clients of the Adolphus. We were there Dec 10 and 31, 2011, for New Years Eve. Upon check in Friday evening, our bathroom only had 2 bath towels, 2 hand towels, 1 wash cloth, and no bath mat, no robes, one soap, no shampoo, etc. There were 2 glasses provided, no extras. On reading previous reviews where there were NO bath towels, etc, I guess we were actually lucky. On Saturday, we left our room at 11:30 and returned at 4:15. Our room had not yet been made up so we called housekeeping and asked that someone come as soon as possible to attend to this and were told that someone would come up "now." At close to 5:30, a housekeeping person arrived, but by that time, we were dressing for dinner at The French Room and asked that they come back after 6:00. We returned from dinner around 8:00 and the room was still not made up. I called housekeeping and asked if they could at least send up some glasses and some coffee for the morning, and was told, yes." No one ever showed up. We tried to watch a movie on the OnDemand channel, but the TV system wasn't working properly. The people we talked to--a front desk person and a handyman--both gave the excuse that it was a "new system," and they didn't know how to fix it. On both nights, we were unable to ignore the service elevator that ran continuously next to our room, #1811. At check out, I stood in line for 15-20 min (the lack of a "queue" system had hotel patrons being serviced in no particular order), and when I finally got up to the counter, the front desk attendant said she had to leave, would be back shortly, and promptly left.
