The 2 other front desk people continued to attend to other people who'd been waiting far less time than me. Finally,when my attendant didn't come back after several minutes, one of the other 2 people helped me so I could check out (a "thank you" to Edward). Considering the elite status of the hotel, we were dumbfounded at this poor service and lack of organization. Based on this experience I can not recommend this hotel to anyone. How unfortunate given the lovely historic atmosphere of the establishment. By the way, I did email a complaint to the hotel at the email address provided by them to register a complaint, and have not had any sort of response to it. Another demerit.

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare on Commerce Street”
Reviews.Author: steve s
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus because it is near the Cotton Bowl. We were told that there is a 3PM check-in so we delayed our arrival until 5:30PM. At this time our room was not clean so we were told to leave and that they would call us when our room was available. At 8PM we were finally contacted for our room. Because it was a bowl game atmosphere there were a lot of young college students and rowdy fans. This would not be a problem if the hotel management would have worked to keep the noise level down. But as it was I could not get any help in getting our hallway and nearby rooms to kept the noise down and we had to listen to the party goers from Midnight until 5AM - we literally could not rest or sleep until after 5AM. The hotel also requires valet parking - which is $24 per night. When they brought my car around to me at 8AM the next morning it was covered in bird droppings. I asked if they could clean my vehicle and they told me to pull to the curb and they would wipe it off. I pulled over and waited 15 minutes and no one ever showed up. So - my experience was just like the Adolphus - Lousy, Noisy and Crappy ...

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Service! Can anyone problem-solve anymore?”
Reviews.Author: RobinsonCoach
Reviews.Content: I'll add mine to the already growing list. The most amazing part about this "towel" problem though...It was going on for DAYS!!!! We arrived at 5pm. We had no bath towels, no hand towels, no rags, no robes, nothing. We also had a tiny bit of toilet paper. So I did what any normal person would do, call the front desk. They would take care of this "immediately." We left for the evening and returned about 11pm. Guess what? Nothing had been done. Not even the toilet paper. So I called and asked again. The man told me they were out of towels but that they would send me 2 robes. Really? He said he was getting a list together of people that needed them. He said he could also send us toilet paper. This never happened either. So by midnight I was walking around on our floor asking people for towels. Everyone was having a similar problem, but at least they had 1 or 2 towels. I went down to the front desk and noticed sticky notes of rooms that had no towels. They would write down my room number again each time, even though I said they already had it on that list. I was offered no solution, no compensation of any type, no explanation, no way to make things better. I was just told, along with others, that someone would be in tonight to wash towels and they would have them out by 6am. And no, that never happened either. A man working the actual wedding finally pulled me aside and said he would go around and find everything he could. So AFTER MIDNIGHT I got 2 robes, 1 bath towel, and 1 rag. Yes, and finally some toilet paper. It was amazing to me as a human being to see so many people unable to find a fix to a problem that had been happening for days. So let me see if I can give you some suggestions: 1 - Find 2 people, either front desk, butlers, bar workers, bus boys, whoever: GO WASH TOWELS, BRING THEM TO THE FRONT DESK IMMEDIATELY (DON'T HAVE TO FOLD THEM) - I know what these washers and dryers look like and how they work. They are not difficult to run (we have them in our athletic areas at school). 2 - If washers are down, take them to a washateria (sp?). You easily could have so many towels and rags back for customers by night time. 3 - Send someone (see above) to go BUY some towels. Walmart, Target, Dollar Stores, you name it. 4 - Call single-occupant rooms and see if possibly you could gather up a few. 5 - Give people compensation of some type. Free breakfast, drinks, money off night, free valet, something, anything. 6 - Don't just tell people what they want to hear. Tell them the real problems. Explain how you are going to fix them. People have to be problem-solvers. People have to take enough pride in their business to have to WANT to fix things. I saw so many people standing around that could have been working on some kind of fix to these problems. I will not ever recommend someone staying there. In fact, if someone says they are going to this area in Dallas, I will only recommend one thing, don't stay here. And by the way, a "We are so sorry about the problems you encountered. This was unacceptable" statement only works once. Eventually you have to stop making these types of mistakes to keep customers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Horrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Peter H
Reviews.Content: I booked three rooms for four nights at the Adolphus, spending almost over $1,800.00. On the plus side, it's a beautiful hotel, and the concierge and valet staff are great. But there are some issues. During our stay, one of the rooms still had garbage in it from the previous tenants, half the mini bar gone, and no towels. The second room had no towels and the third had one towel and was cleaned twice during our stay. What really irritated me was when I explained to the front desk what our issues had been, he simply said, "Yes, we had some issues this weekend." No apologies, no offer to make things right, etc. I understand that things happen, but it's what happens afterwards that makes the difference. Based on what just happened in the lobby, I'll never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for a great old hotel in Dallas....keep looking!”
Reviews.Author: LBeavers
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas for a wedding and the Adolphus was the recommended hotel for the guests. The hotel website offered a historic hotel with classic ambiance and this was our initial impression. Our experience, however, was that the Adolphus is a nicely appointed hotel which is poorly managed and in desperate need of updating particularly in the bathrooms. Check in was a disaster as the hotel was overbooked. After four hours we finally got two rooms although they were not the type we booked. Other guests in the wedding party were not as lucky. They had to find other accommodation. Apparently one of the hotels washing machines broke down and after numerous request for towels, each one followed by assurances they were on the way, I used the bathrobe to dry off after showering. The parking valet spoke broken English and didn't know how to unlock our car which I am hoping, but am not confident will be in one piece when we check out. The bell captain was the only employee we came in contact with that seemed to be competent and caring. If you are looking for a great hotel in Dallas, I would suggest looking past the Adolphus.

Reviews.Title: “Bowl Game Getaway”
Reviews.Author: M0455
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in town for a college bowl game, and decided to use a bidding site for a 4* hotel in the Dallas downtown area. We were pleasantly surprised when we found out our stay would be at the Adolphus, as the hotel has received many great reviews. Our stay def. lived up to the reviews, and then some. The hotel lobby is filled with Dark woods, brass chandeliers, and grand furniture...all of which shout first class. The check-in clerk was very accomodating as well. Even though our room was prepaid, we were still treated as if we were paying full price for a suite. We were even given a deluxe room with a view! The room itself was very stately, clean, and spacious. What we liked most about it was the walk -in closet. We've stayed at all types of hotel throughout the years, and this was the first time we had encountered such a spacious closet. All our clutter could be kept in one area, as oppossed to chairs, desks, etc. The mattress and pillows were also very good. I have back problems, and usually find it difficult to get a good night's sleep at any hotel. But not here. Both the wife and I slept very soundly. The only thing I was not satisfied with was the lack of self parking. The hotel only offers mandatory valet. Wouldn't be such a big deal if it wasn't so expensive ($24/day). But I guess that is to be expected from downtown hotels where parking is at a premium. There is another option though. There is a public parking garage one block from the hotel (corner of Elm and Field) that offers overnight parking (7 to 7). Since it was a weekend, and were in late and out early, we only paid $6! Weekday rate is $12...still cheaper than the hotel. But even with the hotel parking, the hotel is first class, and would recommend to anyone wanting to stay in DT Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “I don't usually complain about hotels, but the Adolphus deserved a negative review.”
Reviews.Author: billyloon
Reviews.Content: I never usually write reviews unless there is something exceptionally good or bad. I stay in a lot of hotels, and my 1-night stay here the night of 1/1/2012 was probably in the bottom 5% of all my hotel experiences. The Adolphus has a lot of potential, and maybe they just had a bad day this time, but the hotel was only at about 50% occupancy so I don't have much sympathy for them. Here it goes: PROS: - Good location in downtown Dallas - Staff is friendly CONS: - Arrived at 5pm and still had to wait 2.5 HOURS for the room to get cleaned! I asked them every 60 minutes or so for a status update, and they kept telling me that housekeeping was in the room cleaning it. The third time I asked they were telling the truth, but the first 2 times I asked they were just telling me what I wanted to hear. Nevertheless, I was cordial and friendly even after 2.5 hours. It just went downhill from there. - They gave us 1 towel for 3 people. I had to ask 4 times for more towels before we finally got some 6 hours later, at 1am. They said they were running short on towels, but they also told me the hotel was only about half full so I'm not sure how they could be short on towels. - The bed was very uncomfortable, and I can sleep just about anywhere. Seriously, the bed I slept in was like a rock. - The temperature in the room was inconsistent all night, either too hot or too cold and the thermostat was not accurate either. - I placed the tag on the door to have breakfast delivered between 6:30-7am. I wrote very clearly on the tag, but they still called me at 5:30am to confirm my order. Luckily for them, the beds were so uncomfortable that all 3 of us were already awake. - Parking in this area is extremely inconvenient, and valet parking at the hotel is overpriced. - No wifi in room, not even for purchase.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management”
Reviews.Author: orj7
Reviews.Content: I'll start by praising the hotel for its old English charm, spacious rooms and very comfortable beds. That's where it ends. We arrived on 31 December to a mass of about 40 people waiting to check in with 4 check-in clerks serving very slowly. It was already 6pm - our room was not ready. We were told that someone would call us to notify us that the room was ready. 2 issues: (1) we had an overseas phone and the hotel refused to contact a non-US phone (2) it was NYE and we had plans. In addition, there was nowhere to shower after a long flight and a long night ahead. Thank goodness when we returned to the hotel at 1am they had a room ready for us - but it took an additional 20 minutes to get our luggage from the luggage room. The next day we had to request our room to be serviced at 7pm! This is unacceptable for a hotel of this apparent quality. The room was serviced eventually between 9-11pm - amazing. The hotel services book in the room details that you have a complimentary car service within a 5 mile radius. However, when we requested the service, we were told that the hotel was too empty to provide such a service. Why bother advertising for such a service? Whilst the staff were friendly they all seemed dumbfounded at the lack of housecleaning services... a little strange given all the previous reviews going back at least to July 2011. I do have to mention that we received a $100 credit for food and beverages, which we used on breakfasts and a snack at the adjacent restaurant. I will not be returning to this hotel for the simple fact that I wouldn't know if I'd even have a (clean) room at the end of the day!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience!”
Reviews.Author: lujacque
Reviews.Content: My family traveled to Dallas for Thanksgiving this year. We met up with family that was already there and we all stayed at the Adolphus. The hotel was very nice and was very family friendly. We had adjoining rooms which meant we could put the baby down in one room to sleep without being seperated and enjoy spending time with the rest of the family in the other room. The beds were comfortable and the bathrooms were nice. We ate breakfast at the hotel. It was excellent. One morning we ate in the restaurant and the other we had room service. Both were well done. The Rodeo Bar and Grill was open on Thanksgiving night fortunately because nothing else was. The turkey dinner was surprisingly very good. The hotel staff was very friendly, especially considering they were working on a holiday. The hotel is in a great location. We walked from the hotel to the American Airlines Center one night for hockey. During the day we walked to the Dallas Aquarium from the hotel also. There is a Starbucks on the corner across the street from the hotel and within a half mile walking distance there are many restaurants such as TGIF, Spaghetti Warehouse and Chipotle. We enjoyed our time at the Adolphus. They serve afternoon tea in the lobby and it was a very nice atmosphere. The only problem we encountered was a slight problem with out hot water. We should have notified the front desk immediately but we did not. I am sure they would have takend care of it.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, beautiful hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: txmar555
Reviews.Content: It had been a while since I visited the Adolphus and I couldn't believe how many great entertainment options there were within walking distance of the hotel. The staff was very accommodating and the rooms are large and well appointed. It's a pleasure to be surrounded by a luxurious environment. Would highly recommend this hotel when visiting Dallas. Great location for viewing the sites!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: BigDaddyVon
Reviews.Content: Without question one of the finest Hotels that we've visited. We were in town for the Ticket City bowl game at the Cotton bowl. We had four rooms which were all upgraded upon our arrival. The food at the "Rodeo Bar and Grill" was great as was our breakfast the following morning. They even provided us transportation to the game at no charge. Will definetly be going back. The doorman, Jimmy, was a delight as was Stacey, who checked us in. After finding that our rooms weren't quite ready she searched till she found us rooms that were availabel. Quite frankly one of the best experiences of my many Hotel stays around the country.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Karen L
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Adolphus for the Armed Forces Bowl. We had 2 rooms. The double room I reserved was unavailable so we were upgraded to a 2 bed suite. Very nice surprise. The staff were extremely accomodating and very helpful. I can't think of any negative to write and we will definitely stay here agin when we travel to Dalls. Thanks for the great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Have a Birthday”
Reviews.Author: TimTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had a milestone birthday coming up and we decided we would return to the Adolphus Hotel, We have enjoyed it several times before and wanted to see the Gaultier exhibit at the DMA. We love staying there, it is always such a pleasure. And both being from Dallas, there is no place more historic. I let them know I was having my 50th birthday there and they took it from there. My room was a super upgrade and we felt like superstars on the terrace at the Adolphus. Thank you all so much! It couldn't have been better. I noticed issues in other reviews and we had no problems, plenty of towels, hot and cold water all worked. We ordered extra pillows and a blanket which arrived quickly. They make you feel first class all the time. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Amenities Amiss”
Reviews.Author: RogLisa
Reviews.Content: Overall stay was a pleasure once amenities were corrected. This historic hotel holds a great deal for the eye. From the valet entrance to the threshold of our doorway, we felt a sense of grandeur and posterity with the exception of the dirty linens in the hallway after 5:00p.m. As we settled in to locate our amenities as stated online, we found disappointment. Anticipating a relaxing evening with a holiday movie and a nice glass of wine or mug of coffee, we found paper coffee cups, lacking of brewing supplies, no wine glasses, no DVD player (per hotel website), and no access to movies on demand as stated. If this hotel has a green earth agenda, they were on target with towel rationing. We found one towel and no washcloths. After several staff interventions, our stay became memorable. We were greeted with a can do attitude and a â€˜sorry for the inconvenienceâ€™ demeanor.

Reviews.Title: “Weird Towel Situation”
Reviews.Author: Britkim2169
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, friendly and professional staff and the room was clean and actually very impressive. However ... we only had one bath towel when we arrived and so called down to housekeeping for another bath towel and some handtowels. 10 minutes later, a lovely lady arrived to advise us that they didn't have any!!!! A 4* hotel and they don't have bath towels - isn't that weird? Anyway, we took the proffered two handtowels and two face towels and managed to dry ourselves after our showers!

Reviews.Title: “Best "Home away from Home" Hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: SReynolds0023
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 16th Wedding Anniversary here at the Adolphus Hotel. When we arrived at this hotel we were greeted like we were famous. From the valet to room service, this was a five star experience. During our stay we experienced our first "High Tea" - we had a blast! On the night of our anniversary, we ate at The Adolphus' famous, The French Room. It is truly the best dining experience. The restaurant is absolutely breath-taking and the environment is both warm and inviting. Our waitress catered to us as if we were the only couple in the restaurant. If you are looking for a hotel that is both exquisite and warm; look no further....The Adolphus Hotel is your place. Enjoy your home - away from - home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: Jorge R
Reviews.Content: I Loved My Stay At The Adolphus It Is One Of The Best Stays I Have Had In A Long Time I Would Tell All My Friends And Clients To Stay At The Adolphus.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: BrussoDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our Anniversary. We live in Dallas but saw a deal on Snique Away so decided to check it out. Although my husbandâ€™s name was also on the reservation they wouldn't let him check in b/c I made & paid for the reservations (kind of a pain but it worked out) When we came back later that night they upgraded our room for free b/c of the inconvenience. The room was very nice & what I would expect of this hotel. Our room over looked AT&T's Christmas tree. Since the hotel is downtown there was a fair amount of street noise & neither of us slept very well. There were two non hotel room doors outside our door, Iâ€™m not sure what was behind them but Iâ€™d assume maintenance of some sort b/c after we went to sleep we heard a lot of banging around outside our door. (we were in room 1111) It is $24 to valet at the hotel so we paid $12 to park a block & half away. Worth the walk in my opinion. I think our room was having water issues though b/c the water in the toilet was hot (you could feel it just by being near the tank) & all the water coming out of the sink was scolding hot (good thing we didnâ€™t shower there)

Reviews.Title: “Rustic and great service”
Reviews.Author: dee n
Reviews.Content: Great service! Had a two-day stay -- the room service food was great.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Jonathan E
Reviews.Content: Service is great from the restaurant to reservations. It felt homey despite its downtown location. Service at French Room is particularly good.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful night out”
Reviews.Author: Andrew A
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Adolphus Hotel and enjoyed ourselves. We are local but like to stay in a local hotel 2-3 times per year. We were greated with smiles by all of the friendly staff. We enjoyed nearby shopping at Neiman Marcus as well as Jos. A Bank. Breakfast at the Bistro was also a treat. On the way home my wife commented about how she enjoyed the stay over the other 2 hotels that we visited this year. We will be back. Merry Christmas to the Adolphus staff!!

Reviews.Title: “One of many stays”
Reviews.Author: jill a
Reviews.Content: If you eat at the best restaurant in Dallas (The French Room), it is fun to go the adjacent cozy bar to visit Cosme, the mixologist and walk upstairs to your well appointed room for a good night's sleep. Breakfast is magnnificent.

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Pleasant Experience”
Reviews.Author: lannyr
Reviews.Content: I had been looking forward to staying at the Adolphus for a long time and, like the previous reviewer, got my chance through SniqueAway. Right away I was impressed with the efficiency of their parking valets and the front desk personnel. And because the type room we requested was not available they were classy enough to give us an upgrade. Very nice room with a great view of the holiday decorations. But we were distressed to find that the sheets were wrinkled and there were hairs in the bed. As if housekeeping had been too busy to change the sheets. We honestly expected more from the Adolphus. However April, on the front desk, was all over it. By the time we got back from dinner she had had the head housekeeper in to inspect the room and the bed had a set of fresh clean sheets. We really appreciated the way she handled it.

Reviews.Title: “Finest Hotel I Stay in”
Reviews.Author: Jim M
Reviews.Content: The elegant atmosphere and interior of the Adolphus Hotel is only surpassed by the consistent service and attitude of the staff, from doorman to department Directors. The responsiveness of the housekeeping department, the attitudes of the chefs the helpfulness of the valet staff; it all creates one unbeatable package of the highest quality hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Good attention”
Reviews.Author: Godzilladude
Reviews.Content: We got a deal through SniqueAway, and as our 25th Anniversary was upon us (and the kids were still in school), we decided to spend a weekend night here, and dine at The French Room. We made a good choice. The room was HUGE, with windows facing west. Everything was in order, save, there were no face towels, and it actually took two tries to get some. Everything after that went just fine. The bed was also VERY comfy. The highlight was after we finish dining at The French Room, we returned to our room, and not five minutes later there was a knock on the door, a bellhop with a chilled plate of chocolates and chocolate covered strawberries, with a note around our anniversary. Nice touch! Everyone was gracious and counteous, it really was a wonderful couple days. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Deb S
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful! I had a corner room on the 22nd floor. It was quiet and extremely comfortable. The bath amenities are also very, very nice. I ate in both the Bistro and the "saloon"--the food in both was excellent (and the bar has some fastic happy hour prices). I will not stay any place else from this point forward when I visit Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience! The staff and property were top notch.”
Reviews.Author: Stacie G
Reviews.Content: I was at the Adolphus for 3 nights recently for Business and was very impressed with the attention the staff provided, and the comfort and beauty of the hotel. I am handicapped, so always need just a little more help and accessibility in a hotel room. The Adolphus was equipped perfectly for my needs. The staff was more than willing to help in every instance. The atmosphere of the hotel is classic elegance. You feel very spoiled by the amenities without a huge price tag. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: lss5059
Reviews.Content: We recently spend three nights at the Adolphus after getting a great deal through a discount hotel booking website. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a suite free of charge because the only remaining standard rooms were small and without a view. Nice start! Our room was huge, super clean, and had plenty of natural light. The beds were amazingly comfortable. The bathroom was on the smaller side but served its function. I'd read some complaints about not getting hot water, but we had not issue with that. There were a few minor issues. Our toilet didn't flush very easily as the knob was loose and nobody came to make up our room on the first day, but I'm sure if we'd brought these things to the attention of the front desk, they would have been addressed right away. The hotel only has valet parking at a whopping $24 per night, which is standard given the downtown location, but even after we moved our car to another, cheaper lot down the street, we were still charged for valet. Again, I'm sure this will get taken care of with a phone call. All in all, we loved our stay at the Adolphus and would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Best holiday family experience!”
Reviews.Author: GdotG
Reviews.Content: Our family just enjoyed a wonderful holiday experience at the Adolphus this weekend. On the first Friday of December, this elegant hotel is transformed into a family-friendly Christmas wonderland where all generations can enjoy the decorations, special meals with Santa and Mrs. Claus, play games by the beautiful tree in the lobby in pj's, and prepare to watch the Children's Holiday Parade on Saturday morning. Everything was outstanding: the staff and service, room, amenities, and food. From toddlers to pre-teens, our entire family had a wonderful time and has booked for next year!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Morgen H
Reviews.Content: We stayed over a holiday weekend to be near friends who live in a downtown Dallas loft. We were able to walk to local restaurants, bars, and attractions during the day and to enjoy a well-appointed suite for socializing and relaxing at night. We highly recommend the street-level bar, and look forward to trying the hotel eateries during our next visit. The hotel staff was marvelous in every way. We travel a lot for work, and this place outshines the usual business-fare one-hundred-fold. Henceforth, this will be the place we stay when we are in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Value Option”
Reviews.Author: Joshua S
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Adolphus after having my reservation cancelled at another hotel in Dallas. The front desk attendant was delightful, accommodating, and provided me with a wonderful room at a very reasonable last minute price. The room was not only spacious, but also had quite possibly the best hotel bed I've slept on in 15 years of business travel. The gym is more than adequate as well. This hotel is one worth booking for the value conscious business traveler, given the rate and the free amenities (such as WiFi).

Reviews.Title: “nice downtown stay”
Reviews.Author: chuckA59
Reviews.Content: hotel old but upkeep is meticulous.. rooms was large with nice appointments and refrig..no ice machines which is a pain but brought to room in only minutes when requested. Very friendly staff. great downtown location. just a really neat older hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: C_LoMcKinney_Texas
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Adolphus hotel on Friday. This was the best hotel experience that we've ever had. The hotel was easy to find from the freeway.The food was great and the Penthouse Suite was above and beyond anything we've had the pleasure of enjoying.The staff is professional and courteous and the property was clean and inviting. We live only 25 minutes from downtown Dallas, but we will occasionally go to Dallas just to stay at the Adolphus and have a mini getaway. A totally awesome experience.

Reviews.Title: “My stay at the Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: Shelley B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus Hotel in Dallas for my 50th Birthday. We had the most amazing time. The staff couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. They went out of their way to make me feel special. We will definately stay here again next time we come to Dallas. One of the most beautiful Hotels we've seen.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: parisfan51
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus on Saturday night. We chose it because of the reputation which after our stay we can is well deserved. The service was exceptional as was the room itself. The price was very reasonable. We did not try the restaurant. The surrounding area is safe but does not have much as far as food choices go.

Reviews.Title: “BE CAREFUL - EXCESS OF CHARGE”
Reviews.Author: CSFilho
Reviews.Content: I've booked this hotel through Booking.com and unfortunately I needed to cancel my trip to Dallas and cancelled the hotel before the deadline with no penalties. My surprise is that the hotel charged one night in my credit card twice and until now, one month later, did not refunded the amounts to my credit card. Be careful with this hotel, as they charge you amounts you do not owe and create several difficulties to refund you.

Reviews.Title: “Always the best hotel stay experience.....perfect every time.”
Reviews.Author: rebeccaanne1120
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus Hotel is by far the best overnight experience I have had in Dallas. The Hotel is elegant, and the staff is very nice, really polite, and extremely helpful. The rooms are always super clean and the beds and pillows are soft and comfortable. The Afternoon High Tea is to die for and the restaurants all offer excellent food...including 24 hr room service. The Adolphus offers World Class service and a high class hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Wearj1
Reviews.Content: Could not have had a better experience! Very nice, clean, and excellent service! Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Reception Weekend”
Reviews.Author: CB5959
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the Adolphus for my son's wedding reception. The suite was very nice and clean. I had a large amount of family staying there also and everyone loved it. The reception was perfect, breakfast in the morning was delicious and all the staff were very helpful. We would definitely recommend this hotel. It has the old time feel with the dark wood and older furniture. It's nice to stay somewhere where it's not so contemporary and uncomfortable. Would love to return someday!

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: Gijsje_11
Reviews.Content: On a recent stay after having been told in the middle of the night by the Dallas Sheraton suites market garden that they had no rooms, no overflow or suggestions, we ended up at the Adolphus. Great reception (as in very welcoming at 2am), great room, great service a class act and a really good value.

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus Hotel is a great restaurant find”
Reviews.Author: Becky M
Reviews.Content: We came downtown to view the first time every lighting of the tree at the newest park downtown: Main Gardens and the light show at AT&T Plaza, which is across from The Adolphus Hotel. We went to the Rodeo Bar and Grille at The Adolphus for something to eat. What a great find. Great service, with lots of flat paneled TV's to view the news or games. Great food that was reasonably priced. Service was excellent. Downtown and Main Street Historic district is rocking with lots of restaurants and bars, including CVS pharmacy, Neiman Marcus store windows for the holidays was beautiful. I will be back to enjoy the restaurants around The Adolphus and in the hotel again soon.

Reviews.Title: “One night business trip”
Reviews.Author: leveller99
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, good staff, great location, fabulous Elvis-Bellhop. Only drawback is that it's very (very) brown. I had a suite on the 18th floor, good space, very comfortable, big bed, two flat screen etc, but bathroom a little tired (and even more beige). Great bars and restaurants, good in-room dining too (corned beef hash and eggs for breakfast was really, very good). Good hotel overall, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “The old crown jewel still shines”
Reviews.Author: dwpks
Reviews.Content: I have to admit at being very skeptical about this birthday weekend planned for me because of an amazing rate that included food credit, which was an added bonus at this wonderful Dallas grand hotel of hotels. Without asking, we were given an upgrade, and this particular area was freshly painted, and the spacious room crisp and well-cared for. Food in the bar was very "Texas" and very tasty. Room service breakfast was right on time, hot, well-prepared and on a wheeled-in table. The stay was quiet, and restful. The only negative was the traffic jam while checking in, and then getting my car the next morning which took longer than usual. We will be back for other special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificence of Hotel Spans Generations”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our wedding night in the bridal suite of the hotel 28 years ago. We have come back for various anniversaries, but this year's was very special. Our son and his fiance will be married in June 2012 and the reception will be held at the Adolphus. He too will spend his wedding night at this fabulous hotel. This past weekend, we flew to Dallas to meet the parents of our soon-to-be-daughter-in-law for wedding preparations. They are from St. Louis and loved the history of the hotel. In short, our children will be married during the 100th anniversary of the Adolphus, which was built by Adolph Busch of St. Louis as a gift to Texas when he began shipping his beer to Dallas. It's a sweet St. Louis-meets-Texas story. And wouldn't you know, when we arrived for the weekend, guest services presented us with a celebration tray of various pastries -- just a little reminder of why we keep coming back as often as possible. The elegance of the lobby and the guestrooms will keep you coming back as well. The French Room is a must and high tea is delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, great price, will stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: kaigogi
Reviews.Content: It lived up to everything that it advertised. Beautiful hotel in downtown Dallas. Only took us 20 minutes to get to Arlington for a Dallas Cowboys game. All sorts of restaurants and bars within walking distance. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and gracious hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: TexasCharliesangel
Reviews.Content: Although I have eaten at the French room, this was my first overnight stay in the hotel. The room was pleasant and I was not disappointed! That's saying a lot considering the lobby and restaurant are so exquisite.

Reviews.Title: “Mommy Son Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Dallasmom2011
Reviews.Content: My son and I were looking for the perfect hotel for our staycation. We chose the Adolphus and were so glad we did. Our lovely Junior Suite was incredibly well priced and had so much charm. All kids love room service, so had plenty of it. The room service rates were the most reasonable I have seen anywhere in years. The hotel is so beautiful. No other hotel in Dallas can compare to the beauty of the lobby, The French Room and the first level common areas. My 11 year old summed it up best by saying " Everyone is so nice and friendly here. I loved our room and the food. Why don't we always stay at hotels that have so much character?" I agree with him!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: DraperyDude
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very large and clean. Decor is a little outdated but the service and location make up for it. I was surprised when I arrived because it was on sale on hotels.com for such a good deal that it is worth much more than what I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Hotel - downtown”
Reviews.Author: NeedRelaxin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 day business trip. Room was quite spacious. Beautiful lobby, nice workout room but no pool. Nice location downtown - but tons of scragglers on the streets - be careful when venturing out at night. Does have pub attached to hotel - 4 blocks from Repository. Downtown Dallas, at least by this hotel, needs a little TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Service and Royal Treatment.”
Reviews.Author: RobinGreenEyes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absoultely splendid. I had such wonderful treatment even before I stepped into the hotel lobby. Thanks to Mr. Philip Johnson who greets you as you come from your car or taxi and arranges for your luggage to be picked up and delivered to your room. My girlfriend and I went on a business trip for the weekend and were very impressed with the staff and their service. The room was tastefully decorated and the beds so very comfortable. Taking a nice relaxing shower with their mega-showerhead and settling into a comfy terry robe provided by the hotel was just sweet relief. The lobby is georgeous with its wood panel and highback comfortable chairs. Hotel is pet friendly for small dogs. Located in the heart of downtown Dallas near the Dallas Convention Center, fine shops, public transportation and restaurants you cannot go wrong. Will definately come again for a weekend end getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Older Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cleolily
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Sat. night for my brthday. We stayed in an executive suite, and the room was very nice. Bed was very comfortable, room was clean. The service from everyone, except maybe housekeeping, was fantastic. The guy at the front desk was great, the valet was friendly, bartender and everyone at the French Room were amazing. If you do stay here, I would definitely recommend having dinner at the French Room. It was the best dining experience I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Love Old”
Reviews.Author: LEESA G
Reviews.Content: Then this is the hotel for you! I am in love with the early 19th century and this hotel was a great find! We went to Dallas this past Thursday and just enjoyed the location and its awesome details of old charm. I plan on going back for a "just because" trip! Staff was super friendly.

Reviews.Title: “WEEKEND TRIP DESTINATION”
Reviews.Author: Deborah M
Reviews.Content: I joined a friend for a weekend in Dallas and selected the Adolphus because I had afternoon tea there many years ago and ever since then have looked for an opportunity to stay. I was just as impressed with the hotel room and service as I was with the afternoon tea all those years ago. And yes, I did have afternoon tea while I was there and yes, it was every bit the experience it was initially. Even if you don't stay at the hotel, make the effort to have afternoon tea there. We stayed in the junior suite and both loved it!! The room had many quaint features that made it superior to so many "plastic-off the assembly line" hotel rooms where I've stayed. If you make it to Dallas and would be happy with somewhere unique-this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “weekend at Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: MicheleSpringfieldVA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus for a friends wedding. Everything took place at the hotel. It was a wonderful stay. Our room was so spacious with large & lovely bath and all the amenities. The staff was very friendly and quick to help with any questions. The ceremony was intimate and the reception was one of the nicest we have attended with delicious dinner and great acoustics. I only wish we had had time for the afternoon tea! Never used a car. Walked to the Kennedy Museum. If we ever go to Dallas again this would be the hotel were we would stay. Truly enjoyed the atmosphere of the Adolphus !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TrotamundosBetis
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is a beautiful historic hotel and a welcome relief from the bland modern chain hotels. The lobby is fantastic and our room was quite nice. The only oddity in the room was the huge distance between the bed and the TV but, given that the rooms were designed in an era before TV, you can't really hold this against the hotel. The staff was very friendly and the location is excellent. It is possible to get just about everywhere of interest in Dallas by Light Rail and we enjoyed not having to waste money on a rental car. Downtown Dallas is pretty deserted, even in the middle of the work day, but we did not find this to be an issue. The nearby Galilee Grille offers an excellent lunch buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a gem and they are so accommodating!”
Reviews.Author: wahinetraveler06
Reviews.Content: What an outstanding hotel. The service and food are outstanding. The room was spacious and comfortable. I had a lovely view out all the windows. This hotel is well situated. It is near the art district with all the museums. It is only two blocks from Nieman-Marcus for excellent shopping. It is maybe four blocks from the 5th floor museum honoring the memory of JFK. I would go back for another stay. I stayed three nights. So comfortable and felt welcome. I must speak about breakfast in the bistro. This was a wonderful experience. Moderate prices for outstanding menu with substitutions of fresh fruit for potatoes. And real table cloths and napkins!

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus-A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Howard S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus Hotel in Downtown Dallas for a weekend in November. The hotel is magnificent and exhibits such granduer. The service is above all others. The area of downtown has a lot of great restaurants and is convenient to the Arts District. We had a great weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm”
Reviews.Author: annaabelle
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel on the weekend of a big college football match. The check in was very slow, with no apologies. However ,the football added to the atmosphere over the weekend. The hotel is grand, old style. Our room was large, with good beds. and a spacious bathroom. The area where the hotel is located is in CBD and lacked any real atmosphere. We visited the State fair , went to an ice hockey game and shopped at North park shopping centre... we did all this using the light rail system. A visit to the 6th Floor museum was a highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Dusty old glory”
Reviews.Author: cristianonyc
Reviews.Content: A picture of Queen Elizabeth of England( who stayed in the hotel in 1991 during an offical visit) hangs in the lobby. That says it all about the old glorious days this hotel has seen. Today is just a dusty momument to what a luxury hotel shouldn't be. Staff is tired as the carpet !

Reviews.Title: “Sheer Elegance”
Reviews.Author: mom8xs
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time at this hotel. The service was excellent. The Bistro food was great and there is a Starbucks right next door. Fun to see people having tea in the foyer.

Reviews.Title: “Sloppy Service”
Reviews.Author: Andrew76028
Reviews.Content: For being such a "High Class" place, we experienced very sloppy service. When we arrived we noticed that are sheets had stains on them. We requested the linens be changed. When we came back from dinner around 9pm they still had not changed the linens. Also, for more than 24hrs there was a dirty room service cart outside our room along with dirty towels in the hall a few rooms down. I would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: sara g
Reviews.Content: I could not have been happier with this hotel. The hotel has a very elegant American feel -- much nicer than I can typically afford on a non-profit travel stipend! Staff was incredibly nice and the location was central to all of our meetings (while still being very quiet). To top it off, they provided free taxi service (!?!) in and around downtown (not sure if it extends outside of downtown). My colleague -- who checked in later -- was upgraded to a massive executive room. I checked in early and it wasn't a problem. I loved my standard king which had a little seating area, couch and desk. If I come back to Dallas, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic week-end!”
Reviews.Author: Pam C
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is a beautiful hotel! The bellhop made us feel welcome as soon as we arrived. We stayed in a suite on the 18th floor. Our overall experience was a perfect 10! We will definitely stay at the Adolphus hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Trouble with towels”
Reviews.Author: Suzi F
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous old hotel that's having trouble with their housekeeping staff. We were in town for a large family wedding. One of the topics of conversation was that no one had any towels in their rooms. On top of a towel shortage, our room didn't get cleaned at all on one of the days of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Every glitch addressed immediately”
Reviews.Author: Vandra
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth or fifth time staying here for three nights during one of the busiest weekends of the year (Oklahoma/Texas game). At first, housekeeping was fairly dismal, with us needing to call every day at about 4 p.m. to see if our room was ever going to get cleaned (they kept saying it wasn't "on the schedule" to be cleaned). But when I discussed our problems and disappointment with a manager on day No. 3, he carefully listened and responded the way a classy hotel should. I believe that this aspect will improve, and we plan on staying there again. I also wanted to note that every other part of the Adolphus was as superior as in the past: The food, the front desk, bellhops and valet. And it's definitely better - and much cheaper - than the Mansion at Turtle Creek, where we had stayed more than a dozen times in the past (same weekend).

Reviews.Title: “A marriage proposal at the French Room”
Reviews.Author: LindaA512
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus Hotel is a magical place. From the moment you enter the magic begins. The fine furnishings, lovely chandeliers, and the most amazing 1893 Steinway piano draws you into another place in time. A quieter, elegance permeates this hotel. The room was splendid. We were there to assist a friend of ours in carrying out a surprise marriage proposal at dinner in the evening at the French Room. I can not describe with words the delightful fare offered. All was exquisitely presented and the taste a utter joy to the palette. The staff of the French room were exceptional. It was truly the most magical weekend overall all and would not have been so if done somewhere other than the Adolphus and French Room. Mike Reed played the lovely 1893 Steinway in such a way to enhance the ambiance provided by this lovely hotel. It was so difficult to leave while he was continuing to play. He is a gifted artists and was so generous to share the story of the piano and talk to fellow music lovers. His choices of music were superb. My review may seem a bit overstated. Please believe me it is not. I am only sad that I have not enjoyed this lovely hotel prior to this stay. It is now on my first choice when in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: BUcinTX
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus while in town to enjoy the State Fair. The hotel is beautiful and so charming- charming in a great way. Everyone who we came in contact with from the hotel was so nice, they made sure our stay was wonderful! Our room was lovely and large. We enjoyed breakfast at the Bistro- very good. My only regret is that we didn't get to try the French Room. We took a peek inside and it was beautiful! The Adolphus will be our go to hotel in Dallas from now on!

Reviews.Title: “Dallas gem”
Reviews.Author: sjsha
Reviews.Content: I had a quick one night stay at this historic jewel but I would highly recommend staying here for anyone visiting Dallas. The staff is very friendly and helpful and the atmosphere takes you back to the days of railroad and cattle barons.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Old School" Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elder1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Friday night last weekend with my 11 year old - she loved it. The place is pretty much in line with all the previous posts. Beautifully 90% restored 100 year old hotel. The 10% not restored is noticeable, which is a shame. It was the little things; loose fictures, a hole where the pot light was supposed to be in the closet, a crack here and there. That being said, it is a beautiful place. The parking was not an issue - we didn't wait more than 2-3 minutes to hand the car off and about 5 minutes to pick it up. The $24 was steep but I couldn't find anywhere else to park that was close. What helps my opinion was the $115 rate I paid through Expedia. I would not have paid anymore than $150-$175 for my purposes but if you're looking for an elegant place to stay downtown, $200-$300 per night would not be bad for this hotel. We didn't use the restaurant or bar but they looked terrific.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time for the State Fair of Texas”
Reviews.Author: texasgirlandboy22
Reviews.Content: I had never been to the State Fair, although I have lived in Texas all of my life! So, my husband and I decided to make a weekend trip from Houston to Dallas and we stayed at the Adolphus for the weekend. Let me first address some of the comments that folks have made...it's not "dated"--it's a historical hotel! It's SUPPOSED to look "older". It has a wonderul "air" about it that something more modern looking can't even come close to! It's not supposed to be a hotel with sleek lines and modern furniture, it's SUPPOSED to be JUST the way that it is. Their display of antiques and art is fabulous, only surpassed by the service. Their front desk personnel was delightful! I booked our room through priceline and was not treated any differently than full price customers, as some others previously made note of! We didn't want to travel out of downtown really to eat--we live in Houston and have plenty of restaurants there. We just wanted to relax and hang out; the concierge suggested a good little Italian place for our first night--it wasn't Damian's in Houston, but it was quite good and hit the spot! I had made reservations at a "seen and be seen" Sushi spot, but asked the concierge for another suggesion in downtown or Deep Ellum. He suggested "Deep" which turned out to me great and just what we were looking for before leaving Dallas the next day. We travel quite a bit and I truly didn't have any complaints about my stay; if I could come up with any "critique" it is that the rooms that are for housekeeping, near the ends of the halls, their door jambs could use replacing. They have been beat up by the carts and painted over and over...and the ONLY reason I noticed it was because one of the doors was RIGHT next to ours and it did look "shabby". I would HIGHLY recommend this establishment to anyone wanting a quiet getaway to Dallas. The shower head was amazing and the bed was extra comfortable...just what was needed after a day of eating fried butter and fried hotsauce at The State Fair of Texas!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, But Ssoooo Dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: tommygirl847
Reviews.Content: We bought a "GROUPON" night at the Adolphus to celebrate the promotion of a new job. Upon arrival, we were in awe of the hotel, the porter was helpful, the lobby was gorgeous, and the staff was prompt and courteous. We walked up to our hotel room #1012, at a glance of the room, it was very spacious, and the bathroom was immaculate. As I headed towards the big beautiful king size bed, I noticed a gigantic carpet spot (like someone spilled some bleach) that was so big, there was no way you could overlook it. I was so disappointed; as I had been bragging to my sister about how beautiful the Adolphus was, and couldn't wait to invite her and her husband to celebrate. Needles to say, I was so embarrassed, there was no way I was going to have any guests in that room. My first thought was.... did we get put in this room because of the:"GROUPON" night we purchased? I really didn't know what to think, but my expectations of this hotel were immediately shattered. I don't know much about up keeping of a hotel, but I do know that if that was my carpet, I would never invite a guest to spend the night.... So why do you feel it's acceptable to rent out a room with a carpet looking like that????

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: A2Z06
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel in a quiet part of the city. The room was very big, clean and modern. Comfortable bed and great shower. No smoking hotel so great for non smokers, not so much for smokers (have to go outside to the front of the hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Susan L
Reviews.Content: We booked several rooms for the out of town guests for my daughter's wedding and could not have been more satisfied. The hotel worked with us on the rate and could not have been nicer about the details. The staff was great and the hotel is something to see. I would definitely recommend this hotel for a special event or just a weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “I almost forgot places like this still exist!!”
Reviews.Author: Georgem28
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotels often and this is the first time I've actually been compelled to write a review! When I arrived, I was greeted by Phil, an extremely gracious doorman, who had my luggage on a cart and my car off to the valet garage faster than I could blink! He brought me inside and promised that my items would be well taken care of. There were a few people on the line, and while I waited (only about a 5 minute wait), the manager Chris walked up and engaged me in conversation. He seemed to genuinely care that I was staying at the Adolphus! I've never seen a manager take the time to wander the lobby and greet his guests, finding out why they were staying here, if it was their first time in Dallas, etc. I overheard some guests telling an agent that it was their anniversary - Chris must have overheard this as well, because as soon as the couple was out of earshot, he jumped behind the desk and ordered up a complimentary bottle of champagne sent up to their room! How classy is that!! The young lady who checked me in, Liz, I believe, was as sweet as can be. She took her time to find me the best room that they had available and introduced me to the bellman who would be taking my bags up (unfortunately, I have misplaced his name, but he was very professional and efficient). As I headed up the escalator, under the opulent chandelier, and into the incredibly gorgeous upper lobby, I really felt like I had been whisked away to the golden years! My room, a standard room I believe, was large and spacious - much more so than your Hiltons or Hyatts - and adorned with vintage-looking though well-kept furnishings. I had one of the best sleeps of my life that night on the ridiculously comfortable bed. The next morning, as I headed downstairs, there was Chris again, in the lobby chatting up guests. I swear - does he ever go home? I was surprised when he remembered me by name and asked how my room was and if I needed anything. The hotel appeared to be quite busy - how could he remember one guest amongst hundreds? He's a treasure, to be sure. Eve, or Eva, checked me out that morning - efficeient and friendly. There was a bit of a delay waiting on my car, but nothing worth docking points for. There were some grumpy people not happy about the wait - seriously, folks, calm down a bit! Is that 5 minutes of your life really worth getting your blood presure up? If you're tired of staying in carbon copy, boxy "modern" hotels where you're just another room number, try the Adolphus! These guys know how to do it right!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and The French Room is dining at its very best.”
Reviews.Author: evenpargolf
Reviews.Content: My wife and i have stayed at the Adolphus several times and it is a great hotel in downtown Big D. Rooms are big and very clean, staff is courteous and helpful. The French Room is without equal in dining pleasure. Food is unequaled, waitstaff is highly trained and knowlegeable. Wine list is extensive. When we are in Dallas going to the Adolphus and The French Room is a must.

Reviews.Title: “A little disapointed”
Reviews.Author: jkbrill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent one night at the Adolphus to celebrate our anniversary and all in all we were underwhelmed. To the hotels credit a great downtown location, courteous and helpful staff, large rooms, comfortable bed, beautiful and common areas. Dinner at the French Room was excellent. This is an old hotel so we have a support column in our room which totally messes with the flow of the room. So despite the room being large, the there were minor inconviences like the television was not convenient to the sitting area or the bed. The tub and comode were an awkward mocha color, this is not a big deal, but it does date the room. Of more concern, there was a large stain on the carpet in our room and smaller stains on the throw pillow on the bed. Stains happen and at a mid-level motel it is too be expected, but I think this is not acceptable at the level the Adolphus purports to be. Most upsetting, the hotel is tremedously understaffed at certain times. From the momenth I walked downstairs to check-out until I was in my car on my way was over 45 minutes. This was mostly due to long waits for the valets and about a 10 wait in line at reception to check-out. We will be back to the French Room again, but I do not expect us to stay at the Adolphus. The best parts of the hotel are available with out being a guest and our room experience fell flat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved the Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: VivaRobVegas
Reviews.Content: I booked the Adolphus with high expectations after reading several reviews, and was not disappointed. The staff were extremely friendly and gracious, and they were a perfect accompaniment to the grand lobby areas. Our room was enormous with a separate living area and represented excellent value for money, with the very comfortable bed & pillows affording superb sleep. The bathroom was spacious, although the water pressure in the shower not so fantastic - a problem I have enountered at several hotels throughout the US. Other than that I couldn't fault the hotel, and its ideal location to downtown attractions allowed short walks to all there was to see.

Reviews.Title: “Not so much”
Reviews.Author: Jisten1
Reviews.Content: I blew off the not so great reviews and decided to book here anyway. The location of the hotel is great, within a short walk to taxi ride to all the hot spots in Uptown / Downtown. The exterior of the building is beautiful and steeped in history, as this hotel is a historical property. We arrived at around 6:45pm, well after the 3pm check in time. Parking is $24 for valet, so skip that and park in the parking garage north of the hotel where it's only $6. Checking in at 7pm, guess what? Room is not ready. Told by Aaron he would call housekeeping to check on the room, and in 30 minutes he would call me and let me know the room is clean. Guess what? An hour later, no call. Walk to front desk, told still not ready. Unacceptable! 4 hours after check in and my room is not ready? Unacceptable. Realizing we were not happy, a lessor room located on floor 4 was given to us, as well as a $50 food/beverage allowance. This was cool on their part, and we used this quickly in the bar. Overall the place is ok. It's quite dated inside, and there are many quirks to the place. I will likely think twice about booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “Badly in need of an upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: cameraman612
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adolphus while attending a conference in Dallas. It is one of the closest hotels to the convention center, which is a 10 minute walk away. However, except for the convenience, and the elegant public spaces on the first floor, there is not much to recommend this hotel. Some specific things that travelers should know about. 1) My room (809, if someone from the Adolphus is reading this) was very spacious, but had numerous problems. The air conditioning unit was so loud that I had to turn the power off just so that I could get to sleep at night (fortunately, I was not in Dallas during its run of 100 degree days). There was no light switch near the door, so when I came back at night, I had to hope I could race over to one of the lamps on the other side of the room before the door closed and left me in total darkness. And the plumbing was a real mess: water in the shower, even at the lowest setting, was too hot to stand under. Even the water coming out of the cold water tap at the sink was warm. Maybe I should have traded rooms with the reviewer who complained that they had no hot water at all. 2) The cleaning staff clearly wasn't paying attention to what they were doing. I was there for two nights, and when I got in the shower the second morning, I discovered that the cleaning staff had removed the partially used shampoo and conditioner bottles I had left there the day before, without replacing them with new ones. It would have been perfectly fine if they had left the old ones there, since they were still more than half full. But as it was, I only had the bar soap to wash my hair with. They also didn't replace the coffee for the coffee maker, but since I wasn't soaking wet in the shower when I discovered that, I was able to call housekeeping to send a replacement. It was clear that the room hadn't been vacuumed in a while either; there were several large crumbs on the carpet. 3) The front desk was also a disappointment. I got to the hotel early , and my room was not ready. They took my cell number and told me they would call as soon as it was ready. I explained that this was important, since I had planned on taking a conference call from my room that afternoon. As the time got closer and I still hadnâ€™t heard from them, I called the hotel to find out how much longer it would take. They told me that the room was already ready, they just hadnâ€™t called. The bottom line is this: If you are there for a convention center event like I was, and aren't going to spend much time in the room, the Adolphus may be perfectly adequate. But if you are in Dallas for any other reason, I have to think that you could do much better than this sorry place..

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: Kelli G
Reviews.Content: Stayed this past weekend at The Adolphus in Dallas. It is a beautiful hotel with amazing customer service. Everything from our greeting at check-in to room service, and check-out was absolutely fabulous. Phillip, Anabal, Tim and Mauricio were so accommodating. The atmosphere was great--there were several weddings and wedding receptions at the hotel this weekend. Our room was very clean, our bed linens were immaculate and smelled so fresh! The beds were extremely comfortable. The bathroom was very clean and did not seem like a "hotel" bathroom. I loved the antique fixtures and furniture present throughout the room and hotel. I can't wait to go back to Dallas, I'll definitely be staying at the Adolphus again!

Reviews.Title: “Slightly Past Due Date”
Reviews.Author: gwcala
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent overnight stay in downtown Dallas. Although well-maintained, the hotel needs to be freshened. The price is a very good deal for the location. One major complaint was the lack of staffing at the front desk -- checkout took 15 minutes because there was only one clerk on duty during the "morning rush.". I felt sorry for the clerk -- who was exceedingly polite and efficient -- but the delay was infuriating.

Reviews.Title: “Experience the Best”
Reviews.Author: June P
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Adolphus is a guarantee for those looking for a hotel that is truly a cut above the chain hotels of our time. The sincerity, graciousness and endless gratitude of the staff is uncomparable. Each and everyone of them go out of their way to somehow make you feel special and ensure that your every need is being met and your expectations are exceeded. We love staying at the hotels of "yesteryear" because you get everything that the big chains offer PLUS the treatment from a time when guests were truly treated with appreciation. Most importantly, do not leave without experiencing The French Room. It should have its own category for food, ambience and waitstaff. Superb!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Experience”
Reviews.Author: AussieLadyBug
Reviews.Content: I have just recently returned home from the USA back to Melbourne Australia. This hotel experience was nothing short of a nightmare during my stay! First of all we were allocated a room, after settling in and unpacking ect we decided to have a shower. There was no hot water. After calling reception up to 5 times to try and have this sorted they decided to inform us that they were having problems with the right side of the hotel so they would upgrade us to another room on the other side of the hotel. So we packed up at 10pm and moved rooms. As for the upgrade that did not happen, just a different lay out of furniture in the room! My next issue with this hotel was the house keeping. They were very slack leaving our room unmade up to 5:30pm-6:00pm both nights. Only when we called the reception they had our room made up for us. On the second occassion she made the beds but did not empty the bins nor hung our towels up (left them in a pile in the bathroom) nor gave us fresh drinking glasses!!!! Our key cards kept deactivating so we often had to visit reception and have them reset! And finally on return home I noticed $280.00USD was missing from my credit card. They "thought" we over stayed a night so took this amount off my card! After a phone call (at my cost) we are currently having this resolved and credited back onto my card. The only positive I can add about this hotel is the complementary driver "Dave" who was a pleasure to ride with.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and comfort”
Reviews.Author: sfhauser
Reviews.Content: This beautifully elegant hotel made a stressful visit to Dallas (for medical reasons) ever so pleasant. The hotel staff helped with a little "happy" for my husband upon welcome (it being his birthday), and everyone was extremely friendly and pleasant. The room was lovely; the bed quite comfortable. It's location is very good for proximity to medical facilities, restaurants and touristy kind of things as well. Loved the history; loved the Steinway piano and fabulous chandeliers!

Reviews.Title: “OU - TX Weekend 2011”
Reviews.Author: Carter J
Reviews.Content: I had a very good experience at this hotel the weekend of OU-Texas 2011. I have nothing but positive things to say with a few exceptions. The positives of my stay included the ambiance of the hotel, the courteousness of the staff, and the spacious room. One complaint that I have is that there were too few staff available at check in. I understand that this is one of the busiest hotel weekends of the year, but it is for precisely this reason that more staff are needed. My other complaint has to do with the elevator situation. It seemed that the elevator bank had four or five elevators, but I recall only two ever working. This definitely needs to be fixed. Overall though I enjoyed my stay and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus is my choice hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Leonard-Montreal
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is a legend in the hospitality business â€“ be sure to book early during the many periods it is hard to find a room. It is always my first choice and my second is the Ritz and Crescent which are farther away from the center. The W is great and modern but I find the rooms smaller â€“ great Spa though. The Adolphus is only 2 blocks from the flagship Neiman Marcus store in the revitalized downtown near all art and sports venues. A restaurants row with great steakhouses, Mexican restaurants within two blocks - but donâ€™t miss The French Room at the Adolphus - a gourmet formal dining with refined cuisine with an extensive wine list â€“ awarded a rare 5 stars status, rated best restaurant in TX.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WineLover1122
Reviews.Content: This hotel is amazingly beautiful, and a great deal for the price. They have wonderful room service, and a car to take you to other places near downtown. Would totally stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “The Place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: C N
Reviews.Content: The caring staff, hotel ambiance, and downtown location of the Adolphus make this an ideal place to stay when visiting Dallas. We stayed for 3 nights and the entire experience including service, dining, complimentary drivers, and the room accomodations made for a perfect getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice for Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: pirateparrot
Reviews.Content: We recently went to Dallas for the first time and did not know what to expect and we chose to stay at the Adolphus based on TA reviews and we were not disappointed. Very nice place to stay downtown. A beautiful and impressive classic hotel. Everyone on staff was friendly and helpful and they made our stay a good one. For an old historic hotel, the rooms were quite large and nicely appointed. Recently renovated and there is no "old hotel smell." We got a great rate and were pleased to also receive free breakfast coupons for the Bistro - which was a nice surprise. The hotel room was spacious, modern, new comfy king bed, nice bath & bath amenities, in-room coffee, mini-bar, good wireless connection, large walk-in closet, great views of the city, close to many things including the JFK memorial site, the Dart train station (2 blocks away) which made getting to and from the State Fair a breeze. The hotel is also close to several great places to dine in case their French Room is not your cup of tea. Everyone on staff was nice and helpful. Valet pakring was also easy. We would stay here again and we can also recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Lori S
Reviews.Content: Brought a group of friends to celebrate a 60th B-day and had a blast! Ate at Walt Garrisons and Loved it! Reviews were mixed, so we really didn't know what to expect. But, the staff was friendly, service was great, and the food was fabulous!! Breakfast at the Bistro was also great!! We do not recommend The Bar, next to The French Room. Service was real slow. Also, when we checked into the hotel, our room was not ready. We were very pleased with the room we received, but really didn't have the extra time it took to wait for a room. We were also shocked by the overnight parking fee. It was over $20/night, that we thought should have been included in the room fee. Overall, we were very pleased and will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it again”
Reviews.Author: fairydancer19
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really beautiful, when you walk in you would expect to be paying an arm and a leg, but really it was quite affordable given the gorgeous, spacious rooms and the upscale decor. This was my second stay at the Adolphus, and I will keep booking trips here for sure. There is a starbucks right downstairs across the street, and many resteraunts within walking distance. The hotel car was also able to take us (free of charge) to the Palladium Ballroom and the House of Blues. The staff was very friendly, I was able to check in early and check out late, which really made my trip perfect. Room service was pricey but delicious.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: SCTravelGuy
Reviews.Content: Recently, I spent three days at the Adolphus for a business meeting. If given the choice, I will always choose an old, classic hotel over something new and modern. Hotels of this age, like the Drake in Chicago, typically have grand and glorious public areas, wonderful service and good restaurants, but the rooms are usually small and frankly a little shabby. That is what I expected with the Adolphus, but that is certainly not what I encountered. I will break down my observations: Rooms: The rooms FAR surpassed my expectations. They had clearly been renovated fairly recently. The furnishings were newer, and the bathroom was great. I was in a standard room with two double beds, and it was much larger than I had expected. If you've read my reviews before, you know that I'm extremely picky about water pressure in the shower, and old hotels typically rate TERRIBLY in this regard. I am pleased to report that the Adolphus has great showers. In fact, if I hadn't just renovated my bathroom, I would inquire as to the types of shower heads they have - that's how good they were. Even the linens were great. Sometimes in nice hotels, you get towels that are obviously older, but these all seemed brand new. Public Spaces: This hotel has absolutely fabulous lobby areas. Dark woods, high ceilings, nice furniture and antiques abound. I spent much time between my meetings just enjoying the surroundings in the lobby. It would be a great spot to meet friends for coffee or just to chat. Meeting Rooms: My group had meetings in several of the ballrooms, and our meeting sizes ranged from about 15 people up to as many as 200 at one time, and the hotel accommodated them all wonderfully. A/V setups were very good. Food: My one regret from my stay was that I did not get the chance to eat at the French Room. Several in my group said that the meals they had there during our stay were absolutely incredible. I will say that the food served to our group for breakfast, lunch and as appetizers at our nightly cocktail party was exceptional. Oftentimes, the "banquet" type food at these meetings is mediocre at best, but this was certainly very good. Location: I will confess that I am a stranger to Dallas. This was my first time to the city other than a layover at DFW. The hotel seemed to be in the middle of the business district, but as all my meetings were at the hotel, that was somewhat irrelevant. I did go out for dinner both nights, and both times, we had to take a taxi to get to the restaurants, but others in my group did walk to some nearby options. The surrounding streets seem to clear out after business hours, so I don't know that there are lots of entertainment options within walking distance. I may be wrong on that, though. Service: This is what really sets the hotel apart. I probably encountered 30 different staff members over three days, and they were all exceptional. From the front desk, to the shoe shine guy (who does a great job), to the bellhop and even the housekeeping people whom I passed in the hall: everyone was polite and helpful. I even witnessed someone in my group ask a passing staff member, "where can I get a cup of coffee?" (it was about 4 PM and we were between meetings). The staff member said, "I'll be happy to get you one, how do you take it?" And one minute later, he appeared with the coffee. This is indicative of the level of service that I perceive the Adolphus expects from their staff. Everyone appears very eager to please, and that's a key aspect of a great hotel. Overall, this is a wonderful hotel. If I make it back to Dallas, I will make every effort to give them my business. I stay in probably 10 upmarket hotels per year, and the Adolphus is the best I have encountered in quite some time. If I take time to write a review, it's either because there is something wrong or it was just a great experience. The Adolphus was definitely the latter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but stay spoilt by over night road works”
Reviews.Author: Scooby1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight during a stopover in Dallas. The hotel was fine except that we had to endure roadworks outside the hotel that virtually lasted all night. I suppose that's not the hotels fault, but I would have appreciated some warning.

Reviews.Title: “Two Days at the Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: Joe K
Reviews.Content: The hotel was first class. The decor and surroundings were really classy. I did not get to eat in the Green Room but had a look at the restaurant and the bar area - they looked fantastic. We did eat in the diner/bar and this provided a nice contrast from the hotel. The staff were very friendly and the prices reasonable (had been in Vegas prior to this). The concierge staff were so friendly and knowledgeable. Service at breakfast was very slow, in fact the second day a member of our party walked out as he didnt want to wait any more (hardly the end of the world). Overall a great experience - I would definitely stop here if I came to Dallas again - ideal location for JFK/Book depository which was the reason for my visit.

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus Dallas, TX stay”
Reviews.Author: amerfam6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus with our 4 children in connecting rooms; they were the most spacious accommodations we have ever had traveling altogether! The hotel is beautiful!! It has a lot of old world charm and grace, and it is conveniently located downtown. We were able to easily walk around to shops and restaurants. We attended a family wedding at the nearby Dallas Arboretum--also gorgeous! The only hitch was that we had to wait an hour to check in as our rooms were not ready. That pressured us for time to get ready for the event. Otherwise, we really enjoyed our stay, and we would definitely stay there again. Also, the hotel staff were welcoming and friendly to our children throughout the hotel, including the bistro and the cowboy grill.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Anne C
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel three times. I always have had a great experience. The staff is friendly and helpful. The rooms are beautiful, plenty of outlets for computer etc. The bed was very comfy, with wonderful linens; I felt like a princess sleeping there. My stays have been business related the food at the meetings has been very good. Its nice to stay at an old nostalgic hotel. It reminds me a bit of the Brown Palace in Denver. First class all the way.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend at the Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: hugezeppelinfan
Reviews.Content: We planned a weekend getaway in Dallas a few months ago that included seeing the Broadway Musical "Hair" as well as some friends and family. We looked for a nice nostalgic hotel and the Adolphus seemed to fit the bill.
