We checked in and were told that the Deluxe King we had booked through Hotels.com was no longer available and that the hotel did not have to honor the confirmation as it was made through a "3rd party". We were a litlle put out as my wire and I had never slept together in a "regular-sized bed". Overall the Hotel was nice and our bellman Anibal was very nice and informative. We had read that the garage was slow in retrieving vehicles, but they were very busy while we were there, and we never waited for our car over 5 mins. We used the hotel's free sedan service (Lincoln Town Car) on tow occasions: 1. We met friends at House of Blues for dinner, 2. Broadway Musical "Hair" at the Windspear Theatre. Our driver was very nice and helpful. We think that the Adolphus was a great value and would tell others if you are going to Dallas, it is a very nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Old world style, modern comfort...”
Reviews.Author: laylahouse
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus combines old world grace and elegance with free wi-fi and a cold a/c! The staff is amazing and we felt like they were truly glad we were there. The bath room, an era of it's own, is huge. And the shower... I want one at home! If I had a complaint, it would be that there is no mirror outside of the restroom so when my husband was showering, I couldn't see in the foggy mirrors! And what kind of complaint is that?? I CANNOT wait to come back... Big bed. Down pillows and comforter. Big HD tv... Iphone with an ambiance app connected to the alarm clock to block out any Dallas noise for sleeping in! I would have stayed another night except for a sick child at home. LOVED it!

Reviews.Title: “thoratec conference”
Reviews.Author: kay r
Reviews.Content: hotel clean, comfortable lacked any outdoor space even a courtyard NO POOL

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer L
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus was wonderful in so many ways, but the main reason I think it stands above and beyond is that the staff is incredibly friendly. I mean they are really really nice. And all of them. The hotel, of course, is beautiful. I'm crazy about the bath soap and I hope to find that shower curtain for my own home. Very clean and the most incredible water pressure in a shower that I have ever experienced. Easily ranks up there with the Mission Inn, the Plaza, and the Awahanee - each unique in their respective ways, and each easily considered a home away from home. I realize that no review will be taken 100% seriously that has nothing bad to say...I really don't, but if I had to...I would warn potential guests that the rooms have been re-modeled. In the 80's if memory serves me correctly. Therefore certain elements of the rooms themselves veer from the 1912 decor and feel. They are still very tasteful. We cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Grand old (classic) hotel, elegant”
Reviews.Author: brokerdt1
Reviews.Content: Elegant and style permeates this great hotel. feels like era gone by. my room was ready early (1:30 on Friday afternoon) and it is very large (particularly for downtown). large bathroom room with both tub/shower combo and a separate shower. The French Room restaurant is high end and highly rated, but is priced as such. Location is excellent, walking distance to Kennedy Memorial / Dealy Plaza, DART train, West End District and bars / restaurants. Free WiFi in the room is nice touch. Like a vintage house or car (or person), it will have wear and limits, but if you accept that as character this is the place for you. I booked it through Travelocity two days in advance and got a great price.

Reviews.Title: “IMPRESSIVE FROM MOMENT ONE”
Reviews.Author: Gayle P
Reviews.Content: REALLY A SPECIAL EXPERIENCE. The hotel is a a landmark rich with history and beauty. From the moment we walked into the hotel we were wowed and felt at home. The friendly service here is totally impressive and totally for real! We were welcomed by the front desk, received a tour of the hotel and the area when our bellman brought our bags to our room. Room was spacious and very nice - becuase of my Fine Hotel and Resort affiliation we received an upgrade to a suite. the next morning the Front Desk person approached me to ask how my room was as he overheard our flight was late and we had a lot of work to do. Room service was teriffic as was breakfast at the Bistro restaurant - both food and service. You've got to try the Rodeo bar - the decor depicts Texas and food is also wonderful. The hotel also offers driver service within a 2 mile radius - much easier than taking your car out and finding parking. Lastly you MUST experience The French Room restaurant. A dinner and special night to remember - like being on vacation just with this experience alone. I can't wait to return - this hotel does it all. BTW - this hotel can be a one stop shop for food and beverage. I have been to Dallas serveral times and have experienced many fine hotels and restaurants - definitley not to be underestimated but The Adolphus is totally special because of it's people. Most everyone that we spoke to had been there no less than 17 years - that is quite remarkable in the hotel, food and beverage industry. They take pride in their workplace and it shows. PS - Neiman Marcus is 2 doors down and a MUST. Their service is top notch too.

Reviews.Title: “Experience in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Mukoace
Reviews.Content: This hotel runs like a top and the history of the hotel was something I found very interesting. Beautiful, grand baronial lobby, it was the perfect location for touring downtown. We could walk to the Dart rail system and get to anywhere we wanted to go downtown. My favorite place was the Rodeo Bar Down stairs. Such a great atmosphere. Adolphus staff to be courteous and very helpful. Any question, they were ready to answer. The price on this location was so resonable and worth every penny. You can get comfortable even in such a fancy hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old world hotel, a can't miss if you need to be in downtown Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: MJandDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adolphus Hotel in Dallas while in town for the for 2011 NABE Annual Meeting. This is a beautiful old world hotel with lots of wood and brass furnishings and plenty of comfy couches in the lobby. The hotel rooms were enormous and the meeting rooms for the event were quite nice as well. The staff at the front desk, the bell stand, the banquet team, and everyone I met from the Adolphus (except for the gal in the business center) were all extremely helpful. The only drawback, which was no one's fault, is the rooms were not ready at check-in time. Certainly take a look at the Adolphus if you need to stay in downtown Dallas for any reason. It has a personality and style all its own!

Reviews.Title: “Retreat from Life”
Reviews.Author: Rested304
Reviews.Content: I had a one night stay to relax and unwind. I did just as the doctor ordered, restful night with room service----and I even got some shopping at Neiman Marcus. Service excellent and friendly employees.

Reviews.Title: “Service Beyond Belief!”
Reviews.Author: JayJay1971
Reviews.Content: As usual this hotel did not disappoint. My wife and I stayed here for her 40th Birthday and upon arrival we were given a letter from the hotel manager wishing her a happy birthday. An hour after we were settled into our room a platter of chocolate covered strawberries and chocolates with a card wishing her a happy birthday made of chocolate arrived! I had one of the employees bring a cake out during afternoon tea and play happy birthday to her on the hundred year plus old piano as a surprise. They made everything special. The concierge is very knowledgeable and can give you advice on local events and attractions at the drop of a hat. Hands down the best hotel in Dallas and would give any hotel in New York or Chicago a run for its money!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: TravelDreamer1992
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here before about five years ago and had a much better experience. This time when we arrived they gave us a deluxe room instead of the suite we paid for. We called down to the front to have our room changed and they said they would send up a bellhop who never arrived. We finally moved ourselves because we had dinner reservations. Once we got to the new room we found two burned out lights. The ac could never get the room below about 72 and the sink and bathtub poured very hot water no matter whether you turned on hot or cold. We stayed here for two nights for our anniversary. Overall it was a very nice room for a good rate but the little things added up to a disappointing experience. Most of the staff was very helpful with the exception of the registrar who blamed us for the room issue because she said we said yes when she asked if we had a "king" room. Apparently a King room is a room type not a bed type at the Adolphus

Reviews.Title: “Great historic building”
Reviews.Author: LassiComeHome
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 night and really like the hotel - has old world charm, building is old so it means all rooms are different, solid walls so you can't hear anyone in other rooms, etc. On checking in I was given a room that looked out at another building - look out the windo and you get a view of bricks - which I was not happy with. I rang down and they changed me to a suite - complimentary upgrade - so I was quite happy with that. The rooms are nice but the bathrooms a little old - and lighting not great. The couch in the rooms looked like it needed a clean. Everything else was very good - very comfortable bed, and great big room. The bar downstairs is nice - but service average. Location is good - central downtown and you can walk to many restaurants etc. All in all a very good hotel I would be prepared to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Paul L
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus Hotel has always set the standard of excellence and customer service for hotels in Dallas and the region. Throughout all of these years and even with several different owners of the hotel, the excellent service has remained consistent and top tier. This consistency is due to the fact that many of the executive staff have been on property for twenty plus years. My wife and I always enjoy an in town getaway at The Adolphus. We would highly recommend The Adolphus to anyone who is planning to stay in downtown Dallas. It will become your favorite as well.

Reviews.Title: “It's a wonderful world only 30 miles from home.”
Reviews.Author: Doris T
Reviews.Content: the magnificence of the hotel is evident the moment you walk in the door. The graciousness of the staff is evident before that when you drive up. The bed is so comforting and comfortable. The rooms are up-to-date while keeping with the old magnificence of the hotel overall. The French Room is a dream restaurant. I have eaten there many times over the course of 20 years and every time the food and service have been impeccable. After staying at hundreds of hotels, the Adolphus is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on our wedding night and it was absolutely lovely. My husband and I absolutely love downtown Dallas and this was the cherry on top. Albeit I did have some trouble at check in since you need a credit card and id to gain access to a room (I had the veil, the dress and the shoes but forgot my purse!) but after a phone call or two I got the room so I could finish getting ready. We even got a nice coffee cake from the bartender for the next morning. Everyone was polite and helpful and my husband and I hope to stay there again for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Old School, and wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: noblehousecatering
Reviews.Content: You won't confuse this with one of the new box hotels. It is rich in design and history with heavy woods and luxurious fabrics. A step back in time that I just love. A very professional staff leaves you wanting for nothing and makes you feel like a king.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong, if you like history!”
Reviews.Author: Skyler N
Reviews.Content: Great staff, amazingly historical lobby, bar, restaurant and rooms! The grand piano in the lobby is a 9-foot hand-carved Steinway that was supposed to be on the Titanic apparently.. We stayed in a Junior Suite, which was spacious and well worth the upgrade if you like to lounge and order room service etc. No smoking in the rooms, of course.. so be prepared to bust out the rastablock. No ice machines on the floors either, so stock up at the 7eleven around the corner :)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful old world charm hotel”
Reviews.Author: chitowntink
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just one night for business and felt very welcomed. Huge rooms with a separate seating area. Loved the location for downtown and the feel of the old Texas charm. The hotel was pre paid by my company but they still authorized my credit card for the full amount which didn't make me happy, they said it was just if I used anything but to authorize the full amount of $230? However, they did deliver a great welcome gift of fruit and bottled water!

Reviews.Title: “Nice historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: abrunot
Reviews.Content: The rooms are quite large, nicely appointed but the hotel is quite old and has old infrastructure, for example when I turn on the cold water in the sink hot water comes out. The room has a musky smell. Overall the place is fine, staff is professional and nice. Building is beautiful, it just seems like it must be a struggle to maintain high standards with such an old building- staff probably has to work extra hard. The area surronding the hotel is very very quite on the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “First Class!”
Reviews.Author: strawberryfamily
Reviews.Content: Rooms in this hotel were very spacious. We truly enjoyed our stay. Loved that we could walk to nearby places to shop, eat, and to attend Mass.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back”
Reviews.Author: Jody A
Reviews.Content: We will be back. Love the hotel I was not disappoint. But I have one complaint your cleaning grew need to Clean air filters in rooms. My room was very HOT!!!!!! Until I remove the air filter.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel but housekeeping lets it down”
Reviews.Author: fionajustin
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the very grand old Adolphus hotel. Despite not being in the nicest part of town the Hotel itself is just lovely. It has a fantastic gym and the saloon/bar downstairs has wonderful service and great meals. Concierge are just lovely and extremely helpful - special mention of Jimmy who is a fountain of knowledge and obviously loves what he does. The disappointing part of our stay is the housekeeping. When we checked in there was (and three days later is still) a bar of used soap under the sink which housekeeping have missed (yet I spotted the minute we walked in). Whilst I am keen to participate in laundry saving initiatives our sheets haven't been changed throughout our stay (despite evident strawberry stains courtesy of our three year old). We also reported that our fridge wasn't working well on the first night and we were told someone would attend to it but that still hasn't happened. There are also other minor things like not replacing soap and leaving the toilet paper all but empty - along with a strange habit of dumping rubbish and dirty linen in the hallways when cleaning the rooms. Other than that the rooms are well equipped, the free high-speed internet is great as is the complimentary town car and driver. If we came back to Dallas we'd probably stay in the nicer uptown area off McKinney Street somewhere but if we wanted to stay downtown I wouldn't have any hesitation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unadulterated luxury, great staff and huge amazing rooms”
Reviews.Author: mkellis
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and right from the beginning I was treated like a VIP! The hotel is gorgeous and had such class. The staff were beyond helpful and bent over backwards to make my stay so memorable. My room was huge, as was the bathroom even though the bellman assured me it was one of the smaller rooms they have. It had a huge bed, a whole separate seating area with sofa and desk with chair and also an easy chair. The hotel provides a sedan service within 3 miles and was an incredible service with a fabulous car used it to go to Hoffbrau steakhouse in the west end which was a really good meal and the 6th floor museum, about jfk and assassination was done very well. Thanks to all the staff for such a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel grandeur with fabulous downtown location”
Reviews.Author: chefvegas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a throwback to the classic grandeur of hotels of yesteryear. The lobby and mezzanine floors are adorned with beautiful hard woods and lovely decor accents. Check-in was very smooth and the room clean and comfortable. Large marble bath, flat-screen TV and minibar (albeit with customary horrendous prices). The only negative, and this only happened once, was on a Friday night getting the car out of valet -- took over a half hour! They were quite apologetic, and all other times (we were there for over a week) it was very quick. Once suggestion - the hallways seem to be abnormally stark for such a beautiful hotel. With such a beautiful lobby and rooms, a little extra attention in the halls wouldn't hurt - though, it was by no means an impact on my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Always excellent”
Reviews.Author: ChrystinP
Reviews.Content: We live in Dallas and occasionally stay at the Adolphus just for fun. It is an impeccable hotel in every way. Staff are professional, courteous, extremely helpful in making sure guests needs are met. An unexpected bonus this trip was discovering a 7-11 has opened on a corner opposite of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: v t
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel, maybe 3 or 3 1/2 the most. I understand the old/historical stuff but the hotel is just not to the part. I had to wait more than 10 mins until the valet recognized me (it's not cheap; 24/night) and after such annoying start I can't believe he still expect any tips... I did not tip him and sure enough he was not friendly. The room itself is pretty big but the a/c was not working. It is about 105 outside and the room stays around 80/85. The bed sheet/pillow case was dirty. A lot of spot as well as blood stain on the pillow case. After calling the front desk the maid arrived about 30 mins and come to find out that she did not bring enough to change the set.... They do provide complementary shuttle service within 3 miles which is the only good service I received during the stay. After the wonderful dinner at the French Room (the best dinner of my life; totally worth it), when I am finally ready to take shower to find out bogus on my shower curtain.... It needs a lot of improvement at the front as well as the house keeping.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: travelingcircus38
Reviews.Content: Had a great weekend stay for LSU vs Oregon and shopping. Scored a $99 rate on hotels.com. Large room with full size sofa and sitting area. The building is beautiful. Fun bar area, and lots of places to sit, sip coffee, surf the net, etc. If you're an early riser and your spouse is not. Did not make res for French Room, and high tea was sadly on an Aug break. Plan to return to do both.

Reviews.Title: “would love to experience the hotel again! Loved the beds!”
Reviews.Author: alynnxaja
Reviews.Content: Hope I have the opportunity to enjoy this great hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “It was Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: sara a
Reviews.Content: Go to the V-Spa and get a pedicure and manaciure! it is so close to everything too!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classic Hotel...would return”
Reviews.Author: Hkdrvm22
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so beautiful and full of character. Very romantic lookng hotel with tons of lounge and sitting area on the main floor. Workout facility is small but perfectly equipt. The staff was so friendly and helpful you couldn't ask for more. Overall great value for your money and perfectly situated to great restaurants at walking distance. STARBUCKS on the corner and 7-11 on the other.

Reviews.Title: “Women Of Faith”
Reviews.Author: Laura T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adolphus Hotel on 8-26-11 to 8-27-11. I had the most amazing time staying in the hotel. The staff was excellent and very friendly. This was my second time staying in the hotel. The first time that I stayed in this hotel was last year when I attended the Women of Faith conference at the American Airline Center. I will definely tell all my friends and family to stay at the Adolphus hotel next time that they are in Dallas. The bed were the best part. I've never had a more relaxing sleep then sleeping in the beds at the Adolphus Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at a grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jfersmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus while in Dallas to attend an event at the convention center. Wonderful, elegant old hotel. Lobby was grand, rooms were clean and well appointed. Service staff was great. Everyone we encountered was friendly and ready to answer any questions. We were within walking distance of the convention center and several downtown restaurants. Our room was comfortable, spacious and clean. We enjoyed sitting in the lobby for a bit on Saturday evening listening to the piano music. The only negative comment I have is that we had to call for a bucket of complimentary ice, wait for it to arrive and tip the guy brining it. The Adolphus was a bit pricier than we normally pay for a hotel stay but was well worth the extra price for the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a great location!”
Reviews.Author: gemflanagan
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 2 nights and it was our first trip to Dallas. The location was great, really central and close to Dealy Plaza and Neiman Marcus is just around the corner! Our room was really big which we were really happy about as we had got a really good deal for a basic room on hotels.com - if the room we got is the 'basic' one it was fantastic! There was a large living area with TV, fridge, tea/coffee facilities etc. We would have liked however if there had been an in room safe, just to keep our passports etc safe. The staff were all very nice and friendly and we would definately stay here again if we return to Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Quite simply, The Adolphus is my favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: DLW5
Reviews.Content: There are never bad surprises here. Everything is the way you expect it to be or even better. Search for a poorly trained staff member. You won't find one. It is a grand hotel where you will be treated like a special guest or even family.

Reviews.Title: “Very "old money" but fancy!”
Reviews.Author: pinkfairywand
Reviews.Content: A few friends and I holed up at the Adolphus during a convention in downtown Dallas. Obviously it has a bit of a reputation in the big D, and as it's home to the French Room, I had pictured something out of a ritzy hotel in a movie. It was definitely fancier than I'm used to! The first floor is very dark and very old school, with lots of stained wood and dim lighting and high ceilings. Upon arrival, the man at reception who checked us in sort of treated me like I was a criminal or that I was somehow doing something underhanded -- admittedly, I'd accidentally booked the name under my old last name instead of my current one. Instead of immediately asking me to provide information on the reservation (my address, my email, etc), he acted as if there wasn't anything he could do to verify it. It was easily solved after I just stood there and told him to verify me some other way, but really? Come on man. Also, when I reserved the room, I requested a room with a balcony as I'd read other customers had done. He didn't mention it at all when we checked in and so no, we weren't given one. (One of the girls smokes.) Our room was large and more than roomy enough for the four of us. The mini-bar can double as a mini-fridge in a pinch. The services we needed were all taken care of almost immediately, from an extra robe/towels to sending someone up to uncork our wine for us. The concierge suggested us to a delicious BBQ place nearby and even provided us with a discount -- and not a tacky coupon, either, just his name to mention when we arrived. (Swanky!) In the event you don't have a lot of money to toss around, I recommend checking on the Adolphus' rates next time you want a little getaway. We got a steal on a room without even using a third-party company to book it. The interior may be a tad bit dated, but if it's good enough for the Queen and rock stars, it's good enough for me. I heard someone mention that one of the elevators is supposedly haunted. Cool!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, larger room in a dated hotel”
Reviews.Author: TominPlano
Reviews.Content: Our room, 423, was very large, clean and comfortable. The amenities included a comfortable king size bed, typical mini-bar, bath with two separate marble-topped vanities, and a powerful, quick-to-get-hot shower. The bedding and towels were clean, with no real surprises. However, if you're looking for up-to-date interior design, or even 10 year old up-to-date interior design, you'll be very disappointed. If our room is typical, you'll find a comfortable, clean room, desperately in need of any design solution you'd see in a typical HGTV program. Yes, this is a 99 year old hotel, and a great landmark in Dallas, with a wonderful history. It would be even more wonderful it the owners spent the investment needed to make the rooms worthy of the historic past, while acknowledging today's traveler's tastes and needs.

Reviews.Title: “An awesome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: bettyjean_larson2009
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus Hotel is one of a kind! Checking in and out was absolutely smooth, and handled by efficient and helpful staff. Everything I asked for was in my room, and the room was clean, smelled really nice, and was more than comfortable. The location was perfect, as the business I came to visit was located in the Adolphus Tower, attached to the hotel. However, I would stay at the Adolphus again regardless of where I was visiting because I rarely find service and amenities as nice as this hotel. I was pleased to be able to have dinner in The French Room, which is definitely not an experience to be missed. The waiter(s) were amazing as was the food and ambience. I also enjoyed a lunch at the Bistro - great food and service there as well. I definitely plan to go back to the Adolphus, this time taking my husband, to enjoy a lovely relaxing weekend away! HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay any where else when I am in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: dory z
Reviews.Content: We came 4th of July weekend, and I know traveling during holidays can be tough, but he Adolphus was wonderful. We had a flat tire on the drive up, and I called the hotel to let them know we would be late checking in, and they were very gracious. Even though we finally arrived close to midnight, the staff was friendly and understanding. The rooms are beautiful and the atmosphere couldn't be better. The French Room is like a step back in time . Literally I can not say enough good things about this hotel. My boyfriend and I are planning another trip back soon, its perfect for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Very fine, but the incidentals added up.”
Reviews.Author: 54countries
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus delivers the full experience of a revered big city hotel. We were initially put off by the bustle of preparations going on for a big wedding, but our room was a spacious and beautiful haven. The room service dinner was terrific and delivered with aplomb. Casual breakfast in the bistro was equally fine. It's worth noting, however, that those meals plus valet parking added rather noticeably to the bill. No complaints, though.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Diana P
Reviews.Content: Hotel was wonderful and had a great stay. I would stay again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: shelley k
Reviews.Content: I took my granddaughter for an overnight adventure. We had a great time! The lobbies and our room were elegant and comfortable. Room service was fast, delicious, elegantly served by very professional, polite staff. Beds were very comfy, with lots of pillows. We really appreciated the complimentary car for brief trips around town. Dave was our chaffeur/ was very professional. polite, very kind to my granddaughter. Great location, downtown Dallas. Without exception the staff was professional, efficient, polite. The only drawback for us was the lack of a pool on-site; Guests have access to a pool some blocks away, for a fee. Would highly recommend this hotel, especially if pool not desired.

Reviews.Title: “Panache arrival/departure and downstairs! But relatively boring rooms... nice bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: CovertGetawayParents
Reviews.Content: Odd guestroom hallway corridor colors... teal green I think? Rooms don't have the pizazz of the downstairs areas- pretty bland, but great bathrooms with marble tile and vintage wrought iron and worn brass accents. Hang out at the bar, lounge around downstairs, then just go back to your room for a great shower and hit the sack. Nothing exciting about spending time in these rooms, though spacious. Checkout front desk guy wasn't thrilled about applying a Groupon discount- didn't ask for us to come back. Nice call-ahead valet car delivery out front on a great covered driveway- you'll feel like a star coming and going. $24 overnight valet. Recommended- great location downtown. 8/10 stay, we'll try it again.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: TexasStocktons
Reviews.Content: Elegant, comfortable, warm, and accessible! We recommend you relax in style here.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: RomaTourista
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is wonderful. The staff is very friendly & helpful, the rooms are immaculate and the hotel is gorgeous! It was very busy and appeared that they were booked to capacity but no one appeared stressed and everything ran smoothly. The location is a short walk to the convention center (even if it's 100 degrees outside). Several good restaurants are just steps from the front door. You can't go wrong if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Staff was great!”
Reviews.Author: ARF44
Reviews.Content: Booked an anniversary weekend. My wife and I loved the room and really enjoyed the classic atmosphere of the hotel. Perfect for couples wanting to get away but also experience a vibrant downtown scene. We will do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Timeless Elegance”
Reviews.Author: farrawaytravel
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 nights in August at the Adolphus hotel as part of a business event. This is my 4th year in a row to stay at this hotel and I have found that the staff has made improvements to their procedures to handle the number of people that stay for this event. The hotel is rich is rich in history and I was actually able to spend time walking around and enjoying my surroundings. The rooms are well appointed and the beds are super comfortable. Everyone on staff, from the valet to the concierge and cleaning staff are very friendly and make me feel welcomed. Overall, a wonderful hotel that truly offers timeless elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful birthday getaway”
Reviews.Author: debbielola54
Reviews.Content: I am a native Dallasite and had been to the Adolphus many times through the year - but only for meals at The French Room or for afternoon tea. This was my first time to stay in the hotel. The stay served as a very brief getaway for my husband's birthday. From the time we arrived in the parking garage until we departed, we were made to feel as if we were the only guests you had. The staff was courteous, informative and exceptionally friendly. The hotel was impeccable in its charm and history. The room was comfortably cool (in this triple-digit Dallas weather) and the accoutrements were outstanding. We were both pleasantly surprised at the size of the suite to which we were upgraded. Knowing it was my husband's birthday, we were surprised when a staff member knocked on our door to deliver a plate of chocolate-dipped strawberries, cookies and an announcement 'card' that was made out of white chocolate -- compliments of the Adolphus. The bed was comfortable, the room was quiet, room service (the next morning) was delivered with lightning speed and presented professionally. We plan to make this a tradition for years to come. Hats off to the staff at the Adolphus hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent property and service from all staff”
Reviews.Author: Champo1963
Reviews.Content: Excellent property and service from staff was first class. Historic property which retains its old world charm plus caterting for the modern day traveller. A pleasure to stay at the property.

Reviews.Title: “you really have some special people working there!”
Reviews.Author: MKeoakes
Reviews.Content: I SO appreciated Connie and her team at The French Room--I mean, I expected a fine dining experience, but they really made us feel like royalty! And Paul the bellman who's bringing Elvis back...love him and look forward to seeing him year after year!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed, will not be back!”
Reviews.Author: HARCal
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in June, 2011, during a business trip and was not impressed with the restaraunts in the hotel. it was a hot day and I went to the restaraunt and was informed that I could not eat at the restaraunt unless I wore a long shirt and tie. I was also informed the restaraunt had a fixed priced menu at $85.00 per person not including wine (well above my allowance). I can see why the only people in the restaraunt were over 70 and clearly there for a "special celebration". The only other option was the bar in the basement where the average patron age was 25 years old. The food was definitely freever pack food warmed up when ordered but there were lots of salted peanuts in the shell to be eaten and more shells on the floor, not a great environment for a relaxing meal after a long day of business. Perhaps the most disappointing experience was the bar, I went to the bar after dinner to order a glass of wine before heading to bed. I was the only parton in the bar. I waited atleast 8 to 10 minutes at the bar as the bar tender poured drinks for waitresses and cleaned his station. finally four other guests came to the bar and now he turned to provide service. I asked what white wines he had by the glass, he grabbed a one page wine menu, tossed it at me and without saying a word went to server the newly arrived guests. Once he finished serving the newly arrived guests he gave me time to order. All wine on the menu is fixed priced at $12.00. I ordered glass of Russian River Pinot Gris, the glass was poured, the last one in the bottle. i had a few sips and informed the waiter I thought the wine had turned as it had that acidy, taste and tingly feeling. The waiter tried the wine and said it was perfectly fine and questioned my knowledge of wine I tried a few more sips and side the wine was definitely bad (I live in California and we trravel to wine country a fair bit, the wine was definitely turned). . In a less than professional manner he offered me a replacement but I was too incensed at this time by the condescending attitude! Unfortunately I must say I did not sleep at all that evening as I had what I determined to be food poisoning (if you saw Bridesmaides you will get the picture). I travel a lot on business and love staying in older hotels, boutique hotels or anything out of the normal business hotel. I cannot recommend this hotel for either business or a vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Gift Shop Manager”
Reviews.Author: N2PKG4U
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was pleasant enough but the limited elevator capacity makes for a tough time getting up and down during peak hours of our convention. The maid service was also not able to accomodate us daily because the hotel was at capacity. So, out of six nights, two we did not receive maid service..............and we were not told in advance. We just walked into our room after a long work day and it was a mess. Mostly I write this to tell you to beware of the gift shop manager. He is creepy and sneaky. I purchased an item for 12.99 and he rang it up for 14.99...................when I questioned him he corrected it and then the total came out to 14.09 YET when he ran my credit card he ran it for 14.96.......................I guess the gift shop is operated separately from the Hotel but it is a poor reflection on them when its time to write a review.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but could use a few updates”
Reviews.Author: dmcc526
Reviews.Content: Add a couple of extra mirrors in the room, ie, 3 people needed to get ready and the only mirror was in the bathroom or the closet door outside of the bathroom. A mirror over the desk would have helped when we all needed to apply our makeup, etc... Although there were plenty of lamps/fixtures, the lighting was very dim.

Reviews.Title: “This is my favorite hotel in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: Gemwinner
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is exquisite! The decor is beautiful, the rooms very clean, the staff friendly and helpful, the food very good. I love that I can walk to the Convention Center from the hotel. Ihave stayed here almost every year for my Mary Kay seminar for about the past 10 years

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: daphnerharris
Reviews.Content: This hotel is conveniently located, easy to get to and exceptionally comfortable. The rooms are very large and the beds are the most comfortable I've experienced in a hotel room, as were the pillows. Not once did I hear any noise from adjacent rooms, or any in the hallway outside the room. I would go back to stay and highly recommend this hotel to all considering it.

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay at The Adolphus and I will be back”
Reviews.Author: JRega
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely beautiful, and elegant. The staff was very friendly. They went above and beyond, and handled the large mass of people that were there for the Mary Kay convention very well, and with much ease.

Reviews.Title: “Always love the Adolphus!”
Reviews.Author: mksig
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Adolphus every year for an annual convention. We have a choice of many hotels and the Adolphus is my favorite because of it's historical beauty, impeccably maintained facility and gracious staff. The staff does everything possible to ensure a wonderful stay. The hotel is decorated beautifully in rich, warm colors. I highly recommend the Adolphus to anyone staying in the downtown area. Thank you Adolphus for another wonderful visit!

Reviews.Title: “I love The Adolphus, but...”
Reviews.Author: vreadel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Adolphus many times in the last couple of years. I love the old world elegance and charm. The hotel suits me beautifully. My rooms have always been elegantly furnished, clean and appealing. I have always been extremely comfortable and satisfied. My stay on July 29 and 30 was the first negative experience I have had. The A/C in my room did not work properly. When I arrived Friday evening, I immediately noticed upon entering the room that it was warm. The thermostat was set at 70 degrees, but it was much warmer. I lowered the temp to 60 and although by morning, it did get cooler, it still was not anywhere close to 60 or even 70. I reported the problem to the front desk on my way out the next morning. Saturday evening was slightly improved, but not much. However, I do love The Adolphus and plan to stay there on my next visit to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Always a first-class experience!”
Reviews.Author: Pegs1028
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus Hotel is a jewel in the middle of Downtown Dallas. A historic icon that has been well preserved, the Adolphus offers timeless elegance and attention to every detail. The French Room offers classic European cuisine in an atmosphere that is unmatched and is reminiscent of dining in a beautiful Renaissance ballroom. Guest rooms and suites are elegant, well appointed and comfortable. Queen Elizabeth and numerous other dignitaries and Hollywood legends have been guests at the Adolphus over the years...check out their gallery of memorabilia in cases displayed near the French Room entrance.

Reviews.Title: “The lobby itself should have its own zip code!”
Reviews.Author: LincolnAdams
Reviews.Content: This was one of those occasions where Priceline didn't just come through for me, it really, REALLY came through for me. :-) I hit on an excellent winning bid of $55 a night, saw the name Adolphus pop up and hurried quickly to TripAdvisor to view its ratings: #1. Yay! Now, I assume its common knowledge that 4 star hotels and up will influence your first impressions of their establishment by luxuriously decorating their lobbies. The Adolphus lobby wasn't a lobby though: it was an extension of Buckingham Palace. I have never, in my relatively short span of traveling, seen a lobby as extravagantly decorated as this one. Huge Renaissance-like paintings and portraits graced the walls, with one section so rife with horticulture it almost seemed like they brought elements of the Safari in to help decorate the place. There is a front desk, then a gift shop, then an escalator that feeds into the heart of the lobby, at which point you have the option of choosing between three dining establishments, the highly upscale and award winning French Room, the more casual dining experience of the Bistro, and finally the Rodeo Grill and Bar. A little something for everyone. So breathtaking was this lobby that there is simply no way entering your room is not going to be an anticlimactic experience. The hotel is quite old, and while the rooms clearly shown signs of having been built in another era, it was clean, very spacious, and comfortable, including a love seat/couch, coffee table, and LCD TV. The wifi was a bit spotty though, and of course, as is typical for 4 star establishments, I had no microwave and only a fridge bar to cram some of my 2-liter bottles of soda in. Speaking of which, there is at least one supermarket within walking distance, so if you're looking to save costs on dining you'll find plenty of options nearby. Unless I missed it, I believe valet parking is the only option here, but it wasn't too bad for $24 overnight (guess I've been used to Boston and New York's absurd parking fees). It is highly, HIGHLY, convenient, partly because that part of the city had an unusually low level of traffic, even during rush hour (again, I'm drawing from my less than stellar experiences driving in Boston and New York.) I was able to easily breeze in and out of the city during all hours, making it a true pleasure to explore the region. Again, my only complaint was the wifi, and considering it was provided by AT&T that should be of absolutely no surprise to anyone. I kid... maybe. They may have been having problems during that time though, as I asked the front desk for the adaptor you need to get wired access and they were completely out of them. Wifi did seem to be MUCH better the last night I was there, but be prepared with alternatives if this is something you need to rely on. Overall, definitely would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel but not the best in handling extremely large groups”
Reviews.Author: casper567
Reviews.Content: This is a truly amazing hotel. I would definitely come back. I was there for a large group function and they were behind every day in refreshing our room and our large group check in was a disaster. With that said, they staff was truly friendly and did a great job outside of possibly being a bit overwhelmed with our event. Food was FABULOUS!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful old world elegance-recommend highly”
Reviews.Author: Knowledge45
Reviews.Content: I am a Dallasite and found myself in need of a several day hotel stay due to electrical problems this winter. This hotel is one of the quiet gems of Dallas but I had never stayed there before. . The rooms are large, the lobby extensive and old word elegant and the restaurnat and bar options incredible and diverse. Staff is also very attentive. The small bar by the French Room restaurant also offered a wonderful resting place for glass of wine before a a fire place and high tea is served in the lobby in the afternoons. The location in in the center of downtown with the flagship Neiman Marcus down the street and numersous restaurants within a few block area of the hotel The hotel rooms are reasonably priced as is the food unless you go to the very elegant and delicious French Room resaturant.

Reviews.Title: “Cool old hotel, wish someone would dump some money into this place”
Reviews.Author: FloridaJayBird
Reviews.Content: It was certainly not a splurge, as the rate for my room was very inexpensive. The hotel, was old and neat looking downstairs. I'd always wanted to stay here. The room was old, but not in a neat way, it needed to be updated and smelled a little moldy. I really do wish this place could get a rehab, it's got great potential.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely historic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Nittie
Reviews.Content: My husband often stays at the Adolphus ob business; the Federal Courthouse is steps away. The hotel is one of those beautiful old Grand Dames, at once elegant and classy. But the hotel is also a perfect weekend or vacation choice for Dallas. We stayed there recently for a Rangers game and took in a Mavericks game last season. You can leave the hotel and quickly acces the freeway that will take you all over the Metroplex. There is valet parking, but with a weekend rate of $99, it's a real treat to stay in such a nice hotel. The rooms are very large, and they are super quiet, with large bathrooms and comfy chairs or a sofa with a big flatscreen...we'll what's not to love? There is a great restaurant in the hotel, but there are other options within walking distance. One could walk to the Kennedy site at Dealy Plaza and catch the Dart Train to the fabulous art museum or new fine arts area. We are loyal members of a national chain, but we spice up our travels with stay in unique, lovely hotels or bed and breakfasts. The Adolphus is a choice we return to again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - But room size and location help”
Reviews.Author: newrock
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here three or four times, and this particular two night stay was the best. This is a quintessential urban hotel with lots of character, and quality. My last stay was a year ago and the room was fine but standard, and somewhat close to the elevator bank such that I heard a lot of hallway traffic. This time, I was in a wonderful room at the end of a high floor. It was very large, with a sitting area, spacious bathroom, and private bed area. It was also extremely quiet - I didn't hear a thing during each of the two nights I was there. The hotel is centrally located if your needs are in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot wait to be back next year”
Reviews.Author: MelissaSudac
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so elegant is was breathtaking. It is in walking distance to the convention center, a CVS and great restaurants. The staff was great, very nice and super helpful. Oh and if you stay you HAVE to eat at or have a drink at the "cowboy" bar downstairs :)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service in a grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: vic_sf49
Reviews.Content: All hotels could learn from the staff at this hotel! I've experienced snobby pretentious staff at other higher-end hotels, but The Adolphus was like a breath of fresh air. There were enough about to deal with the 600 convention goers that arrived on the same day, yet everyone made you feel like you were the only guest they had. The hotel itself was like a stately home, and in great location for just wandering around downtown Dallas. My deluxe room was clean, had a very comfy bed, great aircon and a large bathroom. Breakfast in the bistro was tasty and served until a civilised hour (0630 - 1230). All-in-all, a great place to stay and I'd recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but can't we update?”
Reviews.Author: joesgirl1230
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is a lovely hotel, there's no denying that. It has old-world charm that is very rarely found in the USA, particularly out west, and the food is fantastic. The lobby is elegant, the staff is very friendly. My friends and I kept wondering, though, when we got to our room -- why so shabby? We got upgraded to an executive suite. Very spacious. Fantastic beds. But then - though there was marble in the bathrooms, the toilet was a beige 1980s monstrosity with hard water stains, and a roach made its presence known there. Additionally, because the executive suite has a couch area, the television was half-hidden behind a room-separation pillar, making viewing from bed problematic. I understand that is the "allure" - the old-school styling. But I've been to Europe. I've been to the East Coast. Their hotel rooms still smell clean, not musty, and they know when to paint over the plaster patches on the wall and polish the chrome in the elevators. I honestly don't know if I'd stay there again, but it was nice this once.

Reviews.Title: “Very not bad.”
Reviews.Author: Misterpeck
Reviews.Content: Overall not bad except the showerhead was leaking out of the side spraying all my cloths etc. Went to tighten it and it swung around hit my head and got the entire room soaking wet. Maintanence came and fixed it though. A little overpriced but the French room made it worth the stay. Would not recommend for the price go to the ritz or the w. French is it's only saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Hotel with incredible stories of previous and very famous people!”
Reviews.Author: 1mpicchick
Reviews.Content: Be sure to browse the lobby. Check out all the pictures and memorabilia. They make you feel very special because all the staff then treat you like you are one of their favorite guests. They make me feel important!

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mountain_girl6345
Reviews.Content: This hotel features beautiful woodwork and very traditional furnishings.The location in the downtown business district of Dallas can't be beat-just steps from Neiman Marcus! We upgraded to a suite for an extra $35.00 and it was worth the money. Have your nails done by Angel next door at Victoria's.

Reviews.Title: “Most Amazing Week Ever At The Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: copp1
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus has a long history of treating you like Royalty; that is exactly what the staff does from the concierge to the maids. The take care of every need no matter how small, My cell phone stopped working the kitchen staff brought me a bag of dry rice to absorb the water and help try to fix my phone, the courtesy car driver drove me to a Sprint Store and waited for me to try to get my phone fixed the went out of their way to make sure I enjoyed my stay and in the era of fast paced everything, it was so nice and relaxing to have someone willing to cater to your every need, and the Food was AMAZING, I tried foods that I have never eaten, and The Adolphus has spoiled me, because I think everyone should prepare such amazing meals. Thank you Adolphus for and Amazing Week of Hospitality

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel loved it”
Reviews.Author: LifeisGoodinTexas
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel. The staff is always friendly. Including Jimmy the great man who takes car of our luggage and car when we arrive. We have stayed there several times and have never had any issues. There was a wedding at the hotel and lots of people around the lobbies, and the staff handled everyone with such professionalism. Night life in Dallas has drastically improved over the past several years. If you are looking for restaurants or clubs there are several within walking distance of the hotel not to mention the Randy White Saloon attached to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I like it but have concerns”
Reviews.Author: Janice60864
Reviews.Content: Our stay in this beautiful property was very nice but we had some issues with the hotel during our 2 night stay. The one day when housekeeping cleaned our room we were not left any towels, soap, coffee cups or coffee. When we arrived one closet still contained 3 evening gowns, jeans, shoes & a jewelry box. We were disappointed but aware that the French room would be closed but were surprised to find the French room bar closed as well as no bar service available in the lobby living room. The hotel website said that afternoon tea would not be available during July & August. However, we discovered that tea was being served on Saturday - too late for us!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: 21Events
Reviews.Content: Our first stay at the Adolphus far exceeded our expectations so it will be the first of many stays to come. This hotel is beautifully maintained where every staff member makes you feel appreciated as a guest. We enjoyed hearing about and experiencing the historical background of the hotel-be sure and ask about the background of the Steinway piano. The staff was knowledgable about other locations in Dallas and the hotel courtesy car was a real plus for ease of getting around. Afternoon tea provided an enjoyable glimpse into elegance of the past. This was one of the most relaxing and enjoyable stays I have experienced. If you are visiting Dallas, reward yourself with a different hotel experience offered by the graciousness of the Adolphus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Wonderful, Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: owpetcoff
Reviews.Content: My son and I visited Hotel Adolphus this past weekend. We live right here in Arlington, but wanted to take a vacation close to home. We went to the "Taste of Dallas" and visited all the nearby museums. My son is 14 and I was not sure how he would like Hotel Adolphus because he is partial to more modern settings. But, HE LOVED IT! He cannot stop talking about how nice it was and wants to go back for Christmas :-). We came during the time of the year when The French Room is closed for renovation. Next time we come, we MUST dine at The French Room! I peeked in, and it is BEAUTIFUL! Our vacation itself was wonderful, except for three incidents that do not directly involve Hotel Adolphus, but I will mention them show the fine customer service at the hotel. One has to do with a driver of the courtesy car for the hotel - the drivers are NOT hotel employees, but are contracted through other companies. To make a long story short, the driver was rude and unprofessional. I reported it to hotel management and they were very good at making note of my concerns, investigating, and passing them on to the appropriate personnel. Another incident involved loud, drunken patrons next door growling like wild animals (literally) in the middle of the night. I reported them to the front desk and security was dispatched promptly; they quieted down. The hotel is beautiful and classy, the rooms were immaculate. Breakfast at The Bistro was wonderful (best French toast I ever had :-)). The hotel is near sooooooo many attractions. We will be back! (Ron) (could not make it), Omonpee and Desmond Petcoff

Reviews.Title: “Truly a Wonderful place to stay in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: tommy75711
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus on a fri and sat for our Anniversary it was like stepping back in time with the modern conviences of today , It is truly a beautiful hotel , the staff was extreamly accomidating , it is a great location for downtown shopping and dinning , It is a place we will definately stay again .

Reviews.Title: “Old World oasis in bustling downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: ETC16
Reviews.Content: In the 100+ heat of downtown Dallas, the Adolphus rose elegantly amidst the stark skyscrapers, with colorful flying flags, lacy ironwork, carved stone cherubs, and copper roofs proclaiming that the Adolphus was something special. Indeed it was. Inside, rich paneled-wood walls and vast interior spaces enveloped a series of comfortable, elegant reception rooms that invited guests to linger. What a contrast from the hot, confusing hubbub that lay outside its doors! The Adolphus staff were most welcoming and knowledgeable about the area. Effortless check-in and check-out procedures meant more time to enjoy our stay. At the Bistro, breakfast of eggs Benedict was beautifully served by a discrete staff and we enjoyed a leisurely meal at a window overlooking Commerce Street as businessmen hurried below. Our room was spacious and comfortably furnished. Quality mattresses, towels and linens enhanced the experience. What a joy it was to open the full-length French door from time to time and learn against the railing with its elaborate curlicues while we admired the splashing fountains in the small park across the street. The Adolphus was our Old World oasis in the midst of downtown Dallas. We would duck out to shop down the block at Neiman Marcus or walk short distances to partake of Dallas' thriving nightlife. Each time the Adolphus drew us back. We left yesterday and I already miss that grand hotel. Its charm will continue to draw us back for special celebrations and brief breaks.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know how this gets such good reviews. :(”
Reviews.Author: Jaylasmom
Reviews.Content: We were in Dallas for a concert and decided to stay at the Adolphus since it has such great reviews. We were happy with the valet staff and staff member who took our things to our room for us. I was sad to see that the furniture was not clean (not just stains but needed cleaning). Also the white bedding had spots all over it which made it feel pretty disgusting. The bathroom was very clean and the room was nice other than the dirty furniture and linens but to me that's a big problem. We requested new linens and istead were moved to another room at midnight! The other room's bedding did appear to be cleaner but was still stained. Do these people not use bleach??? We were not given anything for our inconvenience of having to switch rooms. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: BR_Medic
Reviews.Content: The Adpolphus came highly recommended from some friends that are frequent guests there, plus the reviews on Trip Advisor are spot on. We arrived at 1:30 in the afternoon, well before check-in time. There was no hesitation in the front desk staff, no "we're sorry, you have to wait until 4:00", we checked in and headed to our room. It was warm, but we figured the A/C hadn't been on, plus it was 108 when we checked in. The decor was great and there were good quality linens on the comfortable bed. We dropped our bags and headed downstairs. The Rodeo bar and grill is a great place to go for lunch, it's casual and has some Texas favorites (BBQ Beef, Chicken fried steak) on the menu. The service was fast and friendly. After coming back from sightseeing and shopping, we enquired at the front desk about the Iron Cactus restaurant. The Desk Personnel knew how far to walk, that it was safe and what to try when we got there. After dinner, our room was still uncomfortably hot, we called the front desk. They immediately apologized, upgraded us to a suite and came up with keys to the new room. The suite we moved to had a fantastic view of downtown, and came with a separate sitting area Checkout was smooth and friendly. Overall you can't go wrong with the Adolphus, it is a grand hotel in every sense of the word, The service from the Bell Captain, through the Front Desk, to the Concierge and Valets is impeccable. Since we were there during the week, the price was lower than some chain hotels!!! We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Historic Splendor”
Reviews.Author: SusieS
Reviews.Content: The staff are attentive and courteous, and every guest is treated like someone special and important. The grand lobby allows one to escape to a bygone, glamorous era. Our room was spacious, well-appointed, and immaculate. Refined elegance presents throughout the hotel, and we just missed W & Laura, who were there a day prior to our stay. The hotel driver took us to the historic and retro cool Texas Theatre (www.thetexastheatre.com), where Oswald was arrested. Do walk around to the side of the exterior of the Adolphus to look up to the top to view the exterior facade, which is pictured on the hotel's Web site. The architecture is stunning. This is one of our favorite hotels - loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Always a Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: TDShaw30
Reviews.Content: Check in so much easier than the Hyatt Regency, and not as large. Each day when we returned from the conference, the concierge greeted us with a "Welcome Back!" I was going to meet friends for dinner, and when I asked him where we should meet (between hotel and the Fairmont), he offered a free coupon for a local place AND a ride to pick them up! I've never heard this before. Last time I ordered room service, it was the burger/fries meal, and was delicious. This time I had the chicken fried steak, and it was better than mine (and it's one of my specialties)! I called for tray pickup and was honest when asked about the meal. The man I spoke with shared how he cooked it, the cut of meat, the prep, everything. I love this place. The Bistro and bar are nice, too. New: Free AT&T WiFi. Parking is about $20 per night.

Reviews.Title: “The second nicest hotel I've ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: DiskOrDisc
Reviews.Content: Second nicest? Well, a boutique hotel (even more expensive than the Adolphus) was better, but not by much. This is the most beautiful hotel I have ever stayed in. It is old, historic, classy, charming and filled with excellent staff. Be aware that since this hotel is historic, it shows some of its age. But everything works, and it feels good to come back to this level of luxury after a hard day of meetings. LOCATION: It is located in the middle of a small sea of nice restaurants and supporting businesses (small grocery, 7-11, drug stores, etc.). The concierges are very, very good at their job, they recommended just the right place every night. The desk staff was fast, friendly and professional. The bellmen and doormen are top notch (and cute). If you get a room with continental breakfast, be sure to claim your coupons at check-in. The Bistro is excellent (though sadly only open for breakfast and lunch). They even accommodated my dietary restrictions. Every day was off to a good start with a good breakfast (not many places around the hotel open before 8:00 AM). My room was comfortable, gorgeous, and well maintained throughout my stay. Be aware that you may have to hunt for an outlet. The electrical system does not appear to have been upgraded for quite some time. I can't say enough about what a critical role the Adolphus and their staff played in making my work week more tolerable and at times fun. Ask the concierge about Sushi-World. It's not a showy place, but it is a great adventure. There is valet parking ($$$) but local parking is about $6/day. For a business traveler, it was essential to me that they had free wi-fi, and they do!

Reviews.Title: “The Most Elegant Hotel In Dallas”
Reviews.Author: wrld_travlr63
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about The Adolphus. I've stayed in five-star hotels all over the world and The Adolphus remains one of my favorite. The history and decor make you forget you are in downtown Dallas and the service (from the bell captains to the front desk, to the restaurant staff) is unsurpassed. No request is too much trouble. I spent my honeymoon there and I took my daughter there for tea on her 16th birthday. If you are tired of well decorated cubicles or ostentatious Vegas-like design and enjoy hotels with elegance and history, you'll love the Adolphus as much as I do.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Trinagriffith1
Reviews.Content: Loved everything about the beautiful and majestic Adolphus in downtown Dallas, Texas. So convenient to everthing in downtown. Enjoyed walking distance to shopping, dining,etc. The staff was friendly and very helpful! Delightful room with space and beautiful views!!! Lobby, interior and exterior is fabulous!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service...fantastic staff....beautiful hotel !”
Reviews.Author: r8guy
Reviews.Content: Every staff member/associate of The Adolphus Hotel left the impression with my wife and I that we were the only guests! Everyone was friendly, kind, courteous and professional. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms are immaculate the snacks in the bar were very good and our breakfast was superb. The people made the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tatiambrosio
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay there, the hotel is beautiful, the rooms are really nice and the location is great...

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: 56003Foodie
Reviews.Content: From the moment we drove into the hotel driveway we were pleased with the immediate, curteous attention we received from the parking valet and bellman. Upon arriving at check-in, we continued to be treated like royalty. Every employee we encountered made us feel welcome and wanted. Our room was lovely as was the entire hotel. We were unable to utilize the dining facitities; but, intend to return so that we may dine in the French Room. We were able to take a tour of this most elegant and beautiful restaurant which is truly the jewel of the Adolphus Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice heritage hotel with staff needing training on how to be friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: TACCooke
Reviews.Content: Whilst this is a lovely hotel with a lot of history, we found the staff unfriendly, somewhat snobbish and not prepared to offer any tourist advice, just gave us a map, marked the hotel on it and said this is where you are! We were going to ask more questions but decided not to. Room was large, clean, quiet, the Rodeo Bar and Grill food was reasonably priced, we didn't eat in any of their other restaurants. On checking out we found we were charged for using the mini bar, which we hadn't, the staff member reversed the charge, presented me with the final account and said "there you go!" she didn't ask whether we had enjoyed our stay, didn't even say goodbye! Perhaps the heat was getting to them! Even after saying the above I would still recommend the hotel as it is nice and central but I certainly won't be going back to Dallas as I found it most disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: Liamactor
Reviews.Content: On June 19th, I phoned the Adolphus Hotel to plan a special night with my fiance. We had planned to have a nice, intimate wedding ceremony at the hotel and then stay there for the night. First, they told me of several romance packages that they offered. I selected on of them as it was an incredible value. $327.00US allowed us an Executive Suite, Champagne, Rose Petal Turndown Service, and a $50.00 credit for food and beverage. It should be noted, that this was only the beginning of what this hotel did for my future wife and me. When forwarded to M. Davis, the Public Relations Manager to discuss where we could perform the small wedding ceremony in the hotel, he made a few inquiries and soon got us upgraded to one of their Terrace Suites at no additional cost. It allowed us a beautiful ceremony overlooking the Dallas skyline behind the historic 1912 Adolphus. When we arrived on the 23rd of June, every staff member in the hotel was aware of our special event. They all personalized out experience by knowing our name. Mr. Davis had also assisted in getting us a reservation at the booked to capacity French Room. The French Room is one of the highest rated restaurants in the United States and it did not disappoint. Carlos ad Gino took excellent care of us during our 3 hour dining experience. The food was amazing and the servce was unbelievable. We felt like royalty. When it was time to leave the restaurant, Carlos, the head waiter, was aware that my wife and I had just gotten married. He presented my wife with a bouquet of roses grown in his own garden. he Adolphus Hotel created an experience for us that we will never forget. From the personalized congratulations card on the bed signed by allof the employees of the hotel to the very flexible check-out time. My wife and I will revisit the Adolphus and French Room often. And the Adolphus will be top on our list every June 23rd from now on. Amazing hotel. Amaxing people. Amazing experience. W. & J. Owen

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the Adolphus for our family reunion and we all had a great experiance!”
Reviews.Author: vatasings
Reviews.Content: This is an elegant place to be pampered and enjoy activities or rest. The staff seems to remember your faces and names and really look out for you. We had 50 family memebers there and no one had a bad experiance.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location; terrible rooms”
Reviews.Author: onetwopi
Reviews.Content: The good: Excellent staff--very helpful and friendly. Beautiful building--fun just to explore the hotel and enjoy the interior design and antique furnishings that are everywhere. Location--in the heart of downtown and within walking distance to many hot spots, museums, Kennedy memorial, etc. The bad: The rooms are quite uncomfortable--hard to control the temperature. The door to our room let in so much light from the hallway that we couldn't sleep. We shoved towels around the bottom and were still bothered by it. (We're not picky--this is a first for us.) The restaurant--excellent food; terribly slow and terrible service. We ordered a continental breakfast with a bagel with cream cheese and a cup of fruit and it took 20 minutes! The parking: $24 / day with mandatory valet is a bit rediculous The amennities: no pool Other: not kid friendly at all. If you have kids with you, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely old hotel with some service issues”
Reviews.Author: travelinglorie
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently because we have booked the Adolphus for my daughter's wedding. The lobby areas and ballrooms are beautiful. The rooms are also nicely decorated and pretty roomy. Was disappointed that our room wasn't cleaned while we were away during the day. Not sure what happened. Front desk staff somewhat hard to reach. Will go back, but have a couple of concerns.

Reviews.Title: “Always stay here when in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Tabbyspot
Reviews.Content: Always friendly, efficient service. Rooms are spectacular and clean. Beds very comfortable. Fitness facility was recently updated and is much improved and offers a good variety of equipment and exercise aides---plus clean towels and water. Location is great--walking distance to several restaurants and a DART station. Food in the restaurants is over-priced, but there are plenty of nearby options.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversay”
Reviews.Author: jaylotven
Reviews.Content: We always go to the Adolphus and the French Room for special occasions and have never been disappointed. The French Room food, service and ambiance always makes for and unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Kentuckian44
Reviews.Content: At the conclusion of a business training in Dallas, I booked a room at The Adophus and awaited the arrival of my family for the weekend. The history and architecture of the hotel were what first caught a Kentuckian's eye when I began making a decision as to where we would stay for the weekend. I am glad that these two hooks initially drew me there because our stay at The Adophus on Friday, Saturday, and Sunday was wonderful! The hotel is located in the downtown and is a short walk or drive to the major sites, attractions, and restaurants in the Dallas area. A car rental agency is located on the corner next to The Adolphus and connects to the hotel's garage, which provided easy access for rental, parking, and return of the vehicle used during our stay. Upon my arrival, the hotel's bell captain was very helpful and open regarding the lay of the land in downtown Dallas...a tremendous fellow. The front desk staff were very friendly to my family and me during the entire stay. The food at the hotel's restaurants and a connecting steak house was excellent as was the service provided at these establishments and by the hotel's room service staff. Had we wanted to do so, we would never have needed to leave the hotel for dining because the food was that good. We were only sorry that we were unable to dine at the 5-star French restaurant that was located in The Adolphus...perhaps on another visit. I was most impressed, however, with members of the concierge staff who went above and beyond the call of duty in terms of friendliness and professionalism toward my family. After checking out of our room on Sunday, we decided to wait in one of the beautiful lobbies of The Adolphus for a late afternoon flight. It must have been fairly obvious what we were doing because one of the members of the concierge staff asked us if we would like to tour the magnificient old structure. He gave my family and me anywhere from 45 minutes to 1 hour of his time as he took us to various parts of The Adophus and provided an excellent history of the hotel's construction and its varied occupants. It was that sort of friendliness and professionalism during our stay that drove me to write my first-ever review for TripAdvisor and which drives me to recommend The Adolphus as a sure bet for a wonderful stay in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Scott3709
Reviews.Content: This hotel has such history and is so beautiful. The accommodations were great. Rooms are nice and big. The French Room is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Weekend was Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: twofogs
Reviews.Content: We held our daughter's wedding reception last Saturday night in the Century Room in the Adolphus hotel. I have been working directly with the staff for months. We had about 26 rooms reserved for our family and friends. Everyone we worked with were very prompt in anticipating and answering questions by phone and email, extremely courteous and upbeat and always had that "what else can I do for you" attitude. The front desk and bell captain took care of our hospitality baskets and early check-in needs, the bistro manager was great in helping with 2 brunches for large groups on Saturday and Sunday mornings and lastly, during the reception, the staff was very attentive to our needs. With all of our logistics, I cannot think of one thing to complain about or suggest. If I were to have another wedding reception, I would not hesitate to book the elegant Adolphus again. Gail

Reviews.Title: “Used to be wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: StephenAugusta
Reviews.Content: What used to be such a beautiful hotel is being squandered by miserable staffing and no air conditioning in the rooms! Find somewhere else to stay and don't fall for the hype. Walk thru the lobby on your way to somewhere else to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BonBonTX
Reviews.Content: The rooms were beautiful, luxurious, comfortable and clean. The service from the staff was excellent from the time I arrived until the completion of my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't belive the great price”
Reviews.Author: dvaughn971
Reviews.Content: Yes, I'm the idiot who booked four rooms under my name and credit card for twelve bachelor party attendees. After just spending one night, I was releaved to only find about $30 in mysterious charges, none of which I blame on the hotel. The rooms were large, and I was able to book for about hlaf of what these rooms should have charged. The request for a rollaway bed was granted quickly, and the staff was freindly on every level. One qualm is the lack of ice machines. If you want ice, you must request it from the front desk, and it arrive about 1/2 hour later. It didn't even take the valet that long to get my car during the crush load at dinner time.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the price received.”
Reviews.Author: markrab
Reviews.Content: I was on a work trip and needed to stay for 2 nights in Dallas. I am a Marriott Rewards member but couldn't find a good Marriott brand hotel in Dallas that work approved, so I went with the Adolphus. Hotel check-in was very slow - every time I walked by the desk there was only one person working the front. Both times I needed to go to the front desk I waited for 10 minutes or longer. The rooms were nice, though this is an older hotel. I was a bit surprised the garbage wasn't disposed of when I checked into the room, but it wasn't a game changer, just something I took notice of. The bed was comfortable, this was in a good location, the complimentary car service was great. I didn't get a chance to try out the on site restaurants. Good on site fitness center with plenty of machines. Would certainly recommend for couples and business travelers alike. Again I think I got a pretty good deal through work - (under $200/night) - I probably wouldn't pay more for this hotel though.

Reviews.Title: “Truly a "Grand Hotel"”
Reviews.Author: davidmf
Reviews.Content: We were here as part of a â€œStay-cationâ€� to celebrate my 40th Birthday. What I love about the Adolphus is it that it is a True Definition of the old school â€œGrand Hotelâ€� from the doorman who greets you, to the sympathetically maintained public areas that you feel have not changed since the place opened - and I mean that in a good way. We were in a Junior Suite and looking at the floor plans, you can see that this hotel is no â€œCookie Cutterâ€�. Having said that it had just conveniences that you need in a hotel these days, Climate control, Flat Screen TV, Internet access (Which was FREE â€“ take note other High End Hotels), without it interfering with the rooms charm. Service was as expected, our car was brought from valet promptly, our bags delivered within minutes of being requested, Housekeeping and turn down did their thing. We had dinner at the French Room, all I can say is it is not just a Meal - it is an Experience. Again it takes you back to a time when people â€œDressed upâ€� to go out â€“ in fact Jacket and Tie are required -and the whole thing was an occasion with the food being just wonderful. If you live in Dallas and you want someone you wish to impress, this is something you should do at least once, in fact we went back again about a month later and need to find time for another visit. The only negative is the location, there is nothing wrong with Downtown Dallas, it is just that after 6pm the place is a Ghost-town, there is a few places in walking distance, but the only real thing of note is the Nieman Marcus Store. If you want a get-away from a luxury hotel that is different from todayâ€™s modern offerings - then you should not hesitate to check this place out

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility; beware the weekend wedding crowd”
Reviews.Author: rockyhilltop
Reviews.Content: Like a previous reviewer, we booked an "executive suite" through Sinqueaway for a night over the Memorial Day weekend while we were in Dallas visiting relatives. The Adolphus was a great way to leave the family drama behind!
