The previous review complained about the size of the room assigned and, although we did not measure the room, I would concur that the size was probably less than advertised. However the entrance hall and bathroom added about 200 square feet....bringing the total footage closer to the advertisement. The good things: beautiful historic public areas, spacious bathroom with good counter height, fantastic bed and quality linens. The bed was truly one of the best. And if I was asked to rate only the bed, I'd give it five stars. The room was quiet despite a lot of partying going on in the hotel. We also never heard any street noise nor any noise from parties on the terraces of the newer rooms below. Valet was very quick...but expensive. Bad things: Bleach smell so strong upon check-in that we had to leave. (4 hours later the smell had dissipated). There were long black hairs in the tub and some shampoo residue in the tub. I almost think the toilet and floors had been cleaned but the tub had been forgotten! There was only one packet of decaf coffee in the room....something we did not discover until the morning. So we went to Starbuck's at the Magnolia next door to get our coffee. Only one TV in suite which was located in the sitting area and it was 20-30 ft away from the bed. Furnishings were slightly worn...but this suite was located in the oldest part of the building. Windows did not open...which was OK since it was 100 degrees outside! There were lots of wedding parties at the hotel on the particular weekend we were at the Adophus. The Adolphus staff can't be held responsible for the bad behavior of some of their guests and I only mention this because I imagine the weekend guests are quite different from the weekday guests. I doubt that you will see obviously drunk guests in the bar and public areas of the hotel in the middle of the week. In conclusion, I's say the very special rate was worth the services received. However, if I'd paid over $200 for the same room, I'd be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous historic hotel at reasonable rates”
Reviews.Author: RenardFX
Reviews.Content: This was my third time at the Adolphus, and each stay has been lovely. This is a wonderfully run historic hotel with attentive staff and impressive public spaces. I recommend upgrading from the regular room, as the executive suites are spacious and are typically only a little more money. Rates are reasonable (below $200) and if your timing is right, you can get a real steal. My favorite part of the Adolphus is its excellent wood-paneled bar, which is a great place to have a drink to cap off a long day. The Adolphus is by far my preferred place to stay in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service just like the other times I've visited! The only place I will stay when in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: mkross_okc
Reviews.Content: Every time I visit Dallas, I stay at the Adolphus. The excellent service, the awesome food, the great location, there's nothing better. There is no better place to eat than the French Room. Also love the fact that the hotel provides transportation to places like the Dallas Museum of Art and other nearby attractions is a definite plus. I would get lost trying to drive there myself. Also there are plenty of places to go within walking distance. (I just didn't feel like walking in 99 degree weather, lol)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the beauty, service and history.”
Reviews.Author: bonniebj82
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, enjoyable weekend. Everyone was so helpful and professional. The beauty, service and history of the hotel were exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Fine Traditional Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CVATL
Reviews.Content: Not musty or stuffy, this is a comfortable, traditional downtown hotel, with especially professional service. It was a landmark to my Dallas friends meeting me after business obligations, and its proximity to the original Neiman Marcus permitted a quick shopping excursion before my flight home. Priced quite below newer built chains at airport and downtown. Standard king spacious and quiet, comfortable, firm mattress. Cafe for breakfast great, well priced and fast. Neighborhood dead at night but some buzz at bar downstairs, it appeared from a distance.

Reviews.Title: “The only place I want to stay in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: tregantx
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus expertly mixes elegance and class with genuine friendliness and comfort. The public areas of the hotel are breathtaking, and the upkeep, cleanliness, and special touches continue in each private room and suite. I have found many beautiful hotels put great effort into the lobby, but neglect the guest rooms; this is not the case at The Adolphus. The staff is very friendly, always with a smile, a greeting, or an offer to assist. No request has ever been denied or fulfilled begrudgingly. The guest's satisfaction seems to be a personal victory for each member of the staff. Each time I stay here, I leave feeling that not only was my stay special, but that I am special. Enjoy the hospitality of The Adolphus the next time you need to feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service and Overrated”
Reviews.Author: DallasRoadWarrior14
Reviews.Content: A group of friends and I booked 2 rooms for the weekend. Upon booking, we were told that we would be able to secure 2 rollaway beds, one for each room, to accommodate our party of 6 (no rooms with double beds were available). Upon check-in, we reminded the desk clerk about the rollaways and were told we could expect them in the rooms shortly. We had to switch rooms shortly after check-in due to not being in side-by-side rooms as requested upon booking. After switching, we reminded them again about the rollaways and again were told that they'd be up shortly. After returning from lunch and shopping later in the day, we still did not have rollaways in either room. We reminded them yet again - at this point we had asked for them 4 times - and once more were told they'd be in the room very soon. When we left for dinner and an evening out, we still had nothing in the room (and no phone calls explaining the delay). When we returned to the hotel at the end of the evening, we were told that there were no rollaways available in the entire hotel - they were all being used. The front desk clerk was unwilling to let us speak to management and claimed that the hotel was 100% booked and no additional rooms were available. When we went down to speak with her in person, 5 other gentlemen were in the lobby with the same problem - promised rollaway beds to accommodate their party, and now being told to sleep on the floor. The front desk clerk chose to stand in the middle of the lobby and shout at everyone, rather than stepping behind the desk like a staff member of a 4 star hotel and dealing with the numerous unhappy customers professionally. Furthermore, she informed us (again - there were 7-8 people down there at this point, all upset about not having rollaway beds) that we were all "out to screw her." When we finally spoke with management the next morning, they made excuses for the behavior of their employees and made absolutely no effort to correct their mistakes. At the ridiculous prices customers pay to stay in this hotel, in addition to the $24/day parking charge, the treatment we received was unnacceptable. We were paying for 4 star service and we absolutely did not get it - one of the gentlemen in the lobby commented that we may as well have stayed at a Motel 6, considering the way this hotel treats their customers. I will never stay here again. Side note - while I was waiting for 20 minutes for valet to retrieve my car, after they informed me that they couldn't find it, another unhappy couple came down requesting new bedding - because they found BLOOD on the blanket in their bed. While this ordeal was being sorted out, another couple came down to request another blanket after finding BLOOD on their bedding.

Reviews.Title: “wrong type of room, hotel refused to resolve the issue, and I did not get what I paid for”
Reviews.Author: minerboy
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I booked an executive suite through Sniqueaway. The room description on Sniqueaway's website indicated that an executive suite would be from 700-750 square feet. The room we received, #1909, while beautiful, was only 12.5 feet by 35 feet. In other words, less than 450 square feet. I expect to receive what I pay for, and if I pay for a 700-750 square foot suite, it is reasonable to expect to receive such. The Adolphus own website even indicates that a deluxe room would be approximately 500 square feet in it's room description, and the executive suite is an upgrade over that! I contacted the front desk and spoke to a front desk manager named Chris who insisted that I was booked in an executive suite and would not resolve the issue. Chris claimed to not be aware of the general size of an executive suite, and would not send someone to investigate the size of the room, nor did he appear willing to do anything to resolve this issue. Chris acknowledged that deluxe rooms are up to 500 square feet, and that executive suites are an upgrade but the upgrade is based on appointments, not size. Chris was the hotel manager on duty last night, and was therefore the primary decision maker for customer service at the hotel. Unfortunately, he did not appear to be inclined to utilize any customer service skills to resolve this issue. This is not the first time I have stayed in a luxury hotel, more than likely it will not be the last. My girlfriend and I have been repeat patrons at other hotels that we enjoy, and we always spend a large amount of money on incidentals. Despite the flap with the room, we proceeded to spend a large amount of money on room service, dinner, the bar, the honor bar, and the valet parking. The hotel received a large amount of money from us through incidentals, but this did not seem to matter to Chris at the front desk. Unfortunately at this time, I do not believe that I will be inclined to return to the Adolphus.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage hotel, but service sadly lacking”
Reviews.Author: ScramblinSooner
Reviews.Content: While my wife and I were looking forward to celebrating our 10th anniversary at the Adolphus, we were shocked the second night of our two night stay. The room assigned upon checkin was neat, clean, tastefully decorated, spacious, and comfortable. Staff was welcoming and friendly. We had a wonderful first night. The second night, however, was completely different. When we returned to the hotel at 3:30 pm after a day of shopping in Dallas, it appeared housekeeping had started to service our room, but had left. The bed was completely stripped and apparently nothing had been done. I thought they just hadn't finished, and it was still relatively early. We left to attend a baseball game without a concern given the attention we recieved earlier. Returning from the game around 11:45 pm, we were shocked the room was as we found it earlier. Bed was stripped, linens and bedding wadded up on the sofa, nothing else touched. Not what I expected from a hotel of this caliber. I called the front desk and was told our only option was to move to another room. At midnight. The front desk manager said housekeeping was gone but she offered to move us to a suite which we agreed to. Well, the bed in the suite was also stripped and bare! We were then moved again to a room that was clearly intended for another couple. There were items commemorating a special occasion for this couple. I was told by the manager they were in another room. It seems to me, based on the number of guests complaining at the time I was trying to get our issue resolved that somebody on the previous shift abandoned the night shift woefully undermanned. The desk supervisor the next morning assured me I would hear from the front office manager personally. That has yet to happen. The property is indeed lovely and a reminder of the glory days of vintage hotels, however, if management isn't aware of the service that's being provided on their property, this hotel's days will be numbered.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but pricy”
Reviews.Author: jdupont79
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazing! Very friendly and accomodating. However the rooms are pretty pricy, and I even had a military discount. There is valet but it is not free for overnight stays as most of us stay overnight at a hotel. The atmosphere is nice, and clean but just be warned that in the downtown area, most things close around 8p. even the pharmacies. Overall, I would stay here again and would recommend anyone as well, as long as you are willing to pay a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Most Incredible Room/Hotel in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: seb02a
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married 2 years ago at the Adolphus and have made it a tradition to stay here every year on our anniversary. This year we decided to upgrade to one of the larger suites and were VERY pleasantly surprised. Check in was a pleasant process as they seemed genuinely happy that we were staying there. The hotel provided us with a kind note congratulating us on our anniversary and welcoming us to the hotel. We made our way up to the 10th floor (1030 was the suite number) and were in (pleasant) disbelief when we walked into the room. I tried to take as many pictures as I could, so it might be easier to look at those rather than me going into detail about each room. A couple of things to point out though is that there is a full kitchen and a pool table, and the balcony is HUGE and overlooks downtown. If I remember correctly, when I made the reservation they stated that this is the only room that is modern. The other rooms are very traditional (but still gorgeous!). We ate dinner at the French Room and weren't disappointed. The service was spectacular and the food was exquisite. I also highly recommend the Rodeo Bar for a lighter meal. Fun atmosphere and very reasonably priced food. All in all, this is a wonderful hotel that I would recommend over and over again. Do not hesitate to stay here :)

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve its reputation”
Reviews.Author: sematsea
Reviews.Content: Friends and I (in separate rooms) had lots of complaints and problems with service. Our rooms looked into a tiny, dark inner space surrounded on 4 sides by hotel walls. When I complained, I was moved to another room with the same dark non-view, while others in our group had normal, outside rooms. At check-in I should have received info related to my tour, but I had to ask for it when I realized others had a tour document. Mine was misfiled so I would't have gotten it without asking. Light bulbs were missing or very low power, so I had to move a chair next to a lamp to read. the first day, my room was never serviced, although I'd removed the 'do not disturb' sign by 9:30 am. On 3 of 5 mornings, my dirty coffee pot, cup, and used coffee service weren't cleaned or replaced. One evening, it took 30 minutes and 3 calls to get this taken care of at 5:30 pm. The so-called concierge desk had no prepared lists of nearby churches and seemed to be just another bellman desk, not a concierge. Several people had problems at checkout with overcharges for add-ons to a "complimentary" continental breakfast. One evening I listened to a dog barking after 10 pm. Pet friendly is fine---but not near my room, please. Free in-room wifi was a plus--so why did the business center PCs have usage charges? Access to a room fridge was very helpful. The bldg and decor were lovely, but mgmt doesn't appear to focus on service details.

Reviews.Title: “Epitamy of old world glamour and charm”
Reviews.Author: n_polley
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus Hotel is and has been my favorite hotel for many years. It shines as the epitamy of an old world elegant, classical hotel and upon arrival the experience begins. The staff is very friendly, helpfula and most willing to please. The rooms are eqiped with a mini bar and they are well done in taste and style. Must eat at the renouned French Room for the most exsquitset dining experience. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Old Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grant13
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is good, it is within walking distance of all the major sites within the city, you can walk to the historic West End in a matter of 10 to 15 minutes same for JFK assasination site, etc The hotel has a nice old feel and it just reeks of history, however the bathrooms well at least the one in my room was looking a little tired. The rooms are a good size and the service is very good. The hotel is on teh blue shuttle circut so there is a regular shuttle to the airport which is handy. I found that the hotle was good value for money and did not dissapoint me

Reviews.Title: “How to feel like royalty!”
Reviews.Author: susanmartinez12345
Reviews.Content: During my daughter's recent wedding, we stayed in the Queen Elizabeth Suite. We really were treated like royalty. The suite was spacious, comfortable, and beautiful. The staff treated us with friendly respect. The wedding was wonderful, with No Drama. A Big Part of that was just having a good night's sleep and dependability. We would recommend the Adolphus Hotel in Dallas to anyone. It was Premier Service.

Reviews.Title: “Afternoon Tea at The Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaRKClark
Reviews.Content: I went for Afternoon Tea at The Adolphus, and it was absolutely lovely. It was hosted in the lobby (which is absolutely gorgeous!), and they had someone playing the grand piano there. The table settings were immaculate, and the tea service was, as expected at The Adolphus, perfect! I plan on returning for the Holiday Tea service as well.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, comfortable and perfectly located”
Reviews.Author: IsaiahP1L
Reviews.Content: I booked a deal through Travelzoo.com with this hotel which afforded me a $20 credit and a good price on a room. My partner and I live in the Dallas area but wanted to make it a special weekend for a birthday and decided to stay her since we found the deal online. It was easily the most comfortable and enjoyable stay at a hotel I've had. The location is perfect for experiencing everything great about Dallas. The service was friendly and expeditious at all times of the day and night. The bed in the room gigantic and we just melted into it. The pillows was the perfect comfort level and the temperature in the room was ideal. The aesthetics of Hotel Adolphus are luxuriant and exude class. I will stay there whenever visiting Dallas after I relocate to Seattle and recommend it to anyone visiting the Dallas area in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Simply classic elegance”
Reviews.Author: PJacksonTN
Reviews.Content: This grand palace reminds one of the days when staying in a hotel was something to look forward to. The atrium lounge is one of the most relaxing places we ever visited. Make time for afternoon tea. Rooms are large and elegant. This is a place you will not want to leave. We've already booked a return weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Great overall hotel for a very reasonable price especially if you like vintage”
Reviews.Author: annhuggins1
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a great location and is truly a steal for the price. It definitely has a vintage 1940's feeling and the rooms are very spacious. If you are looking for the "newest" hotel, you would skip this one but if you like elegance and history...this is for you. The room service at breakfast was one of the best ever and the food was actually hot when it was delivered! Great staff and great overall feel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Fine Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcdonough3
Reviews.Content: Very 'up-scale' & historic hotel kept up nicely. Rooms are quiet, comfortable & very relaxing. The service was Impeccable. My only complaint is that there wasn't a pool on-site. They do have a courtesy car to take you to a nearby Fitness Center or the Fairmont Hotel for swimming if you'd like. But, still much better to have a pool on the premises. I could be wrong, but I didn't notice anything mentioned about not having a pool when I was making my on-line reservation. Other than that, a very nice hotel. I would stay there again...but only if I didn't have my two children with me. I gave this hotel 4-Stars only because it didn't have a pool.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Texas!”
Reviews.Author: MrPassport
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at this hotel when we got married 25 years ago. The staff of the hotel went out of their way to make our 25th annivesary a memory we will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Practical Luxury with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: davebob123
Reviews.Content: As always, Adolphus was beautiful and classy. Mother's Day weekend, just so Mother could have eggs benedict [always excellent] for room service. Daughters love the majesty and grace of the hotel, and rooms always perfect.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TimTheTraveler
Reviews.Content: After staying in a pitiful "historic luxury" hotel last weekend, this was just a fantastic experience. Short and sweet, this place is first class. It is so historic and it is beautiful. The rooms are quiet and comfortable. The staff is professional and friendly. And it was less expensive than the sad hotel in Fort Worth.

Reviews.Title: “Tremendous hotel - great service, and probably the best meal I've had anywhere.”
Reviews.Author: 53449Carol
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay -- the lobby has unique treasures, including a grand piano that is one of a kind -- the only other one made was lost on the Titanic. There is a Louis XIII(?) clock and table -- amazing! Don't miss the French Room -- I had probably the best meal there that I've had anywhere. Everything was top-of-the line including the atmosphere. The staff was very attentive, from the desk clerk who took time to point out the treasures mentioned above to the hostess at the French Room who actually remembered my name as I left and generally made a point to make me feel welcome, and the wait staff who not only were attentive but very personable.

Reviews.Title: “A very very nice hotel that doesn't have a stick up it's butt”
Reviews.Author: dohamolly
Reviews.Content: Every year me and my 5 dear friends go on an annual girl trip to a city to get away from everything. As silly as we all are, we always try to stay some place haunted because we include at least one ghost related activity during the weekend. This year we chose the Adolphus in Dallas. The 19th floor is said to be haunted so of course we got a suite on the 19th floor. The staff was beyond friendly, the rooms were nice with a fun view of the skyline, the hotel was within walking distance of everything (although they continually offered the hotel car...it was just too nice outside). They went out of their way to be friendly to all of us and catered to our every need. Now to the "haunted floor". One evening after a few cocktails we headed back to the hotel room in the wee hours of the morning while two of our friends lagged behind. A few minutes later we heard the squealing down the hall. They ran into the room and said once they got off the elevator, the phone started ringing in the 19th floor waiting area and all of the elevator doors started opening and closing with no explanation. Of course we all ran out in our pj's and waited by the elevators patiently. A few minutes later, all of the elevator doors started to open and close again and the phone began to ring. It took a few instances of this before we finally answered the phone, which had a very Vincent-Price-type-laugh on the other side. We exploded in quiet laughter (there were guests staying there of course). We later went to the lobby and all of the staff greeted us with big smiles and asked how our evening was going. The entire trip the hotel was fantastic, but I really was surprised and appreciated they that took the time to give us ladies a late night show. Especially considering that most of their clientele rolled up in Mercedes with their Neimen Marcus bags. Thank you Adolphus for giving us some true Texas hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in DT Dallas, with super spacious rooms.”
Reviews.Author: PACnPLAY
Reviews.Content: We completely enjoyed our stay in Dallas at the Adolphus Hotel. As former residence of DT Dallas, we love the walkability of downtown as well as the many great restaurants and bars scattered throughout the area. The rooms are huge for a DT hotel and beautifully appointed and it appeared to be recently renovated. The only negative was our cold water didn't work for one day and we were charged $5 for a small off brand water, during that same time ( a rip off even if the cold water worked). There was also some confusion (we extended our stay by purchasing another night online through a third party because it was cheaper) and we did not get our room cleaned. But on the whole we would recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Certainly not 5 star service, find another hotel”
Reviews.Author: rogdock77
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be one of the highlights of a 3 week US trip, but was the worst hotel we stayed in by a long way. Good location, very grand public rooms, but our room was way past its best. Chipped glass on bedside table, dirty chair fabric, bent metal trim on coffee table, frayed carpet edges, tangled nests of cables, pillows far too soft. Bathroom looked about 30 years old, no shine left on the tub, chipped and badly repaired tiles, soap trays which only tipped soap into bath, shower temperature difficult to regulate (be very, very careful!), hot water through cold tap on basin, squeaky door hinges. Housekeeping was pretty poor also, dust on every surface, obviously not vacuumed properly, finger marks on glass, and an inconsistent supply of towels, shower gel, tea, coffee, etc. And it is very annoying when asking for additional supplies at the front desk to be treated with disdain by some staff. But the killer service problem came when raising these isssues with the front desk manager, Mr Christopher --, on our last day. He seemed to think it was just funny, would not stop grinning at me whilst I complained. He did waive the charge for one buffet breakfast, but made no further attempt at compensation. Apparently as I had booked via Expedia, it was nothing to do with him. I was told to "talk to Expedia". Not what I call 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Items stolen from my room- NO refund”
Reviews.Author: ganehls
Reviews.Content: we were impressed at the hotel history, yet the last day of our stay, an item was stolen out of our room even though the "Do not disturb" sign was on the door. When I reported the lost to the front desk, no one did anything. I reported it a second time in the morning as we were checking out and I spoke to the security personal. I did not hear anything for several weeks. I had to email the hotel again. I heard from the manager- He did not believe me. I asked for the refund again, a month later I still have not heard any thing. So am posting this and on Facebook and any where else people want to read about good hotels. I was not impressed as I saw drunk clients in the lobby at 4AM as well as working Prostitutes with Asian clients in the hotel lobby. If they would have made a reasonable attempt to fix this I would not have posted this.

Reviews.Title: “A good experience, but not a great one”
Reviews.Author: TonyatBrisvegas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived with high expectations on the Adolphus, having seen the rating for this hotel on Trip Advisor i.e #2 of 184 hotels in Dallas. Sadly, it didn't quite live up to that rating for us. The rooms are nice enough but have a tangible feeling of "age" to them (as opposed to "grand old style") and - compared to the 3 other hotels we stayed at in the U.S. - a tiny bathroom with no room to put out your toiletries. We couldn't get a booking into the French Room because it isn't open for dining on certain days of the week and I required a jacket, which I hadn't packed - very disappointing as the restaurant itself looks simply stunning. The hotel staff on the whole were very friendly and the concierge (Annibal, I think) recommended a private tour guide to us, a true gentleman by the name of "Bob". Bob made the Dallas part of our trip for us - pleasant, very well informed about his town and didn't charge like a wounded bull to take us out to "Southfork" for the morning; wait there while we had a tour around; then take us back to the hotel via some of the more interesting historical / architectural highlights of the city. If you are staying here from overseas and want to get a feeling for the city without going on the usual packaged tour bus route - ask for Bob.

Reviews.Title: “My last visit was not up to the usual Adophus experience.”
Reviews.Author: kstrouble
Reviews.Content: I have previous stayed at the Adolphus and I love the charm, location and service of the hotel, but my last visit left everything to be desired. I ran the Rock & Roll half marathon in Dallas last year and the Adolphus is a few blocks from the start line. Last year, the hotel was very accommodating with offers of late check-out and opening up breakfast (bagels, fruit, water, sports drinks, granola bars, etc.) for purchase very early. The staff was great and I've since stayed at the hotel for other occasions downtown. This year, I wanted to repeat the fantastic experience from last year and I was sorely disappointed. When I checked in, I asked about late check-out and was told that a large group was arriving, so I couldn't be accommodated. That would have been fine, but the group checking in next to me asked for a late check-out and was told "sure!" I inquired about breakfast offerings for race-goers and was told flatly, "Breakfast is served from 6:30 to 10." I told the guy checking me in that I wanted to know if the hotel would be offering the same set-up that was offered the year prior. He flatly replied, "Breakfast is served from 6:30 to 10." Then he handed me my key with no offer to get a bell hop to assist with my bags. While I don't mind carrying my own bags, having a bell hop carry your bags to your room is one of the services that the hotel offers and the friendly clerk checking in his group offered it as I was walking away. I had reserved and paid for a king sized room. When I got to my room, it had a double bed. These rooms are less expensive than the room I paid for, so I called the front desk to inquire about changing rooms. The same desk clerk who checked me in answered the phone, asked my room number a few times while he fumbled around, put me on hold, then came back on and asked for my room number again. The hotel has a system that displays the guest name and room number to the person who answers the phone (like most hotels of this caliber) so I'm not sure why I had to give the room number, my name and my issue more than once. Finally, after a great deal of silence, he said, "John will be up to your room in a minute." (Note, there was no apology for issuing me a different room than I had paid for.) When John got to my room, he was very nice- he carried my bags and made pleasant conversation, suggested less-crowded dinner options and made sure that I was happy with the new room. John (and everyone else I encountered after that) was great. I went to dinner with some fellow race-goers and when I came back, I noticed that a new crew was working the front desk. I called the front desk to ask about a late check-out and this time I was greeted by name and told immediately that my check-out had been extended until 1pm. I also had to call the front desk later to request an extra pillow and some silverware. Everyone was so nice, but that only made the first desk clerk that I dealt with seem all the more out of place. I wrote an email to the hotel explaining my frustrations with the first desk clerk, but praising the hotel for all of the other employees. I never heard anything back even though I had requested to be contacted and left a valid mailing address, phone number and e-mail. My room was almost $300 for a night in a city I live in, so I had high expectations of the level of service and unfortunately, one employee with a poor attitude ruined it for me. I don't know if I will stay in this hotel again. It's a charming hotel and most of the rooms are different. The beds are comfortable, although the tv in most rooms is far away from the bed. Room service is great and will meet all of your requests and service is usually prompt and extremely friendly. I am very disappointed, however, that my request for contact went unanswered, so I'm not sure that I would pay money to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: MaryAnne40
Reviews.Content: We couldn't of hoped for a better time. We enjoyed a wonderful night and morning in downtown Dallas. The hamburgers at the Walt Garrison Bar and Grill are the best! We hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing place to stay while visiting friends”
Reviews.Author: Flossie1975
Reviews.Content: Good location to sites we wanted to walk to. Easy access to freeways to travel to friends' homes.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant without being pompous”
Reviews.Author: GCE_2011
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler my expectations when visiting the Adolphus Hotel for a recent conference were modest. I anticipated yet another non-descript corporately produced factory environment. You know the type, vanilla. Nothing bad but nothing that would unique. Iâ€™d like to report that should you have an occasion that takes you to Center City Dallas this is a hotel that you should seriously consider. Elegant without being pompous with a huge serving of Texas style hospitality. The facility is impeccably maintained, the rooms comfortable and clean, and the meeting spaces were all first rate. There is no doubt in my mind that on my next trip to Center City Dallas the Adolphus Hotel will be the first hotel Iâ€™ll be considering.

Reviews.Title: “Unique and lovely historical hotel with all the amenities”
Reviews.Author: MaddieVirginiaUSa
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Adolphus for a professional conference. Without exception all staff extremely friendly and helpful. The lobby areas are sort of "old world" elegant. Lovely large rooms, and the best hotel bed I have ever slept in. In-hotel restaurants are great, and the conference food was excellent. Within walking distance to other good restaurants and light rail. My association is very particular about where our conferences are held, and I can see why they chose the Adolphus.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: dfg555
Reviews.Content: I am a discerning traveler who frequently visits (and enjoys) five star hotels and resorts. Given the Tripadvisor reviews, I expected the Adolphus to be exceptional. It was not. The hotel's service was average overall. The front desk was very friendly at check-in and gave me an "upgrade" upon request to a larger-than-average room. Service at breakfast in the Bistro was fast and friendly. However, it took many rings before telephone calls to the operator were answered. I requested a wake up call that never came. Overall, the service provided fell short of a five-star experience. The room was very disappointing. I appreciate this is a historic hotel, but it is not well maintained. Old, worn carpeting, old bathrooms with shower/tub combos and outdated bathroom fixtures, no safes, no minibars, dated carpeting and draperies, old furniture, and there are no hallways into the room (e.g. doors open right into the room) so there is no privacy and light from the hallways leak through the crack in the door. The hallways are cold. The guest rooms just feel dated. Restaurants: Breakfast at the Bistro was fair. I ate dinner at the Rodeo Bar and Grill which was quite good and well-priced. Finally, I booked the hotel through the American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts program and was told the hotel amenity was a complimentary lunch or dinner once during my stay. Not until I arrived at the hotel was I informed of the limitation -- the lunch or dinner could not be used at the fine dining French Room, but instead had to be taken at the less expensive (and lower quality/rated) Bistro or Rodeo Bar and Grill. This was disappointing and I felt it was misrepresented by Amex and the Adolphus. Overall, an average stay. I will not stay here on my next visit to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant downtown hotel in the heart of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Wanda2001
Reviews.Content: I would recommend the hotel bar. It was elegant and cozy with a bartender that has been there 17 years. The bed was perfect, not too soft and surrounded you with down bedding. The location is perfect with walking access to shopping and sights. Breakfast at the hotel's Bistro was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely property”
Reviews.Author: tandmclayton
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely and elegant. We had a wonderful stay. The room was beautiful, and the staff was helpful and friendly. Enjoyed a fabulous dinner in the French Room. The meal was exquisite, and we left with huge smiles on our faces. Can't wait to return for another weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Staying at Dallas' historic Adolphus hotel is like staying in an antique castle.”
Reviews.Author: mrspinn
Reviews.Content: Last night we dropped our things inside our lovely room, went down to the French Room bar for a couple of cocktails, ordered an elegant cheese and fruit plate from room service and slept like two happy rocks in the billowy bed. This morning we enjoyed a delicious breakfast in The Bistro, a French-style cafÃ© that features no hustle or bustle, just a lovely retreat decorated by teapots. Staying at The Adolphus is like staying in an antique castle. It makes you feel special; like a part of history. Their service is real, in the old-fashioned style, in a very good way, not fancy-shmancy new-style faux like many of Dallas' newer, snazzier hotels. Always a truly charming experience!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay near the wonderful art museums”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaElizabeth
Reviews.Content: This is a really beautiful hotel, with an especially beautiful lobby (especially pretty at night with the pretty lighting). The bed was very comfortable, and the breakfast buffet was good. It's a short walk to the fabulous art museums in the Dallas arts district. Dinner at the cowboy bar and grill was fine (we didn't have the appropriate clothes for the French Room), but we wish they didn't have tv's with news on during dinner. Since we were on the 21st floor, we heard no traffic noise. My only real complaint was that we had to pay over $50 for a taxi to and from the airport. You can pay less with a shuttle, but it takes an hour with stops. We would gladly stay here again to enjoy the museums.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: doc33
Reviews.Content: What a life saver! We had a reservation at the hotel lawerence and it was so bad we walked out. Fortunately this hotel had a room available. Such a beautiful lobby and comfortable rooms. I must admit the elevators were very slow and the valet took a long time, which wasn't enjoyable after just finishing the rock n roll half marathon and standing for 45 minutes for the car was painful. Overall, though, fantastic place!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel that accepts pets at a very reasonable cost!!!”
Reviews.Author: baileysandcream46
Reviews.Content: I was amazed at the beauty and class of the hotel and the staff was very well dressed and polite. The room was spacious it was gorgeous. And they accepted my pet without any problems or lengthy contract and the pet fee was very affordable. It is a classy hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury experience, comfortable, inviting, permanent.”
Reviews.Author: nanacake
Reviews.Content: We love staying in landmark properties such as the Adolphus. Especially when coming to Dallas to enjoy downtown activities, the location is perfect. Even more, the comfort and quality of the Adolphus is an example of true value...a worthwhile experience in every way. Of course, the French Room is nationally known, and the price fixe meals are quite excellent. We look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable and exciting stay”
Reviews.Author: sullivann
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and it is in the middle of my favorite city in the world. I love Dallas and this hotel is a great part of Dallas. Everything was beautiful and the French Room for breakfast was the best and I would highly suggest a trip there during your stay. The only "down" side which was not even really that bad was that the bed was a little bit more on the hard side. Which honestly in the grand scheme of things given how great everything else was, was not too big of a deal given that I slept pretty well anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, one of the best experiences I've had!”
Reviews.Author: Yllanes
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is an extraordinary hotel. Great halls, very large rooms and lots of class. It includes the French Room, a 5-diamond restaurant that you must try if you go to Dallas. The Walter Garrison Rodeo & Grill was a very good everyday alternative, with reasonable prices. During the stay, I was attending a scientific conference at the very nearby Dallas Convention Center, I had to work every day for quite a few hours. My room was perfect for this, very quiet and private and with a very good desk. My only minor complaint is that the Wi-Fi connection was overloaded at peak hours (after dinner).

Reviews.Title: “The largest room I've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: reviewer48713
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel. No complaints. And the friendliest concierge I've every met.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome -- Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: azm1206
Reviews.Content: Love the european feel of the place. The Jr. suite was huge! The property is well maintained. We had breakfast at the Bistro 3x - food was excellent, service was exceptional. Try their pancakes, french toast and waffles - the best I've ever had It was a good experience all around. yummm-my! We stayed for 3 nights for my sister's wedding. The bed was oh soo comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Historic Hotel Lives Up to It's Reputation”
Reviews.Author: 4458preston
Reviews.Content: We live in downtown Dallas and have taken friends to Saturday High Tea at the Adolphus and it is always a magnificent experience. We also eat frequently at the restaurants. But recently we stayed overnight because the chilling units in our highrise condo were down. The Adolphus provided us an incredible rate as "neighbors." For out of town visitors, if you want old world charm and to feel as if you are in a great 5 star European hotel, come to the Adolphus. There is so much history as you walk through the lobby, the French Room, and all of the common areas. The rooms are spacious, the hallways are spacious. The decor is old-world--French inspired, lovely marble and wrought iron vanities in the baths. Room service is impeccible. Table dining with all the silver. And above all, very important in Texas at any time of the year...the air conditioning is glorious. For a historic hotel, this is unusual. You cannot get it too cold for us, and you can actually get their air system into the 60's in your room if you so wish. Sleeping hot is one of our pet peeves, and you don't have to worry at this hotel. We are so glad to have this hotel as our neighbor!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel plus Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: Ray_L_11
Reviews.Content: Great experience. Walking distance to many attractions and train. Very good breakfast at the Bistro. Beautifully decorated throughout. Parking the only negative.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Rock Hard Bed”
Reviews.Author: TheCoeCrew
Reviews.Content: My husband I visited the Adolphus to celebrate our 5 year wedding anniversary. We really loved the European feel and classic decor. We live locally and wanted a night away from our new baby, sleep was a high priority. We were sad to find the bed was hard as a rock. No padding or cushioning at all. It was like sleeping on a hard cardboard box. The next morning both of us woke up with back pain. The food was good, staff was decent- valet was great - but the bed just ruined it. Also when we were asked how we enjoyed our stay by the front desk, we explained that we loved everything but the bed was really uncomfortable. Her response was "I'm sorry to hear that" offering no apologies or concern. Only stay here if you need the location (Downtown) and can sacrifice your back during your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at a historical Dallas hotel.”
Reviews.Author: rrsvargas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at the Aldolphus. The staff was great and were quick to recommend local restaurants. Most of the Dallas activities required some travel, but the hotel staff gladly facilitated. We would have preferred more activities closer to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Old World Feel”
Reviews.Author: 20Leroy04
Reviews.Content: Aside from a non-responsive concierge (via email), the staff was exceptional, the Bistro breakfast nice and the rooms clean and comfortable. Probably not a teenager place to stay. I stayed with my daughter to celebrate her 18th birthday, we wanted to be near uptown, Neiman Marcus and Reunion Towers where we had dinner. A warm and inviting atmosphere. The parking fee of $24.00 per night seems excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: lcraiger
Reviews.Content: Staff went above and beyond to accomodate travelers at this conference. The check in process was quick and efficient and with over 300 people checking out at the same time, the staff worked very hard to get everyone going with the luggage and the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: LaurenR29
Reviews.Content: This hotel was quite nice. I planned a meeting there, and everything from the guest rooms to the meeting space to the lobby was excellent. The staff are very friendly and knowledgeable. It was a great experience, and I would absolutely go back. I will say that I was able to negotiate a fantastic room rate, which influenced our ability to hold our event there greatly.

Reviews.Title: “More hospitality than I've seen in a long time.”
Reviews.Author: CatNichols
Reviews.Content: Rooms were ridiculous large and comfortable. Great beds and linens. Can't say enough about the level of service the hotel staff gave. Went out of their way to accommodate us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Cyclonegal
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a junior suite from the double room that we booked. The hotel is gorgeous, from the lobby through the hallways to the guest rooms. The concierge and valet staff were fantastic-they gave great recommendations to restaurants and helped us book the hotel car for several excursions. We ate excellent food in the Bistro, where the service was prompt and cheerfully friendly. Overall, an extraordinary experience that I highly recommend and would love to repeat. (The Travelzoo fare deal made it all possible!)

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly and Professional Staff”
Reviews.Author: mnedrmz74
Reviews.Content: Hotel Adolphus has an exceptionally courteous and professional staff. The beds are very comfortable and the atmosphere is relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Neil8450
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and the staff could not have been friendlier or more accommodating. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “A great property - The French Room Restaurant is outstanding”
Reviews.Author: abetz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here both because we are fans of the fantastic gilded age hotels built during this period (1900 to 1920) and because of the ranking of the French Room restuarant. We were not disappointed. The staff and service at the restaruant were excellent but the food itself was the star. Very deserving of its status of the only 5 Diamond in the state.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: Nuanarpuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel was amazing, but you have a choice of which airline to arrive in Dallas on and your staying at this hotel, choose Love Field. Its much closer and if you have to take a cab, only 1/2 the price. The staff were great getting me everywhere I needed to be on time and having great suggestions for dinner that was within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Large Room - Great Breakfast Buffet”
Reviews.Author: FaithHopePatience
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and close to the Arts District. Breakfast was wonderful! The room was very large and well furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel for Convention Center attendees”
Reviews.Author: Julie_Absolutely
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend at the Adolphus...great hotel, really. Saturday teas are sumptuous, the history (the 19th floor has it's own ghost), the property is beautiful. My room was lovely, but near a service elevator, so the constant drone created a noise issue, but not to the level where I wanted to abandon my room with beautiful windows overlooking Commerce and the water fountain below. Short walk to the convention center was great...Starbucks a few steps away, and some great little restaurants in walking distance on Main Street.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious but old”
Reviews.Author: texaschick71
Reviews.Content: Great stay and staff very attentive. I understand it is a historic hotel but I couldn't help but notice that the furnishings looked like they came from someones estate sale. Beautiful but they really showed their age. Super comfy bed and free wifi was a plus. Nice rainshower in tub. Could've used a little more lighting in bathroom but otherwise nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value.”
Reviews.Author: chasfd
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed two nights in Dallas for on a business trip. On my first night I was in a non-descript megachain hotel at the edge of town overlooking acres of semis and parking lots. I got on the internet to look for alternatives for my second night and found the Adolphus. For the same price as the megachain, I was able to stay at this terrific upscale independent hotel. Everything was terrific about the Adolphus. Great service, comfortable and attractive room, great downtown location, easy in-and-out valet parking. And remember, when you stay at an independent, for every $100 spend nearly half stays in the local community or supports the local tax base. A chain, only about a sixth stays in the local community. I definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A historic Dallas landmark that is still relevant!”
Reviews.Author: mikehaddon
Reviews.Content: Booked a room for the night for my anniversary. Had reservations at the French Room. Everything was outstanding. The people, the service, all just great. The rooms are a little dated but this if you wanted glitz and glamor you'd be over at the W in Victory Park. Here you will get style and class from a bygone era. I really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff& great hotel....Thanks!!”
Reviews.Author: t0309999
Reviews.Content: Great stay.The staff is wonderful. The hotel is beautiful and the price is great. The internet is free and its just a pleasure to stay here. The rooms are big and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus in Dallas can't be beat!”
Reviews.Author: ChristianWoman59
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and clean, the service is excellent, the food is delicious! What more could you ask for? They accommodated quite a large group of women from all over the world with excellence and finesse. Whenever I go back to Dallas I'll be sure to stay at The Adolphus. It's the best!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic property in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: AKFH
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Adolphus for my 30th anniversary. Had stayed there years before. The property is beautiful and historic. The French Room food is excellent. An expensive property that needs a bit of updating and tlc, but still a great place to stay. This was the first time in many years that I felt the entire hotel was short staffed. Would still stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & Convenient”
Reviews.Author: KCCAC
Reviews.Content: We were here for a conference @ the Conference Center a few blocks away. The hotel is close to nightlife & museums. The Dallas City Tavern was much more fun (live music on weekends) than The Rodeo Bar in The Adolphus. Be sure men have dinner jackets & appropriate 5 star attire for The French Room Restaurant. The conceriege was helpful in finding local eating establishments. The art & decor are beautiful~Waterford crystal adorned tables in the lobby. However, ice was available for a phonecall & tip. Overall, the room we had was average. But the "Old School" charm & service were great.

Reviews.Title: “Made another anniversary extra special”
Reviews.Author: skylanders
Reviews.Content: We had such a awesome time on our 14th anniversary there, we chose to come back on 29th, we had other options but chose to return based on hotel, over all experience of dining....you can not beat the French Room, we have eaten at Castles in Europe and it measures up well.

Reviews.Title: “I stay at the Adolphus frequently”
Reviews.Author: Tradewinns
Reviews.Content: I travel to Dallas once or twice a month and usually stay for two nights each trip. Over the past four years I've stayed at the Adolphus many times. The most impressive thing about the adolphus is the service. Everyone who works there is always extremely helpful, courteous and they have the best manners! The hotel is historic, so the lobby area makes me think of what the titanic may have looked like. In the afternoons they serve tea in the lobby. The rooms are varied in size and shape, but the decor is all pretty standard. The rooms are decorated with furniture that matches the age of the hotel, but it is nice. The bathrooms vary from pristine to not as spotless as I'd like but honestly that's more of a product of age than cleanliness. The bath toiletries are nice and there are plenty of towels. The only drawback to the rooms are the comfort of the bed. I guess I've traveled enough to become picky on the type of beds I like and their beds are a little hard and the pillows a little too inexpensive and lumpy for me, but not terrible. Again, I admit I'm picky. I prefer a softer bed and feather pillows, so I may not be in the norm with my preferences. The room service food is wonderful - try the sorbet! Again, the biggest asset to this historic hotel is the staff, they are so nice. The price is also lower than the surrounding hotels and I love the downtown location. My most recent visit I was upgraded to a large suite, which was very nice but the ac didn't work very well. I'm cold natured so honestly I didn't bother to report it, and the room was great so I didn't want to move!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: citychic31
Reviews.Content: Elegant and beautiful describes The Adolphus Hotel. Our experience was fantastic with a great staff and the very best service. The food was simply delicious. I would recommend this hotel to everyone I know. I really wanted to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Downtown Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: texaswillie
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was excellant. Quality of the bed was excellant. We had dinner in the French Room and the dinner and service was outstanding. Breakfast in the Brist was equally as good. This hotel is beginning to show its age and some areas may need remodeling soon. The French Room was painted last year and is in excellant condition. Parking is expensive for Dallas ($24).The sad part of such a stay is the downtown Dallas. Dirty and absolutely nothing to do around the hotel as many stores and shops are closed. The city has a giant task ahead if they expect tourist to visit downtown.Shops need to be reopened, new retail business established, etc. You can't even attend a downtown movie as there are none. Lots of boarded up buildings including a former city office building located direcltty across the street from the city hall. Lots of street people, beggers and vagrants in that area. Dine at the French Room and then get out of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: tina112068
Reviews.Content: Thank you Adolphus Hotel for your great friendly service. My husband & I spent our 23rd wedding anniversary there this past weekend & we could not have picked a better hotel. We enjoyed our special plate of goodies in celebration of our anniversary. That was very thoughtful. Your staff is first class! We had a wonderful time & no doubt we will visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel & great staff”
Reviews.Author: Shawntell
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adolphus for a week for a business trip. It's a beautiful, historic property. The staff from the bell staff to the convention services manager (Shannon Alexander) made sure we and our guests were well provided for. The sleeping rooms were clean and roomy. The bathroom fixtures were in need of replacement as they are well worn. The Adolphus has a wonderful restaurant, The French Room as well as two other places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: jonzgirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus for one night as part of a Valentine's/Anniversary trip we took. This is an easy review. It was perfect! Stay here! Worth every penny. It's within walking distance to the courthouse, Dealey Plaza, the Sixth Floor Museum and lots of places to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Special place”
Reviews.Author: BDLJR
Reviews.Content: For a city that generally has little of historical interest, the Adolphus Hotel raises the bar. The hotel is well-maintained, clean, and has a lobby that would rival a city with more urban appeal, such as San Francisco or Chicago. Would recommend to anyone who appreciates the "classic" feel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific!”
Reviews.Author: RichSikes
Reviews.Content: The Jr. Suite was beautiful and spacious.The French room was very romantic and the food and service out of this world. The Adolphus was a great Valentines getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Room was not what was requested”
Reviews.Author: elbonian
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice, of course. The problem was that the room was not what was reserved. Reserved a king bed in a quiet locations and was given a queen bed directl on the main (Commerce) street. Room also had a large circular window 10 ft up on a wall that allowed a great deal of the street light into the room all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Quick weekend getaway...”
Reviews.Author: ls1202
Reviews.Content: 'Can't believe I've lived this close to Dallas all these years and never been to the Adolphus. What a beautiful hotel! It's old world, elegant, dark wood and antiques. We arrived on a Saturday afternoon for a one night stay and enjoyed our experience so much. 'Beautiful antiques, luxurious bed ... a walk in closet/dressing room that is bigger than the one I have at home!!! We walked around downtown Dallas after we checked in and had a nice dinner at a little Italian restaurant. We did the valet parking because parking in downtown Dallas is tough to find. They service was quick and efficient. I couldn't find the ice machine on our floor so called the front desk. She told me there are no ice machine but room service would deliver a complimentary bucket. They did ... within 10 minutes! Great experience! Go here!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous historic hotel. Amazing value.”
Reviews.Author: RenardFX
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I've stayed here, and I'm happy to say the Adolphus is a true gem. I have stayed in a number of "historic" hotels who use their age to excuse sub-par cleanliness, lack of amenities, and so on, but not the Adolphus. Everything here works, and is still maintained in its original state. The main dining room is spectacular, as is the floor-to-ceiling wood paneled main bar. The fitness center on the 15th floor is generously equipped, and the staff are friendly and helpful. We were upgraded to a HUGE suite as soon as we checked-in, and the value for this place was amazing. A well-executed historic hotel, in which I don't have to put historic in ironic or demeaning quotation marks. Truly first rate. I will only stay here when I visit Dallas from hereon out.

Reviews.Title: “Take a Pass on the Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: 30thBirthdayTrip2009
Reviews.Content: I had to stay at Adolphus on this trip. A conference I attended was hosted at the hotel. Hotel is aging and it shows. Hallways have a distinct "old hotel" odor. Room is adequate - and very quiet, which was the only plus. Housekeeping did not replenish towels, glasses or water bottles. I think they just made the bed and emptied the trash. Breakfast room service came 15 minutes early - I was still in my pj's. The person who delivered did not apologize - just pushed the food in the door and said he had a lot of other deliveries. The conference also seemed poorly organized. Glasses/water were rarely replenished. Location downtown is nice - unless you're here on a weekend - then everything is closed. I wouldn't stay here again unless I had to. On another note - I had a discrepancy with my bill I had to work out after I left. The gal in their Accounting Dept was pleasant and accommodating. The one positive thing I have to say about the Adolpuhs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful old hotel with lots of charm and fabulous "French Room"”
Reviews.Author: GregandJanet
Reviews.Content: 32nd Anniversary stay at the hotel after a fabulous dinner at the French Room. 3rd or 4th time to eat at the French Room, never disappointed. Truly a 5 Star experience. Lobby was very nice, and all the staff was friendly and helpful. Room was nice, but on the old side. Clean but slightly worn. Very very quiet. Considering the age and location really no compliants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Webster24
Reviews.Content: My stay at this hotel was the best I have ever experienced. The architecture inside and out of the hotel was perfect. I really enjoyed the craftsmanship of the woodwork in the hotel. The hotel perfectly combined modern technology for convenience without taking away from its historical presence. The location is perfect. You are located in the center of Dallas with walking distance to most of the the night life, restaurant, shopping, and historical attractions. I highly recommend the Adolphus Hotel to anyone who wants a first class hotel for a very reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations!”
Reviews.Author: cranejoe2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exceptional. It is beautiful, the rooms are very nice and the staff went out of their way to ensure we had a great stay. The walls are solid, so we couldn't hear anything from other rooms or the hallway. Very comfortable beds. We really enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Recommend”
Reviews.Author: nor-jets
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel with a great promotional rate. It was like going back in time where the bellman still takes your luggage after being greeted with valet parking. It was very nice in a great location downtown Dallas near everything and anything. Can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastically outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: edmonddergen
Reviews.Content: Before all the people who know the history of the property, guests and staff, die off, research and publish a book(let) with the detailed history of the property. I would like to know things like whether the lobby elevators were original, converted from human operators to automatice? Where was the front desk originally located and the original configuration of the lobby? Why did you get rid of the drug store where the infomal restraunt is now located? Details on the various entertainers who performed at the hotel and why you finally closed the night club or night club style entertainment space? It would be nice to have the specifics on some of the better original works of art displayed. Also would enjoy reading about various famous guests who stayed with you? If you have already done this and I just missed it, please send me a copy. I will be glad to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Better than Home”
Reviews.Author: Eileen6041
Reviews.Content: Once a year I travel to Dallas for a business/pleasure combination trip and there is only one place to stay, The Adolphus. Staying at this hotel is just an exquisite experience. The staff, rooms, facilities, personal assistance and dining are all a cut above. If you are use to a first class stay, you will not be disappointed here but that is just the basic yummy cake; wait till you add the icing. From breakfast at the Bistro (I am back in France) to the afternoon tea (that even husbands enjoy and I have dragged him to the best) through the fine dining experience of the French Room, everything is perfect. No matter how many visits I have enjoyed here the WOW factor indicator still goes off the gauge. The architecture of the Adolphus alone is breathtaking. It is one of Dallas' diamonds.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant....gorgeous..”
Reviews.Author: livin4Him
Reviews.Content: my husband surprised me with a Amtrak ride and hotel stay to Dallas...the Hyatt is connected to the train station, but the train attendant recommended the Adolphus , 8 blocks away..THANK YOU THANK YOU...beautiful hotel.. wonderful staff....gorgeous brass escalators....chandeliers..Rooms are spacious and comfortable...loved it... Within walking distance of the JFK Memorial , the Sixth St. Museum several great restaurants and the flagship Neiman Marcus...

Reviews.Title: “five star hotel with three star price”
Reviews.Author: randyhope
Reviews.Content: totally suprised by the high standard based on the price of the rooms

Reviews.Title: “Five Star”
Reviews.Author: hunter5410
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out nice, friendly staff. Comfortable room. Old quaint elevator with real wood. Attended a couple of business events and food was super.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: pjlbrady
Reviews.Content: Very romantic. The hotel is in a central downtown locaiton, very convenient to restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with great employes that offers great customer services in a great location in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: MykJ
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on new years weekend and I knew that it was a good hotel. Every one was friendly and ready to make your stay as easy and comforting as possible. From the professional and friendly valet service all the way to the comfortable sheets and pillows in my bed room. If your coming to Dallas, for business or pleasure, adolphus is where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with poor/no Internet connectivity”
Reviews.Author: worldtraveler1028
Reviews.Content: Great classic hotel with excellent service. Wonderful but pricey "French Dining Room." Spacious guest rooms (I stayed in 2 different rooms). However, after being assured of Internet availability, on arrival found that it had limited or no coverage most of the time (I even moved to another room)., Had to go to lobby to connect as did many other guests. Spoke to ISP (ATT) who told me that lack of coverage was a known problem. Don't know what hotel is doing to resolve problem. Would stay again if reliable room Internet; otherwise, will stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful older hotel with great amenities and terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: Maan1
Reviews.Content: Oldest hotel in Dallas with updated amenities. Room was very spacious,lovely and comfortable. Great downtown location. If I am in Dallas again this is where I am staying.

Reviews.Title: “Dated room, bell and limo staff excellent.”
Reviews.Author: agrenitz
Reviews.Content: Apparently some rooms have updated TVs: if I had known I would have requested one! Our room looked into a very dark courtyard so we had no daylight during our stay: ask for a room with light. Housekeeping staff was mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in Dallas! 20th floor views are absolutely magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: AnitaNicole35
Reviews.Content: Hello fellow- travelers! I stayed at the Adolphus for New Yearâ€™s Eve with my boyfriend and our experience was just splendid! This was our second time staying here and we were able to get a room on the 20th floor, again. The view from the 20th floor is just spectacular and being in the heart of the city in a corner room for New Yearâ€™s Eve is just priceless. The reason I chose the Adolphus and will continue to choose it is because their customer service is excellent and their attention to detail is superb. We had a wonderful dinner the evening of the 31st and enjoyed a delicious buffet breakfast the next morning; I canâ€™t imagine a better way to have spent the last day of 2010 and first day of 2011! I highly recommend this hotel. They will do whatever it takes to make your stay wonderful and everyone is so polite and attentive. Sincerely, Anita

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Dallas to stay.”
Reviews.Author: tcbeard
Reviews.Content: If the bathrooms had a little updating here, this place would be perfect. Rooms are beautiful, very large and comfortable (with walk-in closets, for crying out loud). Every staff member is very well trained and exceptionally professional and friendly. Great location with many good restaurants, bars and sites within walking distance. The lobby, French Room restaurant and bar are all amazing. Free high speed internet (which is not usually the case in upscale hotels). Parking is a little pricey, but valet service is right-on.

Reviews.Title: “Rich, warm, friendly, out-of-this-world service!”
Reviews.Author: admiraltwin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I, in our mid-30s, stayed at the Adolphus two nights to celebrate our first anniversary and to attend the Armed Services Bowl at SMU on Jan. 30. We instantly were met with a smiling valet who offered to throw away trash in our vehicle. The desk clerk upgraded us to a suite upon my announcing our first anniversary. The concierge suggested we eat the Dallas Fish Market nearby and phoned the restaurant to expect us. The rooms are nicely appointed. (And the conditioner is fabulous!) Another concierge gave us the history of some of the hotel's gorgeous antiques, including a $2 million carved table in the lobby. We will return to the Adolphus for any subsequent Dallas trips. If you can spend $130/night in Dallas, do yourself a favor and book a room at the Adolphus.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus is incredible!”
Reviews.Author: SandicNeedham
Reviews.Content: I chose the Adolphus after reviewing TripAdvisor ratings, and I am so glad I did. The hotel is absolutely beautiful, and my room was spacious and tastefully decorated. The staff is wonderful - helpful, friendly, and interesting. Special kudos to the hotel's director of public relations, who has worked for the hotel for about 30 years and had lots of helpful suggestions. The Adolphus is within walking distance of both Dealey Plaza and the flagship Neiman Marcus (and right across the street from a CVS!) Although I didn't use it, there is complimentary limousine service within a 3 mile radius.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and elegant”
Reviews.Author: MhopdFW
Reviews.Content: Always romantic, always a great experience.. Beautiful, friendly, and elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus is a must!”
Reviews.Author: TexasCeCe08
Reviews.Content: For the incredible rate of under 90usd for the evening the Adolphus was a steal. Every aspect of this hotel is incredible. The rooms and common areas are well appointed and the rooms feel more like home than a hotel room. Food is exceptional and the staff makes you feel like royalty. I have traveled all my life and stayed in 5 star hotels and resorts...the Adolphus by far is the best.

Reviews.Title: “French Room Spectacular-Adolphus Okay”
Reviews.Author: TexTraveling
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Adolphus after having dinner at the French Room in the hotel. The hotel has grand public spaces in the old hotel tradition---all very beautiful and well maintained. Our room was quite large by today's standards, but has not been updated--old TV, a small clock radio on the night stand, no bath robes--it is not the Ritz--but also not the price of the Ritz! It is very adequate if you want to stay there and not have drive after that great bottle of wine for dinner.The staff was all very professional and helpful. The French Room is the attraction here, and it IS spectacular fine dining.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel, exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: Jazz028
Reviews.Content: We got a great holiday rate through TravelZoo meaning we could stay in a classy hotel for a budget rate. All the staff were extremely courteous and helpful--concierge, bell captain, desk, restaurant servers. The rooms are huge with a separate seating area. Bath space could be larger. Restaurants are first rate. Valet parking adds $24 + tip to the rate. Cheap parking is available 2 blocks away at about 1500 Commerce (at Lane).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Fabulous Price”
Reviews.Author: gourmetwashington
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Dallas and have known about the Adolphus for years. We decided to stay here during the Christmas holiday on a trip back home. This is a 4 star hotel with 5 star service. Why I rate it a 4 star and not a 5, is that small items such as robes and turn down service are not standard. However, the service is amazing, the beds comfortable, the pillows - unbelievably soft and comfortable and the rooms quiet and very clean. I am quite impressed by this hotel. The price is outstanding as well - $109-129 for a double or king sized room. The location is in downtown Dallas, but highways are close and everything is relatively easy to travel to. The hotel is a couple of blocks from the downtown Neiman Marcus, so nice shopping close by. Plus, the uber yummy French Room restaurant is great. Room service was pricy, so we had delicious hot homemade croissant and muffins each day from the bistro. This hotel is an absolute gem. Plus a historic Dallas landmark and visually beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very special and memorable for my wife and I”
Reviews.Author: Awesome25
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus Hotel went above and beyond to make our stay the best for our 25th wedding anniversary. The atmosphere was great and the service at the top. They even delivered a special '25th' plated dessert gifts for us. Thank you to the entire staff.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: sb0247
Reviews.Content: Best hotel I've ever stayed in. The room was beautiful, the service was wonderful. The only problem we had was that my husband thought the pillows were too soft! Highly recommended. We can't wait to go back and try The French Room.

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away by the Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: buzzboles
Reviews.Content: I am still amazed at the Adolphus. I stayed at this hotel several years ago and it was okay. But I just stayed there for three nights for a wedding and was completely blown away. The latest remodel has brought this hotel to its original elegance. The staff could not have been any better. Very professional and perfectly dressed. Then the suite was veryt spacious with a bed that was so comfortable it rivals my bed at home. Also there were plenty of pillows just like I like. I have stayed in many fine hotels all over this country and have not had a more pleasurable experience. The remodel is just perfectly elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and sophisticated with a touch of nostalgia.”
Reviews.Author: Traveler0686
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus Hotel is probably my most favorite hotel I have ever stayed at. It has the elegance and sophistication of the early 1900's with a modern twist. The location is great and the grandeur of the French Room is breathtaking. The rooms are spacious and the staff is very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dena2
Reviews.Content: The refreshments that are stocked/kept in the rooms are extremely high priced; and there was a hole in the wall underneath the sink in the bathroom area where the wallpaper had come apart from an apparent leak/repair issue.....but other than those two things, I would so recommend this hotel to any traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: jimbosteward
Reviews.Content: We spent our 6th anniversary here. The decor was beautiful and the grounds were well kept. We ate at the French Room and also had breakfast at the Bistro. The food was great at both. The wait staff was very sharp and on key at the French Room and they even remembered it was our anniversary. I did not feel that the price of the food matched the taste. Don't get me wrong, it was good but just pricey. At the Bistro, it opened promptly at 6am and the staff and food was wondnerful. We had "sparkling wine" in the room waiting for us with our turn down service. Overall it was a nice dinner and stay, but for the price I did expect bigger bathrooms with the Jr suite. My closet at home is bigger and for the price I expect nicer than my own home.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: rev1ew
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great amenities, online reservations flawless, efficient checkout

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel that makes you feel welcome”
Reviews.Author: Perkypaws
Reviews.Content: If you look for internet specials, this deluxe hotel is suprisingly affordable. Every employee made us feel welcomed and valued. Lots of comfy nooks in the lobby to enjoy the ambiance. They don't have ice or soft drink machines on the floors, but you can call room service or grab a soda from the gift shop. There is also a drug store across the street. Car delivery service was prompt. We had a chilly room with a stuck thermostat, but a call to the maintenance service resolved the problem quickly and courteously. We were in jeans the entire time and were treated the same as guests in suits. The water temperature could have been a little more hot for me, but my husband said it was fine for him.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: gilbert_10
Reviews.Content: Lovely and convenient. Upscale hotel with all the amenities. Beautifully decorated for Holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Large Jr Suite at great weekend rate. Grand Classic Decor”
Reviews.Author: charles195203
Reviews.Content: Leisure stay to visit daughter and enjoy Christmas events in the city. Excellent location for the arts and close to many restaurant areas. Hotel was delightful, classic decor, with history. Very accomodating with room selection. Hotel room was very large and comfortable. Jr Suite on weekend rate was a great value. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Opulence”
Reviews.Author: jr74066
Reviews.Content: To all who enjoy fine hospitality and welcoming accommodations, our stay at the Adolphus Hotel was simply one of the most romantic experiences we've ever had in Texas. The staff always know how to receive their guests with a brilliant smile, and they are always more than willing to ensure your stay exceeds your expectations. We stayed during the Christmas season, and the hotel lobby had already been transformed into treasure of Christmas wonders. Excellent place.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite”
Reviews.Author: AbileneTexas
Reviews.Content: I was not certain to expect from the hotel as I had not stayed there before, but immediately upon arrival I knew how lucky I was to be staying at the Adophus. I know that sounds "corny" but it is so true. When you come up to the hotel, the timeless architecture cannot help but reach out to you.
