When you enter, you are met with graceful elegance like no other. It reminded me like a scene from the Titanic. The hallway leading to my room was much larger than I expected, and when I walked into my room I found a walk-in closet with built-ins, and a room furnished as one would find in Architectural Digest. I roamed the hotel briefly before leaving to look at the dining room that was in the hotel brochure reflecting a 5 star rating. The walls and ceilings are painted in the vogue of the Cistene Chapel and the chandeliers appeared to me to be French blown glass. I hope that I get the chance to return and have the funds to enjoy a five star meal there as it was an enchanting experience just to walk in. When I made the quick tour, two of the staff were doing a wine tasting, and it appeared to me they were making determinations of which wine to order. When I was checking out in mid-afternoon, I heard delicate piano music being played, and followed the music. When I arrived, I found people having tea, and a pianist playing an ornately carved grand piano. The staff was not stuffy, and when I could not get my cell phone charger to work, one of the staff just plugged in their cell phone charger for me. Would I stay here again? Yes.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely enjoyed my stay!”
Reviews.Author: TMSoto
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay. The staff was very friendly and very knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and especially beautiful at Christmas”
Reviews.Author: zinniaqueen
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus was a very central location in the downtown district. It was convenient for us as we were going to an event at Fair Park (State Fair of Texas). Our room, a King Deluxe was very nicely appointed and quite large and the rate we found was extremely reasonable. At Christmas time, the hotel is is beautifully decorated as well!! We would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus Christmas Children's Parade weekend is the perfect family celebration venue.”
Reviews.Author: GdotG
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus Hotel is the elegant grande dame of Dallas hotels: quiet, dignified, and sophisticated, the home of a 5 star restaurant and excellent business meeting facilities located in the heart of downtown Dallas. However, on the first weekend of December she transforms into a family-friendly Christmas playground to host the annual Chrsitmas Children's Parade benefitting Chidlren's Medical Center. Families are welcomed beginning on Friday afternoon. Our check-in experience was smooth and handled quickly. My grandchildren found Christmas cookies and milk waiting in our room. The more casual restaurant was geared completely for familes: kid-friendly menu, buckets of peanuts to enjoy while tossing the shells on the floor (one child's favorite memory!), with a wait staff who never stopped moving in their efficient effort to serve large extended family groups. We had stopped by after checking in to ask about getting a reservation; when we arrived for dinner at the time we had mentioned, we found a table reserved with our name on it! The Adolphus is within easy walking distance of the famous Neiman Marcus window display as well as a park area with fountains and room to run. Families gather near the beautifully decorated tree in the hotel lobby for pictures and conversation; children play in their Christmas pj's. The housekeeping staff is attuned to guests' every need. As we were approaching our room, my husband casually mentioned that we might need more towels and coffee for the in-room coffee maker. Unaware that anyone else had heard our discussion, we were amazed when a housekeeper knocked on the door moments later with the items! The Saturday morning parade is magical for everyone, and to be at the center of the activity is a treat. We met Santa in the elevator and talked to elves and costumed parade participants in the lobby. When we needed plastic utensils for a snack during the parade. the hostess in the lobby Bistro quickly accomodated the request. The Adolphus certainly knows how to indulge its guests every need, whether the business traveler or the extended family.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus is a Delight!”
Reviews.Author: AmySioux2
Reviews.Content: I just had the pleasure of staying at the Adolphus in Dallas for a business trip. It was a refreshing change from chain hotels in both atmosphere and service. There was not a thing to complain about during my stay and the highlight was the delightful staff: Friendly, efficient, even fun. I will choose this hotel again when my next trip calls for a stay in downtown Dallas and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “stay @ the adolphus”
Reviews.Author: TexasAggiegirl
Reviews.Content: everything was great. It is a beautiful hotel, very convenient to the parade we were attending.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Clean Rooms, Excellent Service and Beautiful decor”
Reviews.Author: TampaFrank
Reviews.Content: Don't hesitate to stay at the Adolphus when visiting Dallas. Great downtown location with many restaurants within walking distance. The rooms are some of the largest I have ever stayed in and they are wonderfully decorated and extra clean. Staff was very helpful. Our rooms did not have great views, but being downtown that should be expected.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Weekend with the Grandsons”
Reviews.Author: Trish019
Reviews.Content: We met our son and his family at the Adolphus to spend the night and attend the Christmas Parade. The service was excellent amid hundreds of families staying there to attend the Parade. The rooms were very comfortable and the food was very good considering all the food that was having to be prepared. We know that The French Room is wonderful, but did not have the opportunity to eat there, but the two of us will return to have dinner later. Check in and check out was quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas' Best-Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: RBraz
Reviews.Content: This is truly one of Dallas, Texas' best-kept secrets! From the moment we pulled into the hotel unloading area until our departure, we were treatedly like very-valued guests, knowing we were in for a true treat. Everyone, and I mean everyone, working at this hotel made sure our stay was first-class. The rooms were large and spacious as well as being very functional. Their on-premise Five Diamond Restaurant (Texas' only such rated restauratnt!) was second-to-none. I don't know which was more superior---the food or the service. Believe me, you will not be disappointed with this hotel and its amenities. In fact, I am sure you will be pleasantly surprised, just as we were, to find such accommodations in downtown Dallas. And, all of this is conveniently located to all major attractions in the Dallas area. We can not wait to return to Dallas and stay at this one-of-a-kind hotel again soon!

Reviews.Title: “You will never find a hotel with this level of preeminence and value in one beautiful setting!”
Reviews.Author: Vinnie2010
Reviews.Content: I rarely experience this level of quality from a hotel in a downtown location. Service staff was phenomenal, furnishings were impeccable and the experience was truly memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: Ontheroad6798
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at The Adolphus. We had a great view on the 19th Floor. The staff was friendly. The French Room was an incredible experience. Food was excellent and service was impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, friendly staff, and large/comfortable rooms.”
Reviews.Author: MBentley_10
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is well-situated for business travel, particularly those with business before the federal court (which is only one block away). The staff was very friendly and attentive. My room (on the 12th floor) was larger than I expected, well-appointed, and very comfortable. The hotel retains its historic character and the lobby/public areas are spacious and excellently-maintained.

Reviews.Title: “The Adophus was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: kmulvaney
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown; near good restaurants--just ask Concierge about the YO Ranch Steakhouse and some others in that area. Everyone was terrific and the hotel was spotless, and superbly appointed.

Reviews.Title: “A 20th Anniversary to remember!”
Reviews.Author: MaritaP1
Reviews.Content: What a perfect place to stay for our 20th Anniversary! Everything was absolutely perfect, the hotel was more than I could have hoped for. We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great ***** Hotel downtown Dallas near Neiman Marcus”
Reviews.Author: Leonard-Montreal
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, excellent location in the center of the business district and only yards from the flagship Neiman Marcus store. Spacious room, great bedding. Old world southern hospitality with all the modern touches. One of the best chefs in Texas - must dine one night in its award winning restaurant. You will also find great Tex-Mex, steaks and other dining nearby.

Reviews.Title: “THe Adolphus is a classic experience.”
Reviews.Author: DHSRowlett_TX
Reviews.Content: You have to appreciate the ambiance, the architecture and the classic service of this historic Dallas Hotel. It holds its own among the meriad of new trendy glass facilities hitting the Dallas skylkine. New isn't always better. The dining and service is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch lodging and dining experience”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Randy
Reviews.Content: One of the finest hotel and dining experiences I have had the pleasure of enjoying. We attended the Black Tie Ball at the Adolphus and stayed overnight. We were upgraded to a junior suite. The property, staff, catering, and entertainment were all top notch. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Experience Available in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: PlainGirl
Reviews.Content: Elegant, romantic, historical, impeccable service, best restaurant experience of our lives at The French Room, extremely relaxing, within walking distance of many types of adventures, spacious rooms, and good quality wi-fi (for the price: free) are descriptions off the top of my head. The staff would certainly be entitled to being snooty in such a grand hotel but it's remarkable how helpful and down-to-earth everyone is without exception. I left my bags with a bellman and then parked in Thanksgiving Tower for $5 for the entire weekend. It's only a few blocks walk past some good restaurants and nightlife - great places to try if you care to venture outside the hotel. The Adolphus will be our regular staycation address when we need a long weekend to decompress or to celebrate a special occasion. You truly are transported to a far more magical place and the rest you get in the comfy beds makes you feel like you've gotten away without all the hassles of travel.

Reviews.Title: “BE CAREFUL OF WHAT THEY PROMISE”
Reviews.Author: CUITLAHUAC
Reviews.Content: I travelled again to Dallas on business, and decided to try a new hotel. After asking around and reviewing ratings, I decided to try an older hotel, thinking it had a lot of character. As part of the reservation, i checked if I would get mileage in my airline mileage plan, and was told by the hotel, the airline, and the package operator, that I would get the mileage. The hotel left quite a bit to be desired. It is supposed to be a 5 star hotel, but when I arrived, I went in to the room I was supposed to get, and while checking for bed bugs, I removed the sheets, and the top sheet had a streak of what appeared to me to be dried blood. I went to the front desk, told the reception about it, and was changed to an "upgraded" room, this time, no bed bugs and no streaks. The floors are uneven throughout the property, and the amenities are aged. Could work in London or Paris, but I don't think it is a North American type. After waiting for a month for the mileage to be credited to my airline account, I checked with the hotel, and they told me, after I was told by everyone that I would get miles, that since it was a prepaid sale, no airline points will be awarded, and that they award miles only to specific rates and dates, and it is all arbitrary and their decision is final. Not a major deal really, just a bitter ending to a very tepid stay in an old, outdated property. IF YOU EXPECT ANYTHING FROM THEM, GET IT ALL IN WRITING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Words cannot describe”
Reviews.Author: GAWPKM
Reviews.Content: Words cannot describe my experience at Hotle Adolphus. The rooms are immaculate. Beds are comfortable, linens crisp and clean. Free internet and WIFI. The only thing I can say negative is the need to remove the old tube style TV with a flat screen. If that's the worst I can think of, then if you choose the Adolphus, you can't go wrong. The location is right in the heart of Downtown. The downtown area is great for shopping and nice dining, a short cab ride will take you to the Deep Ellum district with its vibrant nightlife and the West End is loaded with great restaurants. I would have to rate Hotel Adolphus as my favorite Dallas Hotel and a must book for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to celebrate hubby's 50th birthday!”
Reviews.Author: 6pattersons
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Adolphus on many occasions and it continues to be my favorite in the Dallas area. I love the ambiance of this hotel with the antiques and architecture. The French Room is WOW! no other words for such an incredible dining experience. Rooms are large but yet cozy. And the staff is very friendly. The greeter that opens your door when you arrive has been there for years, greets you with southern charm. I give 5 stars!!

Reviews.Title: “Class, convenience, service.”
Reviews.Author: Dani13Travels
Reviews.Content: The service at the Adolphus is impeccable. Every staff member I interacted with was knowledgeable about the hotel and local area and willing to do anything needed to make the stay not just pleasant, but unforgettable. The hotel a beautifully maintained and appointed property where you step back in time in classic and comfortable decor while having all of the modern conveniences. The French Room, on-site award winning restaurant, is happy to accommodate food allergies with only a day's notice. Business travelers will find the hotel comfortable and convenient. Saturday afternoon tea is perfect for bridal and wedding showers or just a great afternoon break on a girls' weekend. The only draw back to this property is that it does not have a pool. The Texas Club has a relationship with the Adolphus so you have access to a nearby, indoor, heated pool and sauna, but it would still be nice to have it on-site. Check the Adolphus website. They often have wonderful deals on rooms when you purchase in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with water temperature issues”
Reviews.Author: funnymoney
Reviews.Content: This is truly one elegant, historic hotel in the heart of downtown Dallas. In fact, it is a feature on the city's artwalk through downtown. It is beautifully furnished throughout the lobby and that also reflects in the hotel room. Parking is quite expensive ($24/night), as it is usually is any big city, but there are public parking lots within walking distance if you want an alternate. Checking in was painless, but our complaint about the lack of cold water was not necessarily taken seriously by the front desk on our first night of our stay. I would guess the usually the complaint is lack of hot water, but this was a serious lack of COLD water - even the toilet emitted a heat! Other guests we spoke to also had the same issue, so it wasn't just our floor or room. If the hotel hasn't fixed it yet - visitor beware!! You do *NOT* want to scald yourself in the shower, washing your hands or brushing your teeth! We found that wasting water, by letting it run for about 15 minute, will cool the water down in the shower, when the setting is set on the coldest possible. Upon our checkout the front desk took note of our concern again (it was supposed to be addressed by the staff the day before), so I hope it really will be taken care of before somebody accidentally scalds themselves. Another thing to be aware of is that although there is internet access (AT&T), take note it is not speedy. At all. I think it may have been slower than dial-up, and I honestly don't know why as I did not inquire about it with the hotel staff. However, if you're on vacation, maybe it's best to stay unplugged and enjoy the sights of Dallas. If you need it, there is a 24 hour business center, although we opted not to use it. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a great location, but be sure to know that it does have it's quirks! It is also a classy, elegant & historic location and I would imagine a great place to get married, or to host any sort of celebration. We did not taste for ourselves, but there is some fine dining available in house. We did partake in a meal at the Rodeo Bar, which was great. We were even able to confirm gluten-free options for dining.

Reviews.Title: “Stately, historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: TXtravelbug05
Reviews.Content: Hotel lobby and public areas are beautiful and stately. Room was clean but needed updating. Staff is friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money; excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: sestein1
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of Dallas, very convenient; staff courteous and attentive; room a nice size with a street view (even at reduced, advance rate) very clean; attractive, comfortable bathrooms

Reviews.Title: “Hotel great but read the small print”
Reviews.Author: Trisha49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with toddler granddaughter and her parents. The hotel was lovely, rooms comfortable and our booking had said breakfast included. This turned out to be a continental breakfast for one person in a room - crazy idea and feels like misrepresentation although it does say that when you read the small print. It was sorted out but detracted from the overall good impression. Good location for downtown Dallas. Valet parking efficient and convenient but not cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Charming and convenient”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneA42
Reviews.Content: My company exhibited at a major industry tradeshow at the Dallas Convention Center. There were 20,000 conference attendees - severely taxing the downtown housing stock in Dallas. I chose the Adolphus about 6 months in advance for our Sales team; twelve of us stayed for between 3 and 6 nights. The hotel sold out and was very busy. The location is terrific - a 4 block walk to the Convention Center and 2 short blocks from the flagship Neiman Marcus (only I cared about this.) Cabs were always available and there is a hotel car. But there was not a free shuttle - which the Joule has. Service was willing and helpful but the staff did not anticipate needs or offer extra help. I had to deliver conference badges to other colleagues staying at the W Hotel and the items were taken to their rooms immediately. At the Adolphus I had to make an effort to retrieve the stream of packages I was receiving daily. Rooms were spacious and charming. The bed was extremely comfortable and the room layout was pleasant, even though I had a view of a large air shaft. There were 2 closets with mirrored doors, a nice size bathroom with tub/shower combo, a sitting area, and a desk and TV. The ventilation system was not well filtered. The last 2 nights I was awakened at 2am by noisy guests in the hall outside my room. Others in my group (on different floors) had complained about the noise earlier in the week. The common areas are beautiful! All in all it was a lovely place to spend a week and quite genteel in demeanor.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus Hotel is 5 Star excellent.”
Reviews.Author: evenpargolf
Reviews.Content: The staff is very attentive and prompt in handling any request. The French Room is dining at its absolute best. Service, food and wine list are unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “Not really for 20-somthings or for leisure.”
Reviews.Author: shuynhict
Reviews.Content: If I were a business traveler, I could see myself enjoying this hotel. It is in the middle of downtown. But this was our first time in Dallas and their downtown isn't what we expected. The hotel was billed as a 5-star hotel. It was nice, but the rooms were decorated as if we were actually staying at a B/B. The floral motif and the rich greens were a little much. The pillows were super soft, I mean barely support your head, so if you stay make sure to ask for a bunch of extra pillows if you like support. Also for being a 5-star hotel, the television was a 27" tube tv that was way across the room. So at night when we were trying to relax it was hard to watch. They billed free wifi but it took a good 10 min to just load google. My credit card was charged for 2 totally different charges and I am currently trying to resolve the erroneous charge for which they do not even have on file. So if you have they type of money to spend on a hotel like this, go to a different hotel if your looking for something modern and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Romantic Get Away”
Reviews.Author: AnnFurbay
Reviews.Content: Our junior suite was beauiful, well appointed, quiet and made for a very romantic stay. The French Room was amazing from the ambiance to the service and of course the food. Everything made for the perfect weekend get away.

Reviews.Title: “The best of the best”
Reviews.Author: tiredtravler99
Reviews.Content: This hotel is consistantly the best of the best in terms of luxury, service and conmfort. The staff is consistantly trying to up the game in terms of anticipating your needs. I stay there annually, and it is just outstanbding in every way. My favorite staff member is Darlene, who does the wake up calls- the best way to starty the day!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully appointed hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Klextra
Reviews.Content: The lobby is gorgeous, with beautiful carpets and an antique carved piano. The room was large and very nicely decorated. Our bathroom was especially nice, with a TV speaker and an iron stand for the vanity area. Every employee we interacted with was very helpful and friendly. We were provided excellent directions to the DART station for the train to the State Fair.

Reviews.Title: “The best non-chain hotel I have stayed in for years.”
Reviews.Author: AbbyWinston
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is a charming, meticulously maintained historic hotel with well-trained, friendly staff. They handled every aspect of my stay professionally and accurately, from a late check-in to the courtesy van service. It is comfortable, clean and quiet - pleasant to work in your room if you choose to.

Reviews.Title: “Everything but the cleanliness of the carpet edges was great.”
Reviews.Author: KathyMA
Reviews.Content: I loved the uniqueness and the character of the hotel. It was a very pleasant stay and I would recommend the Adolphus to others. Please just play more attention to the carpets (especially around moldings and door edges). All employees were pleasant, professional and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel - Not sure about the Hype”
Reviews.Author: Fzipped
Reviews.Content: First of all, I had no expectations other than a good hotel to stay with amenities and a close walk to the convention center. Checking in was easy and a quick escalator lift to the elevators wasn't bad. the room was one of those where there were steps up to get to the floor in the back. not bad but if you have a lot of luggage, you have to stop and meander you way up about 8 steps. The room was quite large, exceeded my expectations. the TC was a flat CRT and very far from the bed assuming you watch TV in bed. The bed was comfortable, pillows were a more foam than feather, rather hot at night. The AC points away from the bed so circulation of air where you sleep is needed. I kept the temperature around 66 to remain comfortable. The bathroom had a tub, a bit off color an old. The sink was chipped and is inside a cubby so it's hard to blow dry your hair next to the mirror without smashing your elbows in the two sides. I'm only 6'1". The door to the room while closed lets lots of light in and luckily it wasn't noisy. The besth thing going at this hotels is to go grab free breakfast at the Magnolia and grab free drinks from 5:30 to 6:30pm there too. Just walk in and say you forgot your card. although I'd recommedn to a friend, I wouldn't place this on the hotel of dreams by any stretch of the imagination. I also had a standard room.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: autumnlvick
Reviews.Content: Probably would have never stayed here if it werent for the wedding location being located in the hotel. but it was great and I am so glad i did stay.

Reviews.Title: “Aaah - relaxing”
Reviews.Author: crazymonk67
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property twice. 1st time got a room with a street view. Rooms with a back of the building view, no so nice. But if you're not going to spend lots of time in your room, it does not matter anyway; does it? Very nice property, updated with nice looking and comfortable furniture. Free Wi-fi is a plus if you need to work on the road. Valet parking is a little pricey but worth it. Staff is courteous. Learning your way around the first two floors is interesting. Looking forward to my next stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for the Value”
Reviews.Author: BPare
Reviews.Content: This place was centered right in the middle of Downtown Dallas, walking distance to the Dealy Plaza and many resturants, only a 30 min drive from the Stockyards in Fort Worth and well worth the money. The rooms are spacius w/ a great living area and bathroom, the beds were a little worn and my spouse ended sleeping in her own bed due to the smallness of them but it was a great night's sleep for me. There are 2 bars downstairs, one was very intimate and other a great place to watch the football game. There's a starbucks across the street and the staff was very friendly. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely grand hotel in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: irishmm
Reviews.Content: We loved stayiing at the Adolphus (one night only, while we went to the State Fair). The AAA rate was very reasonable, on a Friday night. Our room was elegant, very clean, and spacious. A comfortable king bed made for a good night's sleep after a long day at the Fair and dinner in the West End (walking distance from the hotel). The character and ambience of an historical hotel such as this tops the "chain" hotels any time. Look for the bellman with the "Elvis" haircut and great Southern charm. "Thank ya very much" for an overall charming stay at the Adolphus.

Reviews.Title: “!9th Floor is Spooky!”
Reviews.Author: Shelly41908
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a quick weekend in Dallas to catch a Cowboys game, It was convienent and very centrally located to the Downtown area, walking distance to a lot of restuarants and the Dealy Plaza which is also a must see. This hotel was very pretty to admire, the lobby has a wall of keys in the back which is a great photo shot. At night there is a ambiance that follows you and the rooms are spacious. The mystery about the 19th floor is just spooky getting off the elevator but it made for some fun ghost stories. We would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic hotel! Impeccable...”
Reviews.Author: kobydog1
Reviews.Content: Beautiful historic hotel! Impeccable service and in a great downtown Dallas location. Perfect for local staycation weekend get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Good Historic Place”
Reviews.Author: Jchambliss
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is great historic hotel in downtown Dallas. It is a bit out of the way, but that works in its favor most of the time. The staff is very helpful and they are quick to offer a hotel car to run you around if you ask. I opted to walk and most places in downtown area you would want to visit like the Westend Historic District, the Arts District, and Victory Park area are about 15- 30 minute walk from the hotel. You get a good room and a very helpful staff however, and to be honest you see more of the city if you put in the time to take the short walks. As always, you should be mindful of your surrounding, but I had no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, just great. Great location for our stay. Great staff!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ladyinpink034
Reviews.Content: We went to Dallas to spend a day at the Texas State Fair. I wanted something close, and something that didn't put me in an area where I'd have to worry as we had my six year old son with us. Our vehicle was valet parked, the staff was nothing short of fantastic, very professional, and made us feel at home. The gave us tips on the area, and the concierge knew just where to send us. My only complaint was about our room being on the outside wall where an outdoor band was playing at the Iron Cactus across the street until 11:00 or so at night. Avoid the corner of the building across from the Iron Cactus or you'll hear it until they quit for the night.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay.”
Reviews.Author: silver003
Reviews.Content: I would suggest making harder to access tv channels with charges.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay and staff”
Reviews.Author: WindOne
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious. The staff is friendly and accomodating. Each time I come to the hotel, I am greeted professionally. I recommended this hotel to one of my colleagues who was staying the same week as I. He also loved the stay.

Reviews.Title: “SO accomodating to last minute travelers”
Reviews.Author: mrkdorf
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for it's location to the passport office on our way out of the country for our honeymoon, and we were blown away by the service. We booked this hotel upon arrival due to our passport mishap, and were elated when they took AAA discounts. When we went to our room we found it to be one of their largest and most sought after rooms totaling what would normally be a $1450 room! the man who booked our room for us upon arrival was so kind to help us out on our honeymoon and gave us a fabulous room for bottom dollar! Thank you so much!

Reviews.Title: “Full of character, very comfortable, and...”
Reviews.Author: 12ab3c
Reviews.Content: Full of character, very comfortable, and gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel, Clean and Spacious Room”
Reviews.Author: love2travel42
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here. The staff was very courteous and eager to assist. We were pleasantly surprised with the spacious room and roomy bathroom. The room was equipped with everything we needed. Would recommend this hotel, and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great visit”
Reviews.Author: PatrickR54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Apolphus for two nights. We went to a concert a few miles away and celebrated our anniversary with a dinner at Tthe French Room on-site. We were greeted very warmly. While the hotel is a glimpse back at old-money opulence, the staff is not stuffy at all. Everyone was friendly. The rooms are quite large for a downtown property and very comfortable. The French Room provided us with a memorable, though expectedly pricey, anniversary splurge meal. The food was and service were both just spot-on and the wine was perfect. Overall, a great little getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Very Nice Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJMorgan
Reviews.Content: The price for this hotel was competitive with any hotel in the DFW area and the location made it very convenient to see the entire area. The parking is a little expensive but that is the only complaint. The hotel was very nice and the room was clean and well maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at a classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: st8cc8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night on business. The room was priced at around 100 per night - fairly good value. There was a bit of a strange smell from the plumbing for a while, but it went away. The bathrooms are very nice. All of the staff was pleasant, and helpful, making the experience very enjoyable. The in room breakfast was surprisingly good too. The hotel has a very historic feel to it and is classically decorated. If you have more free time than I did on my trip, one could really enjoy the atmosphere. The hotel has free internet, which is nice, but it was really slow.

Reviews.Title: “Classic hotel - elegant and classy!”
Reviews.Author: wsexton
Reviews.Content: From the front desk staff, to the concierge, the bell men, and restaurant staff - everyone seems proud of their role at the Adolphus and you are greeted with friendly and efficient service. The hotel is classic elegance from a more romantic era. The bedding is first rate and comfortable. The marble bathroom is spacious and rich. The Adolphus is a very good hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like I was right at home.”
Reviews.Author: ShariHoutler
Reviews.Content: I was so comfortable and relaxed during my entire stay. It made being away from my family much easier.

Reviews.Title: “The staff was friendly, efficient and very accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: CSlusher
Reviews.Content: I was always greeted with a smile and with a helpful attitude. The hotel is gorgeous and the rooms and inroom bathrooms were very nice. I would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, grand old hotel but needs a better breakfast”
Reviews.Author: DairyTraveler
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the Adolphus over all and found the staff friendly and helpful. The room wasn't as updated as others (TV was old and pointed away from the bed), but held the charm of an older property. Only complaint is that the breakfast buffet was one step above a two-star chain. The hotel deserves a grand buffet in the European tradition to match its elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Oustanding Service and Value”
Reviews.Author: BGent
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze and I was automatically upgraded from a jr. suite to a luxury suite The concierge and bell staff were extremely attentive.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Mini Get-Away”
Reviews.Author: RedOakTexas
Reviews.Content: Overnight stay at the Adolphus. Hotel is located in downtown Dallas-- walking distance from Neiman Marcus, close to the Dallas Museum of Art, Nasher Sculpture Center, The Sixth Floor Museum, and restaurants. Service at hotel was superb. Staff was attentive to all our needs and extremely helpful and outgoing. The room was spacious and wonderful. We had a Junior Suite with a large balcony....since my husband is a smoker it was perfect. Had dinner at the French Room---food was excellent! The hotel was elegant but very comfortable and cozy. Loved it!! It was a very intersting mix of guests---families, couples, business travelers. Would highly recommend it for an anniversary or weekend get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LifeisGoodinTexas
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! The lobby is gorgous and the rooms are great. We had a room with 2 double beds and it had a small sitting area. The beds were very comfortable and I wish I could have taken their fluffy pillows home with me. We had family in town and the room was large enough for people to come and visit. We booked on-line and only paid $95, I have paid more than that to stay at a Best Western or Holiday Inn, and this place is a luxury hotel. We even saved money by parking in a parking garage down the street, which only charged $2.00 on the weekends. If you want to feel special, I really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Service and location”
Reviews.Author: courtieboy
Reviews.Content: Myself, my wife and our four year old stayed for two nights. Everything was fantastic, the room, the service and even the price. The courtesy Sedan was great for visitng the sites. It is plush but not too snobby for middle of the road travellers like ourselves. Look for any discount deals and go for it1

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus is elegant and relaxing.”
Reviews.Author: Delighted33
Reviews.Content: We recently attended a conference in Dallas and chose to stay at The Adolphus. This hotel is beautifully decorated and furnished. The room was "roomy" and elegant, and the beds were very comfortable. Although they were extremely busy with a large number of guests arriving at the same time, they were courtesous, helpful, and well organized. We contacted staff for additional needs that were promptly met. They were prepared for the conference attendees in all aspects of the hotel. The crowd was a little overwhelming, but the professionalism of the staff made things run smoothly and in a timely manner. We were very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: kellyalexsmommy
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus Hotel was such a wonderful suprise! This was the first time I had stayed there. The Hotel sent a car to the airport that was on time and the man was really nice. The Lobby area is so beautiful as were the rooms. The Hotel is a Landmark and is over 100 years old yet kept beautifully. The staff is kind and thoughtful. I slept better than I have in years there. Plus it is a real bargin to stay there! I highly recomend teh Adolphus Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus Hotel in Dallas is a unique and wonderful experience because of its history and beauty.”
Reviews.Author: former01
Reviews.Content: Downtown Dallas is a nightmare to drive around, with the one-ways and trains/els, and highways, if you miss your turn, you have trouble getting around with the no U-turns and traffic. Not all GPS's have accurate up-to-date maps, making directions not exactly accurate. The hotel is great, though!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grand Dame”
Reviews.Author: mstrattoncat
Reviews.Content: While looking at colleges in the Dallas area, we decided to stay at the Adolphus, mainly because reviews were good and price was reasonable. Although it is downtown, and we were not there for business, we found it to be centrally located and the ease of parking was fine. Staff was very professional and friendly. The hotel is just beautiful. Our junior suite was very spacious with wonderful bedding. The room was a tiny bit tired, but extremely clean - still a 4/5. We would stay there again, even though we were looking at the SMU campus. The drive was easy and certainly close to Neimans downtown and an easy drive to the Arts District.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus is the only place to stay in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Dallas78266
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is an historic hotel with beautifully appointed spacious rooms, wonderful staff, great downtown location and I will continue to stay here every time I am in Dallas. You can't beat the quality of this hotel for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “The Ninth Annual Chinese Auction at the Adolphus Hotel was beyond expectations....”
Reviews.Author: KKHutcherson
Reviews.Content: From the beautiful and spacious Junior Suite that my husband and I stayed in to the gorgeous decor and exemplary service from the staff, Paula Fenner and the Adolphus hotel succeeded in hosting the most amazing and successful Chinese Auction that our DFW Chapter has had in ages! I will recommend their catering/staff/facilities to anyone who is ever looking for a first class event location in Dallas,TX! Kimberly Hutcherson President, HSMAI DFW www.hsmai-dfw.org

Reviews.Title: “Great History and Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Polyrose
Reviews.Content: I truly enjoyed my stay at the Adolphus and the room itself. Although on the 21st floor, there were never any elevator delays, and the hotel overall was beautiful. The staff and the atmosphere were both hospitable. The car to transport people to the Convention Center was a definite benefit - the outdoor temperature was over 100 deg F every day. There is free wireless if you have a laptop, but note that the Business Center does charge for internet access on their computers. :-( I am happy to recommend the Adolphus for a stay in downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “very nice - would stay again”
Reviews.Author: AVisitor80126
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that retains its charm. From the valets to the rest of the staff, they were excellent, and going out of their way to assist. Our room was not ready when we first arrived, and they could have not been more accomdating in getting us into a room asap. But - second time on this trip - we requested a king bed and got two doubles. Given we waited for the room already, we took it. Only complaint about the room was that the windows were filthy - someone had drawn little "porno" pictures in the dust that were quite visible when the sun shined in :) The food in the bistro was OK - nothing to write home about. For breakfast there is a corner bakery a few blocks away that is better food and better value. The bar is great - great bartenders, free peanuts and very reasonably priced drinks and beers. I would stay here again - with the great rate we were able to receive. I wouldnt pay full price....

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with this hotel and I would stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: DMonty73
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and very helpful, friendly staff. The room was very quiet even though it looked over a very busy street. Room service was prompt and the food excellent. The room was very large with great closet space.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel with a lot of history and ghost stories!”
Reviews.Author: nearnhart
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus hotel in Dallas Texas is one of the most pleasurable places to stay when visiting friends, family, or pleasure. The hotel staff is very knowledgeable of the area and history of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “lovely”
Reviews.Author: PerkasieMyounger
Reviews.Content: This is an old world, old money feel hotel. The service was impeccable, very professional and caring. The hotel often used the hotel limo for us. We ate in each restaurants and room service , everything was fabulous. I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: VTLaxRef
Reviews.Content: Fantastic room and the staff could not have been more helpful. If I ever need to visit the downtown Dallas area again, I would definitely stay at this property again.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus excelled in every way.”
Reviews.Author: DSA_NL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding in every way. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout my stay. The rooms are clean, spacious, quiet and elegant. Room service and the restaurant serve excellent food at reasonable prices. The lobby and common areas are beautiful and relaxing. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel great experience”
Reviews.Author: jamisonpi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night with my husband, our 13 year old son and my mother. My mother got a single room and my family stayed in a junior suite. The rooms are larger than average. It is a very beautiful hotel and they are pet friendly. The food in the bistro was overpriced for breakfast charging 8.50 for 2 scrambled eggs. The grill for lunch was delicious and the atmosphere was fun. We heard all about the ghost stories from the bartender. We stayed on the 19 floor in hopes of seeing the elevator doors open and close, but all we heard was a big band playing that startled us in the middle of the night. We would stay here again. Good value on the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Classy hotel with great service in the heart of downtown.”
Reviews.Author: tjlex
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great! Stay for four nights and I have nothing negative to say about it. The price was very reasonalbe. The rooms were very large, bathroom ammenities were of good quality, and house keeping was excellent. I recommend the Walt Garrison's Rodeo bar/restaurant located on the first floor. Great food, service, and atmosphere. The location allowed for easy walking distance to several other bars, restaurants, pharmacy, shoping, and Dealey Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “The home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: wongash01
Reviews.Content: I have been going to the Adolphus since 1987. Twenty three years later they are still great and a place you can rely on---there's Jimmy, who greets you and makes you feel welcome and helps you out of your trans and into the hotel, theres the wonderful, professional staff to check you in and out efficiently, there's John who takes you and your luggage to your room, gets you settled in, and is always available for anything you need (if he can't or doesn't know, he will find out), and there's Reginald, who can get you the hotel car, refer you to the restaurant, store, show and more so your desires can be satisfied. You can walk to the Dallas Convention Center!

Reviews.Title: “"Stay at the Best-YOU Deserve It"”
Reviews.Author: PinkCaddie
Reviews.Content: With so many cookie cutter Hotels " out there - I always look for something a little different. I love atmosphere and personality in hotels and resturants. The Adolphus has both atmosphere and personality. The ice is brought to your room and placed in an ice bucket with a emerald green tassel. How fun.! Much better than the " run of the mill " ice machine at the end of every hall. NOT quaint! The lobby has the Baby Grand piano, just wish I knew how to play.! And the beautiful sofas and chairs! WOW! I would not mind just sleeping in the lobby! The Bistro with its TEA Pots offers such a great dining experience. Try the Tortilla soup! YUM!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, but not worth Travel & Leisure review or rack rates”
Reviews.Author: Leverett97
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus based on a recent article in Travel & Leisure naming it the #9 city hotel in the country. It was lovely, but I can't believe it's one of the top 10. The room was shabby around the edges, the bed a little too soft, the food overpriced. That said, the decor and spacious rooms were luxurious, and it was well worth the great AAA weekend rate we got. We would stay again at a similar rate, but probably not at a higher rate.

Reviews.Title: “Mary Kay Beauty Consultant Pleased with Staff Service!”
Reviews.Author: MaryKayConsultant_1
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved the staff at the Adolphus in Dallas, Texas! They did their absolute best to ensure my comfort and fix any problems or answer any questions I might have had. Mayra at the front desk and Jerry at the concierge desk were especially helpful and kind. The hotel has beautiful woodwork and stone accents with a charming mix of elegant antiquity and modern efficiency. When I was just glancing at the pictures on their website my first thought was of an exclusive 1800's hotel that only the well-to-do stayed at. This is a very beautiful building which shows its classical elegance and grace at every turn and sometimes in delightfully surprising ways.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Grandeur in downtown Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: Marti32
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the benefits of staying at the Adolphus! Beautiful architecture, both inside and out, courteous, competent, eager to assist and professional staff throughout, were what we expected and received at this hotel. Our yearly convention is held in Dallas & we know we have the best hotel one could ask for-thank you Adolphus! See you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: erazsicxela
Reviews.Content: I loved everything about this hotel. The rooms were decorated elegantly and traditionally. The lobby and other common areas seemed authentically historical and refined. The beds were so comfortable, and the linens were very crisp and pretty. Our room had a HUGE closet as well as spacious bathroom. The service was professional and welcoming, not at all stuffy.

Reviews.Title: “Historical and Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: MBones7
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a Monday night in the Summer during a business trip, landed a fantastic AAA great. Absolutely magnificent lobby. Staff was friendly, efficient, and knowledgeable. I had a mid-level room, which was huge and very nicely appointed. On the downside, as pointed out in other reviews, it had tissue paper thin walls. Fortunately, I had quiet neighbors. Also, there are probably better neighborhoods or parts of this city to stay in, this part was sort of dull and borderline sketchy. Finally, the Rodeo Bar/Restaurant had a good bartender but had a lame menu and was a pretty weak scene. Overall, I had a pleasant stay for my limited needs.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it used to be”
Reviews.Author: Zbison
Reviews.Content: I attend the Dallas convention center every year here and we always stay at the Adolphus. When I say "we," I mean thousands of women at the same time in the Adolphus and surrounding downtown hotels. We first were given a room with only one bed and had to be moved to the double bed room we had reserved. The next day I walked into the room at 5:30 PM and the housekeeping staff were just starting to clean our room. She left that day with only wiping down the bathroom and making the beds; no garbages emptied or floors cleaned. Several colleagues had trouble this year with not getting any new towels, or housekeeping leaving wet towels behind on the floor. Typically, this is NOT the Adolphus standard, so I'm guessing they must have laid off some staff due to the economy. That's the only excuse I'll make for them. Room service was excellent, but you can also eat a great buffet downstairs at the Bistro. There's a nice burger restaurant also in the hotel that we ate at a couple of times, but the food quality wasn't consistent. First it was great, but the last time it was terrible. Mixed opinions from fellow colleagues might suggest we'll try one of the other hotels this year. The Rennaissance has always been great, but not within walking distance of the convention center like the Adolphus is.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay at the Adolphus”
Reviews.Content: I had a wonderful time this summer at the Adolphus Hotel in Dallas Texas. The hotel itself is exquisite. The hotel staff were friendly and bent over backwards to do whatever was needed to accomodate my needs. The food was delicious. The service was outstanding. It was in easy walking distance to the convention center. I enjoyed the walk, but they do have shuttle service available.

Reviews.Title: “The was the best experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: buttercup76
Reviews.Content: Great location to conduct business and convenient for other leisure activities.

Reviews.Title: “Well maintained and refreshed established hotel!”
Reviews.Author: reltubsj
Reviews.Content: I found the Adolphus to be a well maintained established hotel. Has that traditional charm, but updated tastefully with flat screen TV and wi-fi! Even on 17th floor at 0900 in morning, water was hot!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: Slubs
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus was a great place for us to stay. Very classy without being snobby, Excellent taste in decor. Spacious standard room. Very quiet in the room. Great deal. Go for it!.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Big Rooms, OK breakfast”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoFamily2010
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and the rooms were very large and clean. It has a very grand lobby area next to reception. Only stayed one night on business - the location seems pretty dead but we were able to walk to the convention center with no problem in the morning. Staff was friendly and everything went well. My only slightly negative comment is that the breakfast buffet was pretty limited in its offerings for the price. I was fine with it and thought the food was satisfactory, but my collegues all opted for menu items instead - and they enjoyed their food.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and Enjoyable!!”
Reviews.Author: jevans12
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Adolphus several times while in Dallas. It was a wonderful old world hotel that gives great service. They are quick to assist you and the room service for dining is great. The beds are quite comfortable and the rooms are spacious.

Reviews.Title: “WOW”
Reviews.Author: Lacydeane
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough good things about this hotel. It was beautiful, comfortable, clean, and everyone was friendly!! They even had a free limo available out front for our use. I highly recommend this awesome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and Classy”
Reviews.Author: miracle2012
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is great, the staff is friendly and helpful, the rooms are spacious. The newly remodeled fitness center has some great equipment. We had a banquet meal there that was amazing. I always enjoy my time at the Adolphus.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus Wows”
Reviews.Author: AmeliaRKClark
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Adolphus last weekend, and everything was truly amazing! The valet was very prompt, and even thought there were several people in the lobby upon our arrival, I did not have a wait to speak of to check in. All of the staff were so nice, I really understand why the hotel gets such wonderful reviews about their service. Room service was prompt, and the concierge was so helpful with directions and information. We even left something in our room, and when I called housekeeping they sent someone up to look for it and called us right back. I will definitely be staying at The Adolphus again at the first opportunity.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus is a beautiful hotel with an incredible staff!”
Reviews.Author: mwright6101
Reviews.Content: I was a guest at The Adolphus Hotel in Dallas, TX in July 2010. I can not praise the staff enough for their high level of professionalism and attention! Although the hotel was completely filled with guests, the staff went above and beyond making me feel like I was the only one that needed assistance no matter what it was I needed. My room was beautiful and I intend on finding out where I can purchase the pillows - they were incredible! ALL of the staff that assisted our large group with transportation was very courteous and extremely attentive as they moved us in and out so quickly and with ease. I never waited long for transportation - it was always available. Adolphus had a limo available the 4 days of our stay and I want to commend our driver, Brian, who was so helpful and extremely courteous and kind. We thank you Brian for taking us back and forth and getting us where we needed to be during our stay at The Adolphus. Thank you all again! I will be staying at The Adolphus again next time I visit Dallas and will not consider staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Marge43
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is a Grand Hotel that is a Historic Landmark with a 5 Star Restaurant but it also has two other very good restaurants in the building. The Convention Center is a short wwalk away an there are other restaurants and shops in the area.

Reviews.Title: “An experience of classy elegance.”
Reviews.Author: MKayKruiser
Reviews.Content: It is a place that you can count on having a stress free experience in a beautiful room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Historic Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: Retiredlady8
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance of a number of restaurants. Much larger rooms than would be expected. Excellent overall experience. We booked a weekend online with advance pay which made it a great value. The only problem was the bed in the room was so broken down it was a roll to the middle experience. We did get another room that was certainly not as nice as the first because the first room's view was the best. Lightening fast room service and except for the bed a great overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent food, not impressed with the hotel service”
Reviews.Author: Stephintexas
Reviews.Content: We were going to a dinner party at the French Room and decided it would be fun to book a room and stay the night. On a positive note, everything we had to eat and drink at the hotel was perfect. We started with coctails at the bar next to the French Room. It was a small bar and only people from our party were there. The cocktails were expertly made and delicious. We then had a 3 course meal for 11 people at the French Room and everything was delicious. I had the beef tenderloin, which practically melted in my mouth. Most people ordered the salmon, which the man next to me declared to be the best thing he had ever eaten. The service in the French room was outstanding. We had breakfast the next morning at the Bistro and it was also great (I had egg whites, berries & toast. There was also a small buffet for about $10 which many people chose & looked good). Now for the bad...upon checkin I was told I had not booked a king bed (even though I knew I had & later confirmed w/ my Expedia reservation that I had) & they could only provide me with a queen room. The room was old world beautiful, but the lighting in both the room and the bathroom was very poor. I had to turn on the heat lamp in the bathroom to get adequate lighting to see to apply makeup. Many of the individual lamps in the room did not work. The bed bowed in the middle once you laid on it (not supportive), which also meant that the flat sheet on the bottom was quickly coming off the bed. I try to make the best of any stay, and was content with having a place to stay after a lovely party, until the next morning when I felt that they were actually trying to kick me out of the hotel. My husband and I went to the elevator to go down for breakfast about 8:30 am. We had no bags with us. As we approached the elevator, a maid asked "what room are ya'll checking out of?" I told her we were not checking out. She said "Ok, just trying to turn the rooms for the next group you know". Someone should tell her a bit of friendly conversation and then a polite inquiry as to whether we were checking out would have given her the same information she wanted without seeming that we needed to leave so she could get her job done. After breakfast, we went back to the room to get ready to check out. The plaque on the door said checkout was 1pm. At 9:55 the phone rang, it was maid service checking to see if we were still there or could they come clean the room. I answered that obviously, we were still there. Keep in mind that the "do not disturb" sign was still on our door, had they checked. The service at the restaurants was 5 star. Unfortunately, the service at the hotel itself doesn't come close. The Magnolia is right next door and next time I will eat at the French Room, but stay at the Magnolia!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in town”
Reviews.Author: Coastguardkids
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Adolphus every July and I wouldn't want to stay anywhere else. The staff is always polite, friendly and courteous. The hotel is beautiful and has an old European elegance about it. The beds are very comfortable, the rooms classy and clean and the bathrooms are opulent. Room service is prompt and polite. They make you feel like you are important and welcome. Our group looks forward to our annual luncheon and eating at The Bistro Restaurant every year as they have the best Tortilla Soup I have ever had! Highly recommended hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality for the price.”
Reviews.Author: mason01
Reviews.Content: Easy phone reservation experience. Reservations asked about AAA membership and offered discounts, also discounts for pre-paying. Good value, chose a junior suite. Room was spacious, and bed was magnificent. Lots of light and outlets to plug into. Bathroom could have been more elegant to keep up with the rest of the room. Maybe a soaking tub would improve.

Reviews.Title: “This is a very excellent hotel for all business type's”
Reviews.Author: lauricereilly7
Reviews.Content: The location is great. I love being able to walk to different areas, that are close by. The convention center is in walking , the Shuttle and cab's are right there when you need them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: justimagineinc
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay was fantastic! We booked our reservation through a travel deal online, but you would never know it based the way we were treated from the moment we entered the hotel until the time we left. The staff was attentive and polished. Everyone seemed to know that it was our 15th anniversary and went above and beyond to make it memorable. We had appetizers in the French Room Lounge. If that was any indication of the quality of the food served in the actual French Room, we can't wait to return and eat the full meal! Breakfast was outstanding as well. I am completely impressed with this "grande dame" of a hotel. She is a jewel in the heart of downtown Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is 1 star at best”
Reviews.Author: KP_vs_theworld
Reviews.Content: Room wasn't clean when we arrived. The ice bucket had smelly stale water in it from previous tenant. Poor job on housekeeping. The couch had stains on it. The room was not very comfortable, it was just tolerable. Tried to get the A/C going with no luck. The room was outdated and overrated. We ordered room service, think dessert would be quality... we were wrong...Horrible Bland food and you can only get ICE from the Room Service department. Called front desk, no answer. Customer service did not exist. We have decided never EVER to stay here again. Worst Hotel I've been to in a long time. I tried to sort out all the problems with the front desk the next morning, asked for Manager...was told there was not manager on grounds and I would get a personal phone call from them. Well its been a week and no phone call.

Reviews.Title: “a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: vespagl
Reviews.Content: Old world charm, great facilities, intelligent staff, and a superb room made our stay exceptional. We highly recommend this hotel, you will not be let down!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Getaway in the Heart Of Dallas”
Reviews.Author: KCTraveller5171
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently visited Dallas and stayed at The Adolphus. This hotel was where we used to have "getaways" when we lived in Dallas and holds a special place in our heart. We've had too many incredible dinners at The French Room to describe and too many great experiences to remember. One thing is for certain, this hotel evokes a feeling of understated elegance while remaining warm to their guests. On several occasions we have been upgraded to one of their suites, as was the case this time, and were pampered beyond belief with a living room, dining room, kitchen and two baths! Room Service is always incredible and their proximity to the original Nieman Marcus store makes for a fun shopping trip. If you like chrome and glass this isn't for you but I don't know a woman alive who wouldn't enjoy a romatic dinner and the ability to slip upstairs on an elevator versus a car trip home to a houseful of kids! The Adolphus is a winner!

Reviews.Title: “Mary Kay talks about "Extra Mile" service: The Adolphus has it.”
Reviews.Author: ReneeBWilson
Reviews.Content: There is a reason that the Adolphus has a 5 star rating: their staff.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else in Dallas!”
Reviews.Author: MCCNELSON
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Adolphus. We wanted to take a last minute trip to Dallas for the night and had to bring our small dogs with us. We searched LetsGoPets.com and found a great rate for the Adolphus. We have stayed at the Ritz, W Hotel and the Zaza for our weekend trips to Dallas, but the staff at the Adolphus were by far the most helpful we have ever encountered. We will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay....”
Reviews.Author: istacze
Reviews.Content: I was in Dallas for the first time on a business trip/conference. I found this hotel to be very well staffed and beautiful! The hotel was clean and the staff was very helpful to a first time visitor. I was within walking distance to many great resturants and the hotel Bistro has a greast breakfast buffet. My room was spacious and very quiet. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like a VIP the entire stay!”
Reviews.Author: leat023
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for the weekend and had the best stay we have ever experienced at a hotel before! The moment you walk in you are sincerely welcomed by the amazing staff and feel like a celebrity because of the 5 star attention they give you. Jaime at the front desk was amazing and extremely helpful!! The room was huge compared to other hotels we have stayed at and was very comfy. The only "bad" experience was that the batteries in the remote went dead, we got new ones within 5 minutes of us calling though. I don't recall ever leaving a hotel and only having one thing that bothered me during my stay and this was insignificant. And their restaurant, I can't even begin to describe our experience in The French Room. It was beautiful, romantic, delicious, and we got an amazing deal (a 3 course meal for $50 per person, of course we went a little crazy on the wine though). We will definitely go back every time we visit Dallas! Thank you to the Adolphus for making us feel like VIPs and providing us with an unforgettable trip!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to have the Wedding of your Dreams!”
Reviews.Author: tcudg143
Reviews.Content: The hotel is absolutely beautiful and fabulous! The staff is so caring and will help you with anything you need right away. The food is delicious and the rooms have a very homey feel to them. I couldn't have asked for a better place to have my wedding. We will keep coming back every year to visit and remember what a special time it was for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel w/ a Grasshopper”
Reviews.Author: SNoble83
Reviews.Content: My wife and I loved this hotel. It was stunningly beautiful and our room was gorgeous. We only had one complaint. There was a very large grasshopper in our room that managed to get in our bed with us early on Sat. morning. It was quite the wake-up call. I still have yet to figure out how a grasshopper gets on the 19th floor of a hotel. In any case, we'd visit again, but we'd like a bug-free room.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy hotel, totally amazed at the friendliness and service of the staff”
Reviews.Author: erevell
Reviews.Content: I expected a nice hotel and when I arrived, was still pleasantly surprised at how nice everyone treated the customers. From the front desk, to the bell hop to the concierge, I was treated like they truly enjoyed their jobs and could not do enough to keep me happy! If you go, take a tour of the hotel, it is a magnificent place of grandeur that has been kept so perfect in the past 98 years it has been in operation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, FANTASTIC Staff!”
Reviews.Author: MemphisBelleWCC
Reviews.Content: The staff of this hotel is one of the best I have ever come across - and I have done A LOT of traveling. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and in a great location - walking distance to fantastic restaurants, shopping, and site seeing. They also have a hotel car, which is free of charge within a two-mile radius - this was extremely helpful when making quick trips, as taxis seem pretty pricey in Dallas. The only issue I came across was the "amenity" of the day pass to The Texas Club (a fitness facility a few blocks away). The website makes it seem as though a day pass is included in the room fee, but I learned that it actually costs $10/day. The cost might be worth it to some, as The Texas Club offers great classes and has a pool and hot tub, along with plenty of fitness equipment. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the area - especially if you are attending something at the Dallas Convention Center - it was a quick and easy walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Every Time”
Reviews.Author: Gidget350
Reviews.Content: I usually spend about 10 nights a year in Dallas, and Hotel Adolphus is one of my favorite places to stay. Although I do occasionally try different hotels, I always return to the Adolphus because it's simply the best! The hotel is always immaculately clean, the staff and service is wonderful, and it's in a great location. Their food is great as well. I highly recommend staying at the Adolphus, and will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A Very Grand Old Lady”
Reviews.Author: Vancana
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a cookie cutter hotel chain experience, then the Adolphus isn't for you. However, if you relish staying at an establishment that oozes history and class, where one can imagine how life used to be when service counted for something, then this is the place to be. From the moment you enter the front door, you are treated with professionalism and a genuine friendliness not often found these days. We stayed a total of six days, with a three day interlude in the middle, so we had plenty of time to gauge our thoughts, and to take the opportunity to dine in the French Room, the Bistro, and indulge in afternoon tea and enjoy drinks in the bar. All were top notch, with outstanding service and excellent quality meals, with a special mention to Jim Donohue and Carlos. The rooms we had were large, one being a junior suite we were upgraded to, and both were very well appointed. Room service was quick and efficient. And on at least half a dozen occasions we took advantage of the courtesy limo that is provided free for hotel guests to get to destinations in the downtown area. Room rates were very reasonable for this class of hotel. But it's the decor and history that is the appeal, and you can easily immerse yourself into the comfortable charm of the public areas, as it invites you to sit a while and ponder the old time values in a modern world. We look forward to returning soon. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: wickedwynell
Reviews.Content: Although my trip to Dallas was connected to my job, reservations were set up with the Adolphus Hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very nice and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent every visit!”
Reviews.Author: osumom710
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is one place I know I will always be treated well, have wonderful accommodations, and a fun and friendly environment. I love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: luvz2cruz
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful rate by booking online at the Adolphus website. We were extremely pleased with the hotel, the staff, and the location. Everything was top quality. Our only complaint was that the French Room was closed for renovations during our stay. It has to be done sometime, but I wish their website would have provided that information at the time of booking.

Reviews.Title: “Not customer oriented.”
Reviews.Author: gerbear333
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite at the Adolphus while in Dallas for surgery. The room they gave me was run down and poorly layed out. The bathroom was on opposite side of bedroom... had to walk through living room and office to get to it. This was not favorable given the reasons for me being there. I asked for alternative room with layout with bedroom next to bathroom which they could not provide. So I "moved out" of the hotel. They charged me for night's stay even though they were unable to provide me with a room with a bathroom next to it. I spent all of 2 minutes in the room. I travel alot and the way the customer service was handled was rushed, arrogant, and just rude. I'm not high-maintenance traveler and don't expect freebies. However, the cancellation policy was too rigid given their lack of adequate space. Travel with caution.

Reviews.Title: “Like a Classic Car.”
Reviews.Author: DoctorJoeE
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Adolphus is like driving a vintage '57 Chevy: You revel in the history, the solid construction, the nostalgia - and then you remember there's no air conditioning, no power steering or windows, no MP3 connection...and then the battery goes dead, or the carburetor blows up. When staying at a historic property, know that some modern amenities you usually take for granted will be absent, and that old things tend to break. The Adolphus has no in-room safes, no ice or soda dispensers, tiny bathrooms, and small, ancient picture-tube TVs which are hard to visualize from across the spacious room, and cannot be used to access your statement or check out electronically. Air conditioning is primitive and loud. Wireless internet is available (and free!), but signal strength is spotty at best. The hotel was built small (by Adolph Busch, the Budweiser guy) and then added onto, multiple times - which means the magnificent lobby is on 3 separate levels; and you can't go from some of the conference and ballroom areas to others on the same floor without going down a flight of stairs, crossing the lobby, and going up another stairway. This is annoying during a conference, and I suspect more so at a wedding reception. (This is the first choice for every Dallas wedding reception of any stature, apparently.) All of that said, the Adolphus is the place to stay if you must spend the night in Dallas. It reeks of old-world history, prices are reasonable, and the service is superb. No other vintage hotel that I know of, with the possible exception of the legendary Palace in San Francisco, has been as lovingly restored and preserved. This is what it must have been like to stay in a first-class hotel in the early 20th century. The main restaurant, called the French Room, is also excellent, with a well-chosen and fairly-priced wine list. Portions, however, are what my wife calls "nouvelle/no food" -- artfully arranged, but way too small for most American (and particularly Texan) preferences. Two of my three major hotel pet peeves must also be mentioned: valet parking is outrageously priced -- why do hotels feel entitled to charge so much to park your car? (There is, however, a public garage 2 blocks down.) And they have in-room "mini-bars", which I consider an insult on general principle. Here, the prices are not only ridiculous, but they actually tack on a 20% "restocking charge" as well! (Do they think we're stupid? Or do alcoholics simply not care what alcohol costs?) Internet access (my 3rd peeve) is available and free, as mentioned above, but the signal is weak. I understand the problems of wireless internet in an old building, but it wouldn't cost much to install a few extra wireless transmitters. In short, like a '57 Chevy, the good aspects outweigh the bad, in my opinion -- as long as you know and accept the inherent limitations of vintage equipment.

Reviews.Title: “The food, service, and decor of the French Room are second to none!”
Reviews.Author: LSUTIGER_NOLA
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is a nice hotel with an incredible staff. Dining in the French Room is a delightful experience for each of your senses that is certain to unsurpassed by any restaurant in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus Hotel is truly a wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Gr8FunGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adolphus Hotel as it was recommended by the client we were visiting. The room rate was excellent, the rooms were great (the only downside was the window overlooking the courtyard was claustrophobic). the treats and mini-bar were greatly appreciated and the French Restaurant on property was first rate. I would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alpat79
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful time at the hotel. Staff, service, food, and room were all extraordinary. Would recommend for business and leisure travle to anyone. Terrific value.

Reviews.Title: “historic beauty WITH A TWIST”
Reviews.Author: sadiebugfriend
Reviews.Content: I love history, this is a step back in time ! Upon checking in I was told of a ghost on the 19th floor, a bride that was left at the altar in the early 1900's. Well.... my stay was on the 17th, thank goodness. My room to the view & the dining experience was perfection !! Looking forward to my next visit....TO PERFECTION !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok”
Reviews.Author: Archer83
Reviews.Content: The staff were helpful and friendly, a couple of the girls at the front desk were quite easy on the eye too... The rooms were good, only downer was that the wireless internet dropped out quite a bit in the second room (I stayed here twice) which got quite annoying. For some reason all the hotels in Dallas are quite expensive, so the value isn't too bad when it's all compared. If you get a cab in Dallas make sure they know where you want to go, a lot of them seem to have absolutely no basic geography and I found myself having to give them directions from my own map! This isn't a fault of the hotel's however but I did catch these taxis out the front.

Reviews.Title: “Very overrated”
Reviews.Author: mom_rn1
Reviews.Content: Our arrival at the hotel was ok. We checked in without any problems. Jerry, the concierge, took our bags to the room and was very helpful. He was the only quality aspect of this hotel. Certainly the rooms were attractive although the headboard on one of our beds was broken. The drain in the sink would not open either. Overall the room was just average. The beds were average and the furnishings were average. My biggest complaint is that we were nickel and dimed for everything. A 20 oz. bottle of soda was $3 and Jerry advised us to get our drinks and snacks at the convenience store behind the hotel. There was no social hour in the evening or anything like that, not even coffee in the lobby, just bad coffee in the little pot in our room. The computer was 10cents per minute and printing was 49cents a page and you had to swipe your credit card just to get the computer to turn on. We tried to call the front desk several times and were put on hold and gave up waiting every time, even Jerry gave up when he called from the room to ask a question when we checked in. This was a cheap hotel for a very high price. I would not recommend it unless you qualify as an honored guest, otherwise they don't have time for you. The last straw was when we found out they charged $24 per night for parking and the valets who parked the cars hovered with hands out as we got in and out of the car when we checked in and out. If we had driven around a lot requiring them to get our car and park it several times I might have been a bit less irritated. Again, unless you can afford one of the elite rooms don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel with an exceptional staff.”
Reviews.Author: Kstoddyb
Reviews.Content: This was my wife and I's second stay at the Adolphus in about three weeks. The first had been just a one night stay when we'd tried to pick up a vehicle we'd purchased online. We were so smitten by the gracious and attentive staff that we had to stay there the second time when we actually got the vehicle (with a new transmission). This time we took our 6yr old daughter as well. I honestly can't say enough about the people here...John in the Rodeo Bar, Paul at the front desk, and Sandoval (I apologize if the names not spot on) who was the Concierge the first time we stayed there...all were exceptional and very personable. My daughter adored Paul and loved talking to him about the animals in his native Zimbabwe. The food at the Bistro was very good, room service was prompt and courteous, and next time we visit we'll eat at the French Room (there will definitely be a "next time"). The location is great in downtown just a block from Nieman-Marcus and fairly close to the West End and the Dallas World Aquarium & Zoo.
