When you consider that the rooms at the Adolphus were less expensive than the rooms at the nearest Holiday Inn...it's a real no brainer to stay there. Try the Adolphus...I know I'm very glad that we did...

Reviews.Title: “Great way to spend our anniversary”
Reviews.Author: WestTXTravler
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 40th wedding anniversary after staying there on our wedding night in 1970. Great place to stay and I thought the price was extremely reasonable. Will go back when I can.

Reviews.Title: “Best service of any hotel in Dallas.”
Reviews.Author: swankorama
Reviews.Content: So quiet and peaceful on the 17th floor. Room was so comfortable and tastefully decorated. Staff made every effort to address you by your name. This is how hotels should be run!

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus is a wonderful place to stay in downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: janderPlano
Reviews.Content: Great, gorgeous hotel. Not much around late at night just outside the hotel unless you are into the bar scene, but the hotel itself has lots to look at!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: TexasSnorkelfans
Reviews.Content: Hotel was chosen by Bride for out of town wedding guests. Stayed 2 nights. Rooms were large, clean & comfortable. Staff excellent. Only downside was parking - Valet parking offerred ($$), but 2 blocks away was parking garage for a few dollars. Also - no pool, but we didn't need one anyway. We would return.

Reviews.Title: “So where do I start.....from the friendly bellman to the wonderful service at the party I hosted....it was all perfect.”
Reviews.Author: furniture1947
Reviews.Content: Hosting an after rehearsal dinner for 125 friends and family in a city ten hours away can be daunting, not to mention the need to plan a weekend full of activities to keep everyone happy. The staff at the Adolphus Hotel was at my side every step of the way from the hospitality suite, to the menu of exceptional food to service that was unbelievable. Everything was perfect and all of my guests felt pampered and special. Paula Fenner and her staff pulled off flaming deserts, beautifully set tables, people to help me move gift bags, boxes or grooms cloths from one room to another when we were at the wedding, and the list goes on and on. I cannot wait to go back to The Adolphus and spend another wonderful weekend or perhaps a week with the friendly staff that made all of us feel special and welcome each time we stepped out of our comfortable room. In today's hectic world, they seem to have captured the right pace and service to make everyone feel extra special. My son's wedding weekend will be long remembered as A+ thanks in part to this fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: BocaBlocks
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus was built by Adolph Busch of Budweiser fame so you know it was top of the line when it was built. Unlike some other historic hotels, the Adolphus is just as beautiful today with numerous expensive, beautiful and historic furnishings throughout. Ask at the desk for the information sheets that describe the items in the public areas. The service at front door, front desk, valet car compliments the decor and grandeur. Location is also great. You can walk to Sixth Floor Museum & the Art District in the other direction. Adolphus also will drive you to downtown attractions. Best to reserve with doorman in advance. Only service lacking was the poor concierge. Not knowledgeable about restaurants or concerts. Expected better at this level of hotel. We had an upgraded room that was large & well appointed. Do not miss dining in the French Room. This is not your usual hotel dining room. It is beautiful with great service from Jim Donohue, the maitre d' and his wait staff. The food is delicious, just don't come ravenous as it is nouvelle cuisine. Only nitpicks besides concierge for this top level hotel was lack of newspaper [please not USA Today!] at door in morning, no in-room safe and having to stop at desk to check out. If you like classical music, go to the Dallas Symphony. Call them directly or online and say "VisitDallas" to get 20% discount. Enjoy dinner in symphony hall at one of their 2 restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “5 star all the way”
Reviews.Author: sandpiperx1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in pretty much the best of the best in this country and I have to say the whole atmosphere at the Adolphus Hotel is top notch. Annibal The concierge handled everything I ask for and then some. Mayra at the front desk made me feel welcome and was on her game.. Not the normal I am just doing my job thing, But really enjoying taken care of the client, Wish there was more out there today as it was refreshing and pleasant. Would send anyone I know there and know they would be treated well.. Mark

Reviews.Title: “Top notch quality and customer service”
Reviews.Author: LizHopkins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding reception at the Adolphus in June 2009, and I could not have been more impressed with how great their customer service and attention to detail were throughout the wedding planning process, as well as during the wedding reception. I worked with their event planners for about a year, and they went above and beyond to make sure everything was perfect! I could not have imagined a more perfect place to have a wedding reception, and would highly recommend it to anyone thinking about staying there or having an event there. Amazing hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “If you go to Dallas, stay at this hotel. Service is excellent; hotel is beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: 55blondie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is spotless, beautiful and full of old world charm. The staff is friendly, the service is the best I have had in almost 20 years. They have a can do attitude and remember who you are each day. The small Bistro in the hotel has excellent food, value and best of all, A-one service. Be sure to ask for Diana; she smiles and takes good care of you and your breakfast! When I come back to Dallas, as a professional or visit, this is where I want to stay. I could spend all day in the lobby just relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Good old style hotel”
Reviews.Author: gmcc
Reviews.Content: We arrived here at about 11.30am after an overnight train trip from St Louis. I thought that we would only be able to drop the bags as we were early for checking in. Our room however was ready and we were able to check in without any problem. The hotel itself is really nice. It is not like the sterile chains where everything is the same. It has character and what I would call "old fashioned style." There are 2 restaurants and a bar in the hotel and a bar/restaurant attached. I only tried the attached bar and had some food there and went for a drink. Both food and drink were reasonably priced and bar staff excellent and very pleasant. Rooms were smallish but perfectly adequate with coffee maker, iron and board, plenty of cupboard space and cable t.v. The hotel is well placed for the historic district and the Sixth Floor Museum is about 15/20 min walk away. There are plenty of bars and restaurants in the close vicinity. The House of Blues is about 30 min walk from the hotel. One of the employees however told us we couldn't walk there as it was too far! Train station is also about 15/20 mins walk from the hotel. No shops nearby. A final comment is that everyone we met was exceedingly friendly and appeared genuinely happy that someone from Scotland would take the trouble to visit their city.

Reviews.Title: “This is a superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: goddsandiego
Reviews.Content: The rooms are like apartments, the service is caring and ever-present, the restaurant, bar and decor are just plain beautiful. The hotel offers a great sanctuary to the general dullness of downtown Dallas. I recommend this hotel as a destination in itself

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Reception at Adolphus Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Amandascgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding reception at the Adolphus Hotel in the large ornate ball room. The staff at the Adolphus were wonderful to work with and so helpful and welcoming to all of our guests. We had about 350 people attend out wedding and 175 of our guests stayed at hotel. It is the perfect place for out of town guests to stay and also walking distance from so many wonderful Dallas museums, Neiman Marcus Store, and Iron Cactus Restaurant. We hosted my bridesmaid lunch at the French Room and I could not have been happier. It was a dreamy night and I would not have changed anything. I highly recommend the Adolphus as a reception site and also a hotel for your guests to stay. We received so many compliments and thank you notes from our guests who stayed at the hotel and they all commented on how nice their stay was a the hotel and that they want to visit the hotel again. My husband and I spent our first night in one of their luxury suites and we were treated like royalty. Our guests also enjoyed another suite as the hospitality suite and were able to socialize and relax with each other. Beautiful Dallas Hotel with reasonable prices and much Dallas history.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: web92453
Reviews.Content: Dear Adolphus Team, Without reservation it has been an extreme delight to work with The Adolphus in Dallas for our daughter Sara's wedding in April of next year. Granted we just started organizing this momentous event and needless to say today we placed a reservation deposit with Jessica. Our Church is located in the Park Cities area so we wanted someplace close. After we met with The Ritz Carlton, The Mansion on Turtle Creek and The Crescent, it was evident that Jessica Furlow and The Adolphus was to be our location for Sara's wedding reception.We could have chosen any of these venues, however from the first time we met Jessica, and she made us feel at home instantly. Her warm smile and can do attitude should be treasured by your organization as Iâ€™m sure it is. You are very fortunate to have her on your team. We truly look forward to working with Jessica and the Adolphus in the next few months. If you are a Father or Mother please know that this is a trying time when your baby is leaving the nest. My comfort is Jessica being by our side in this process. Thank you for having such a beautiful hotel and wonderful staff. Sincerely, The Ballardâ€™s

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: ashleepage
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus hotel was my husband and I's wedding reception location. The service is the best in Dallas and we were completely taken care of. Out of town friends, family, and my husband and I stayed in the hotel for our wedding weekend and it was simply beautiful. We couldnt have asked for more and highly recommend the Adolphus hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The only hotel I trust for my client's accommodations”
Reviews.Author: 9265producer
Reviews.Content: My clients are in the entertainment field and expect nothing but 'the best' accommodations and service when they are travelling and performing. For the past 25 years I have worked with The Adolphus because I know my clients will receive the utmost in service and professionalism. I can rely on the hotel staff to attend to every detail of the reservation and specific individual requirements and ammenities. I know my clients will be well taken care of from the time the reservation is made through the time when they walk through the lobby doors to check -in until they depart. With all the details required to make the trip and my job and theirs successful, I can trust The Adolphus to make hotel accommodations worry free!

Reviews.Title: “Old World Luxury on a Modern Timeline”
Reviews.Author: casas32
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus is a beautiful old hotel with all of the modern conveniences. Three restraunts, one to fit any mood, from the French Room to the Bistro for breakfast to the Rodeo Bar for a fun lunch. The Adolphus has free wireless internet that made let me work and people watch in the lobby. Great service also.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: arstenor
Reviews.Content: Great deal and the best service level by entire staff - I finished a bottle of water and was wlaking in the lobbby and the bellman offered to discard the empty for me. The room was clean, free internet and great in room amenities. I will use them again in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Convention at The Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: DuaneMatthes
Reviews.Content: We were part of a 100 persn convention that had the Adophus as a host for our convention and the use of serveral of the hotel's conference rooms, as well as, the main Ballroom. The hotel staff met or exceeded our needs at every turn. The event staff for food and tecnical needs were outstanding. The Doormen met every one of our special needs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: sarab2002
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Adolphus for our wedding anniversary. We were married at the hotel last year and loved it, so we thought we'd begin a yearly tradition. The staff (especially Jessica Furlow!) was extremely helpful in making the initial reservation and also making reservations for both the French Room and Rodeo Bar. From the moment we walked into the hotel, the staff was courteous and very quick to make us feel at home. Even though we arrived before the appointed check in time, we were shown to our room. The room was breathtaking with a separate living room and a huge patio overlooking downtown Dallas. After unpacking we went down to the Rodeo Bar for lunch. We were not disappointed here either. The prices were very reasonable and the food was delicious. We both had the pulled pork sandwich and highly recommend it. That evening we went to the French Room for dinner. At $80 a person, we were a little hesitant to dine here, but all of our doubts quickly diminished. We were treated like royalty from the moment we arrived and truly felt like we were the only ones in the restaurant. I am a very picky eater and was worried about the menu items were not of the norm, but everything was incredible. I don't eat fish but my husband had me try his and even it was unbelievable. I highly suggest this restaurant if you are celebrating anything special or are just looking for a romantic night out. When we arrived back to the room, we were greeted with a chilled bottle of champagne and a rose petal turn down. We knew about this in advance since it was a package we chose when booking the room, but it was still fun to come back to after dinner. Overall, this hotel is incredible. The rooms are beautiful, the restaurants on-site are phenomenal, and the downtown location provides great proximity to local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Guest Thrilled at Adolphus - Dallas!!”
Reviews.Author: maryfunk
Reviews.Content: We had close to 100 nights booked with this hotel for our son's wedding. The rate was Wonderful and our stay was the Best EVER at Any Hotel!! We have stayed in many hotels over the years ~ but this hotel was different. The people who worked there made us feel Very Special. We greeted each other by first name every day and they were So Much Fun!! They met each and every one of our request with a smile ~ with superior efficiency ~ and with professionalism. The people that made our stay So Wonderful were at the front desk ~ at consiere ~ at valet ~ in the restaurant/bar area. We Absolutely Loved John - Anibal - Paul - Maya - & Jimmy!! When we checked out of the hotel there were hugs between all of us! They made us feel like family!! We had over 250 people attend our son's wedding and they stayed at the Adolphus ~ each and everyone had wonderful things to say about the hotel and we all had such a Great Time! The seating in the lobby was a meeting point for all of us and we got to have visits with close friends and family that wouldn't have happened had it not been available to us. We litereally stayed in the lobby for over 4 hours while every one of our guest checked out ~ it was a huge party with laughter and hugs. I would recommend THIS PARTICULAR HOTEL to any large group looking for a Wonderful and Inviting Place to entertain your guests! It is a Top Rated Hotel that went Way Past Our Expectations!! It was Our Pleasure and Complete Joy to Stay here ~ WE WILL BE BACK!! Mary Funk Austin Texas ~ and a Very Happy Mother of the Groom!! Thank you Adolphus ~ You're All THE BEST!!

Reviews.Title: “Best all around stay from a world traveler”
Reviews.Author: DLWolfe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the extreme pleasure to stay here for a wedding. Although there were two weddings taking place in the Hotel on the same night, we had a truly fabulous experience. Not only were the staff the most professional I have encountered, but they handled the massive influx of people very well. There was not a frown to be found, nor a ruffled feather by staff or customers. The suite was exceptional and the food was without a doubt top notch. We felt very well cared for and could not have found a thing to change or correct. Your Valet staff deserve an extra Kudo. Please, please let them all know how great they are. Many congratulations to you Mr Davis, you run a superb House. Terry and Debbra Wolfe-Houston

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant!”
Reviews.Author: yahighness
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the last night of the All-Star wknd and I must say I was impressed! I wasn't expecting to get everything we got for only $110. Very classy and older hotel that had a very warm feeling...the staff was wonderful. I will def stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Darling staff, huge rooms, ridiculously amazing food!”
Reviews.Author: eveorsburn
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel in Dallas - it is where I go to get away from my 3 year old and connect with my husband. The French Room is my favorite restaurant in the world - try the souffle and ask for Connie!

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Change of Pace”
Reviews.Author: jamy208
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Adolphus while visiting Dallas for a cheerleading competition. However, this stay at the Adolphus was definitely a departure from the normal, hum drum accommodations weâ€™re used to. For this type of event we normally stay at a Holiday Inn, Fairfield Inn and those types of hotels, which are fine. Weâ€™ve been confortable and have had no complaints. However I was very pleased when I stepped into the lobby of the Adolphus. Now Iâ€™m a very modern girl. Like things to be new and modern. Wouldnâ€™t normally go for anything old fashioned. But surprisingly I enjoyed the historical dÃ©cor of the Adolphus very much. I read a plaque on the building that said the hotel was built in 1911 by Adolphus Busch, co founder of Anheuser- Busch. Much of the original dÃ©cor and architecture remains, from the lobby to the rooms. The rooms vary as well. They are not all the same in layout and size. Because we were with a group I got to see a couple of different rooms. My room was on the smaller side, having a long hallway leading to the sleeping area. The desk was in this hallway. The sleeping area had two double beds with posters, but the bedding was very comfortable. We slept like a dream. The bathroom was huge. Large wardrobe housed the flat screen tv and some drawers. There was a mini bar as well as a small coffee maker in the room as well. Also the closet was HUGE. Like a walk in closet. However there were a couple of small negatives. Nothing major. First, as I said the bathroom was huge and was consistent with the historical dÃ©cor. The floor had a piece of some sort of sticky gum or something on it. It kind of blended in with the floor and was off to the side so may not have been seen by housekeeping. But they should mop the ENTIRE floor. Also, the shower wasnâ€™t my favorite. It had an old fashioned shower head where the water only went straight down. You had to stand right underneath it. Not a lot of pressure either. The appearance of the shower was very nice with slate wall tiles, however. The other negative is that after our first night there, we got up early and went to the competition and didnâ€™t return until about 3. When we walked in we saw that the room hadnâ€™t been cleaned yet. I was quite annoyed about this because I wanted to come to the room to rest because we had a busy morning. They didnâ€™t come until 3:30. I left the room so they could clean and came back to get my jacket to go outside about 15 mins later and she was already done. I donâ€™t think they vacuum daily. The room seemed clean, though. Also, the walls must be paper thin. I think the first night the room next door may have been empty, but the 2nd morning we could hear a VERY loud, unpleasant conversation, complete with profanity, going on next door. I think it was a phone conversation because I could only hear one voice. When I walked to the adjoining door I could hear the conversation clear as day. The Rodeo Bar & Grill had great burgers and is only open for lunch and dinner. There is another, much more expensive restaurant on the premises as well that serves breakfast. Overall, it was a good experience and I really enjoyed the different atmosphere from the usual hotel we stay in. It was like going back in time. Also, we got a very group rate of $99 per night which I was very surprised about. I would have thought they would charge much more, so it seems the rates are pretty reasonable. I wouldnâ€™t mind staying there again if I ever come to Dallas again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and historic hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: mai582
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adolphus for 5 nights for a conference and everything was great and grandiose there - the room was huge, the service was great, and the food in the French Room and at the Rodeo Bar was delicious (definitely try their chili!!) If I had one thing to complain about, it was that they never gave us enough room amenities. My colleague and I shared a room and even though we stayed there for 5 nights, they only gave us one small bottle of shampoo/conditioner/soap and housekeeping never provided us with any more after our first night. I know that many hotels are trying to be more environmentally friendly and I guess I could've called housekeeping to ask for more, but was it my job to call them every single day? I didn't want to go through that hassle and have to tip them every time, soI just ended up buying one at the local CVS... All in all, this place was very good, but can't say it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinK
Reviews.Content: In the heart of downtown Dallas, this is a very charming historic hotel. The staff was also very nice and helpful. The hotel is supposedly haunted, and I love haunted hotels. Unfortunately I did not experience any hauntings during my stay...

Reviews.Title: “Historic downtown hotel does it the old school way.....”
Reviews.Author: sp8holly
Reviews.Content: What a pleasure to stay for five evenings at the Adolphus Hotel in downtown Dallas. I had admired the hotel from across the street when I stayed at the Magnolia Hotel. Happily I was able to stay at the Adolphus on this business trip. I HAVE NEVER MET A MORE ACCOMMODATING CONCIERGE STAFF ANYWHERE. These people were professional, friendly and so helpful. I instantly felt comfortable at the hotel upon check in. My room was enormous and lovely in an old school sort of way....beautiful upholstery and lovely bathroom with great amenities. My room was very clean and I was so comfortable throughout my stay. This is a great GRAND OLD HOTEL. The common areas are so beautiful and if you have a minute ask the concierge about the history of the hotel and some of the furnishings. I highly recommend this hotel and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “great if you dont want to eat or sleep”
Reviews.Author: annederoo
Reviews.Content: the place is clean, the rooms are large, the beds are super comfy, nice pillows, everything you could ask for . . . EXCEPT the place has truly paper thin walls - you could hear our neighbor's telephone conversation like he was standing in the room with us & our room was above the ballroom which had a wedding going on (not sure why they put a non-wedding party guest above the wedding party) . . . absolutely terrible food at obnoxious prices (at the rodeo bar - $16.00 for cold chicken fried steak & lumpy mashed potatoes? - didn't try the supposed 5 star french restaurant since those prices were even more obnoxious).

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bittco
Reviews.Content: I have visisted many hotels in Dallas and this is probably my favorite. Sure the rooms need some updating but the hotel is more then the room- even if the rooms are spacious and have free internet. The hotel lobby is beautiful and massive. There are many spots for sitting back and relaxing. It is very classical looking and the location in downtown Dallas makes it very convenient for work purposes. It is also a historic hotel which plays a role in the history of the city- this sort of thing doesn't interest everyone but it does me.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exemplifies SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: Mroberts1954
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely experience at the Adolphus! Everyone is so professional and friendly! Our room was quite large, bed and linens were great. Even a walk-in closet! I want to give a special thanks to Phillip Johnson and Gerald! Both were huge helps when the valet service lost our car key (thankkfullly, we had a spare). Even that problem was quickly resolved once we got home. Another perk was the proximity to the downtown Neimans! WIll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great time and great service at the Adolphus!”
Reviews.Author: *kara*intn
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Adolphus and had a great time. In particular, the hotel was beautiful and service was great. We had lunch at the Rodeo Bar in the hotel and the food was surprisingly very good (I didn't expect much from a hotel bar). We also went to the Rodeo Bar for drinks one night and the service was excellent (thanks, John!). We had drinks one night at the Bistro Bar, and service was great there, too. I have to mention the main Concierge (I believe his last name is Odger). He was fantastic and helped me so much. He helped me find a place around the corner for a manicure and made the appointment for me. He also recommeded a place for my husband to buy a shirt, and he recommended a place for breakfast (Cafe Brazil) that was so good we went 2 days in a row. The location was good, too. There are both a CVS and 7-11 within a block, which is convenient for drinks/snacks, etc. I would recommend the Adolphus - I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus should be renamed "A-don't-us"”
Reviews.Author: Travalot2
Reviews.Content: This is 2nd time we've tried Adolphus in a year and it's even worse than before. The hotel itself is beautiful, historic, and centrally located but that is where it ends. They still have no organization to valet your car--you wait at least 20 minutes or so in the street before you can pull car in. In our room we find a toothpick wrapper on the table...minutes later we find the toothpick on the floor. Wine was supposed to be delivered upon check-in. Additionally, we had also asked for ice....2 phone calls and an hour later it finally arrives. When we call to get our car, we're told they are not taking phone requests. You have to go down in person to request...and that it would be a 20-30 minute wait before your car would be brought to you. When asked to speak to a manager, can you believe we were told there isn't one on site?...so we were told. Are you kidding me? This during busy time of year, week-end before Christmas! This is same type of thing we experienced before. It's a nice place to visit but I wouldn't want to stay there...especially given the price you pay! Too bad the service is so bad and they are indifferent. They beauty of the hotel is marred by the lackluster service you receive. You can always go visit the lobby and bar but save your $ and stay elsewhere. This coming from a seasoned traveler whose stayed at many a hotels!

Reviews.Title: “What an experience...Adolphus Hotel?? Almost.”
Reviews.Author: MissPigitheDiva
Reviews.Content: We had a company Christmas party at this beautiful & historic hotel. We were offered a awesome rate to stay overnight, and we thought, hey why not. A chance to stay at the wonderful Adolphus. I could certainly tell they had crammed a lot of events into this hotel for one evening. People in every nook and cranny. The hotel is indeed beautiful and charming and it was decorated to the hilt for the season. The halls of the hotel are the largest hallways I have every seen and extremely well lit all night long. Our room was very large. It had a couch, arm chair, coffee tables, desk and chair, king size bed. The view from the 8th floor onto Main Street was decent. Downtown has become alive again after many years of nothing to do down there. We enjoyed watching people from our birds eye view. The bathroom was plenty big. The TV was kind of tiny, but we were not there to watch TV. We retired early, around 10PM, and that's where the evening went downhill. The guests across the hall from us had evidently booked their room for a party. It started around 10:30. People coming and going and loud music and noise. People banging on the metal door to gain entrance to the hoopla, metal door slamming shut very loudly, over and over and over again. Around midnight i could not stand it any longer so I called the front desk. No answer, no connection, out of order signals. I called every extension I could find on the phone, nothing worked. I stuffed some pillows up against the door. Turned the air to run constantly on the heater (which was actually pretty loud) it helped to drown out most of the noise. But not really, until 3:30AM when I heard the loud mouthed hostess screaming for someone to get out and go home. Oh my. What a night! I wanted to get up in the morning and tour the hotel and maybe walk around downtown but I was pretty exhausted. I did let the front desk know of the situation as I checked out. And one last note. Be sure and check your CC the next few days after your stay. I was charged for the over priced minibar that I absolutely did not touch. I was told they would adjust this error. I realize that it is not the hotels fault for the inconsiderate guests across from our room, but I am more concerned that the phone systems was not working. What if we had a emergency ? Oh well and never again.

Reviews.Title: “a visit of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: johnpg2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adolphus for a conference for five nights and found it a wonderful hotel very comfortable with excellent Resturant also i would recommend the pool and other facilities at the texas club which gives it the edge on other downtown hotels in the area

Reviews.Title: “Grand Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonPersephone
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 6 night stay, with five friends. The greatest asset this grand old hotel has is its staff. They are wonderful. We were treated like valued guests and nothing was too much trouble for them. Everyone was smiling, polite, helpful and great fun. The public rooms are grand and spacious and the decor is probably much as it was when the hotel was built in 1912. The bedrooms are enormous. (we stayed in standard rooms). The beds were luxurious and very comfortable. The biggest downside to the bedrooms is the lighting - not unusual in hotel rooms everywhere - but in my room there wasn't one mirror in the bedroom, no overhead lighting anywhere, only table lamps. In the bathroom there was one small shaving/make-up mirror with nowhere to put anything. The shower was adequate but not overwhelming. And no in-room safe. The other complaint we had was that so many of the amenities in the public areas were closed. On only two days of our stay were we able to get a drink (of any kind) in the lovely lounge area, the Bistro restaurant, which served a very good, (reasonably priced)breakfast was closed at all other times of the day. The only place to eat or drink most of the time, is the Rodeo Bar downstairs, which is not 5-star standard. If you want a slick, modern hotel, don't stay here. But if you appreciate the old-time grandeur and courtesy of staff, there is much to appreciate at this hotel. It is in the commercial area, so not much going on in the immediate vicinity, but public transport via the new DART system is very good, and the hotel has a courtesy limousine which will take you anywhere within a 5 mile radius of the hotel. Great. We all enjoyed Dallas and the Adolphus, despite the few gripes!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away!”
Reviews.Author: dc1128
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Adolphus is in serious need of repair and updating! I stayed in a Jr Suite and the furniture was worn scratched and dated. The toilet wouldn't flush properly and the door to the room let so much light in it was hard to sleep. The decor was very much outdated! The entertainment in the French Room Bar was a joke. Definitely two musicians that could not play. I've heard better music in a Karaoke bar! The breakfast was luke warm and the bacon burnt. I've thought of the Adolphus as the Grande Dame of hotels in Dallas for years but it definitely does not deserve that reputation anymore. The valet parking fee was atrocious.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Charming”
Reviews.Author: Worldtravel41
Reviews.Content: I traveled to Dallas on business and this property was recommended by a colleague who works in the downtown area. From my check-in to departure, service was attentive and warm. The front desk, staff and even valets were very chatty and eager to answer any questions. I stayed in a 20th floor suite that was very large by city standards with a separate work area. The common space of the hotel is an attraction unto itself: very elegant sitting areas leading up to the French Room, with great service should you wish to have a glass of wine or some appetizers. The downstairs connects to a low-key sports bar. The property's location places you within walking distance to much of the business district, as well as several museums, the aquarium, and an art district. I prefer hotels with personality and history when I travel to other cities, and this property falls squarely in that category. It reminded me of a cross between the Seelbach and Brown Hotels in Louisville, which is a very, very good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely accommodating”
Reviews.Author: WalshTexas
Reviews.Content: I will definitely stay here again. Although my bathroom could have been cleaner the staff was so nice, friendly and most of all they got me where I needed to go! You are lucky if you get to meet Paul one of the bellman. Make sure you eat breakfast in the Bistro and have the Huevos rancheros!! Oh my gosh it was fantastic! Again the service there was wonderful as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service, Historic Charm, Cosy Comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: Estrellica
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Adolphus for a good friend's wedding, which was held in the hotel. The service was excellent, from the front desk, room service and the concierge. We were helped to our room by "Elvis" and he sang to us, a wonderful welcome! The staff were very helpful all weekend with whatever we needed, and all of them were very warm and friendly. We ate twice a the Bistro, both times were excellent. The lobby of the Adolphus is stunning, as are the antiques, and surrounding plants and flowers on the outside of the hotel. The rooms are clean, and spacious, I loved the beds with all the pillows and the walk in closets - there was a dresser each for my friend and I, an iron and board and hairdryer in a separate dressing area. This is great when you are travelling with someone else. The decor is fitting with the age of the hotel, the old convex mirrors over the beds and hallways seemed a bit creepy but intriguing at the same time. My friend was married in the French Room which is just gorgeous, and the food and service was spectacular! She also had a suite with a pool table, it was huge and had a small library and terrace. A perfect suite for a bridal party! I would go back to the Adolphus anytime and would recommend it to anyone staying in Dallas!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant & Classy Style”
Reviews.Author: danidb518
Reviews.Content: A bit expensive, but just for one night, we splurged! I had always wanted to stay there and see the antiques. Valet parking was alittle over twenty dollars. Nice, large, quiet corner room on the 15th floor. A bit musty smelling, I'm sure due to age. We walked around & found two decent priced Italian restaurants nearby after we ate across the street for a quick meal at Jason's Deli. Nice gift shop inside hotel. The bed in our room was comfortable & the sheets were wonderful! Feather down pillows. Breakfast was pricey-around $12.00 for the basic & strong tasting coffee. Nice atmosphere in the restaurant - tea pots of all shapes & sizes were on the walls. Elvis sighting!! I had to look twice at Paul, one of the bellmen; he does a pretty good impersonation, and has the sideburns & diamond rings like Elvis had. Nice guy- maybe he'll sing for you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AmsosaUK
Reviews.Content: I have no hesitation in saying how great this hotel is and how good the staff are They were polite, helpful and were there at all times to help out with any questions or concerns, from arrival til departure

Reviews.Title: “Rooms show age”
Reviews.Author: Fletch32
Reviews.Content: Overall we like the experience at the Adolphus. It's a great hotel with lots of history, and despite the lore of being famously haunted, we saw or heard nothing unusual. The rooms do show their age. No overhead lights - all lighting is from lamps. My wife was so frustrated by the low lighting that after putting on makeup, she had to go out in the main hallway near the elevators to touch-up in the better lighting out there. We had a room where the view from our window was a brick was with windows maybe 30 feet away. Zero light came through the window, which actually made it good to sleep in one day. The room had a full-length mirror - in the closet, with about 2 feet of space in front of it to stand. Great shower. Free wireless internet was nice. Enjoyed our time at the Walt Garrison Rodeo Bar, and was glad to see the Starbucks right across the street. Service during breakfast at the Bistro restaurant was extremely bad for having such a light crowd. Also at the Bistro, I called down for a wedge salad, saying I'd come down and pick it up from them as opposed to having it delivered to the room. I waited 5 minutes before going downstairs to the Bistro, then waited 10 more minutes once I got there. Seriously - 15 minutes for a chop of iceberg lettuce with blue cheese sprinkled over it?

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect stay I've had in a US hotel, or in the world! thus far.”
Reviews.Author: MiquiP
Reviews.Content: From the moment I checked the webpage for this hotel, I knew I would enjoy it. My partner had stayed before and was well aware it would be devine, so I trusted him completely. But my expectation was exceeded, from the second I exited the cab at almost midnight on a Thursday evening through the time I left for the airport the following Monday afternoon. The service, accommodations, FOOOOOD AND DRINK, amenities and lounges and decor, to the value - truly first first class all the way. And not even to mention the location, close enough to walk to everything I was interested in, from shopping, dining and museums and attractions, and if not a short drive or cab ride away. It was perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Forget the TERRIBLE concierge! See Paul at the front desk if you need something done right”
Reviews.Author: GenkiKairu
Reviews.Content: The Adolphus gets a mixed review from me. I stayed there for 5 days recently and was initially so excited to check in, since I heard that it was THE hotel in town and had the best service. I was in Dallas with my ailing Mother (this trip was a surprise vaction for her) and I contacted the concierge, who we'll call "D.O", just about a month prior to our check-in to explain the significance of the trip and to request a few simple room requests, which D.O assured me would be taken care of. These requests included a nice room on the highest floor possible with a view, and a welcome note for my Mom to be placed in the room. Pretty simple requests right? Especially for a concierge service that, according to their website, is "in the best European tradition". I even sent D.O an email 48hrs before our arrival re-confirming the requests, and was told that everything was ready to go. Well, you guessed it, we arrive at the hotel at about 9:30pm on our check-in day (I told D.O we would be there at around 10:00pm) and NOTHING is ready. We get a dark, cramped room on a mid-level floor, with absolutely no view and no welcome note to be found. Furious at the incompetence of D.O and tired from travelling all day, I headed back to the front desk to see how this could have happened at the Adolphus, where again, according to their site, all guests "are considered royalty". A gentleman named Paul listened to my story, and after confirming on his computer that D.O had left NO notes regarding our visit to anyone else, Paul took matters into his own hands like a true professional and saved me from heading right out of the Adolphus forever. Paul got us into a much larger, higher, brighter room, with a beautiful view of the city and had some wine, cheese and a welcome note sent up as my Mom and I stepped out for a coffee. This was really appreciated Paul. The next evening, Paul had a beautiful bouquet of flowers sent up for my Mom. Finally, some world-class service, I thought. So, despite the pathetic concierge service by D.O, Paul really made our stay enjoyable. Two other employees are real stars as well. Gerald at the front door was SO friendly and really took care of us. Thanks for representing Gerald (and sorry again about the bad bbq comments!:). And John at the belldesk was excellent as well. Be sure to talk to John after you return from the Kennedy 6th Floor Museum for some great storytelling! Really enjoyed meeting you John. Thanks for your hospitality! I am recommending the Adolphus only because these three individuals stepped up to the plate and gave the service that one should expect there. I HIGHLY encourage anyone who's thinking of staying at the Adolphus to search out these three people if you need something done right. They will take care of you MUCH better than D.O. Oh, and be sure to bring your own umbrellas too. I had to get a manager on the phone to demand one after being told by Ryan at the belldesk that "budget cuts" and "other guests not returning them" had depleted their stock. Ryan then suggested that I go to the hotel giftshop and "buy one". What???? How many stars does this hotel have???? Buy an umbrella???? There were several times when I sure didn't feel like "royalty". However, overall, excluding the "D.O" and "umbrella experience", the Adolphus gets a 7/10 from me.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: billyboy18
Reviews.Content: We spent a few days at this historic hotel with its southwestern charm and were not disappointed. The lobby and public areas are beautifu--deep, dark wood with a club like atmosphere. The bar was dark but friendly and the service was first rate. Its an old world type of hotel with few modern touches--this is not a boutique hotel! The rooms were ok-nothing special, weird closets in the area near the bathroom but perfectly fine for a few days. Out "wedding" rate was only $139 a night so it was a bargain. The area around the hotel is boring and pretty deserted so hang out in the lobby and the French Room and you will do just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay right in downtown”
Reviews.Author: gopalshenoy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier this week for 3 nights when I was in Dallas on business. This is a very historic hotel built in 1900's and even Queen Elizabeth has stayed here. For $133/night, it is a steal. They upgraded me to a suite (not that I needed it), the beds were super comfortable. Had breakfast at the Bistro - the breakfast was great. But for how much I eat, I don't think I will spend the $20. If you are like me and don't care for eating 3 eggs and sausages for breakfast, just cross the street to the AT&T building right opposite the hotel entrance and there is a small cafe on the left hand side. You can get hot breakfast and coffee for $5. But this is nothing against Adolphus though, it is just my personal taste. The JFK museum is not far from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: jechho
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights. The hotel i beautiful. Full of history. Service is great, front desk was very helpful. The fitness center was good. Did not try any of the restaurants in the hotel, but they seemed good. The only thing I missed was a outdoor swimming pool. The hotel has free wifi, a plus in a hotel in this class. Had some problemes with the hot water, It was hot, but not as ot as I like it, old pluming??

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, boring location”
Reviews.Author: Resmama
Reviews.Content: The hotel in itself if very nice, but the location in downtown Dallas must be the most boring one can imagine. There is no life, no people on the streets, it is just a deserted desert! Sure, there are some nice restaurants around, and walking distance to the arts centre as well as the JFK sites, but we still left Dallas with a very depressed feeling. It is the nightmare of all cities! Further, in a place like Dallas in the summer, one really needs a pool, and therefore I would easily pick another hotel, in another location.

Reviews.Title: “Such a great experience”
Reviews.Author: KT-7
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this beautiful hotel built by Adolphus Busch in 1912. The beauty and opulence in the hotel is amazing. Mr Busch was also part owner of the Titanic. He had a beautiful grand piano he planned on placing on the Titanic, and when that did not happen it reachiing its final destination in the Adolphus lobby. The rooms were quiet and delightful, room service and maid service was great. What was amazing was how a bellhop took me under his wing and showed me everything. John was incredible Texas hospitality, and I still can't thank him enough. A beautiful grand, grand place to stay with unbelievable warmth and hospitality...it made me love Dallas! I shall return. PS: for you history buffs out there it is just down the street from the JFK memorial, something all of us should see!

Reviews.Title: “Extraordinary”
Reviews.Author: TeeSheets
Reviews.Content: From the time you set foot at the entrance until the time you leave, the courteous and professional staff provides service like no other hotel I've ever experienced. The rooms were spacious, clean, and well maintained. Conference rooms were comfortable and well staffed. The lobby was always immaculate no matter what time, day or night. I will remember my stay for a very long time and will stay nowhere else on my trips to Dallas, TX.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding historic hotel”
Reviews.Author: clarkepich
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Adolphus for over 15 years. It is a charming hotel in Dallas and the staff and service is excellent. We spent our wedding night and many anniversary nights at the hotel and recently spent our 15th wedding annivesary there. The hotel sent up a wine and cheese plate and a very nice note regarding our anniversary. We will continue to stay at the Adolphus as long as it is around. Heather and Clarke Pich

Reviews.Title: “nice, costs nice, but watch out”
Reviews.Author: eloisefig
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying that the staff was very nice, i got checked in very quickly. french room- great. i'm 28, but look about 18 and the waitress/waiter were very professional and nice despite the fact that they probably thought i was a child food was delicious Valet coming in was very good, getting the car on a Saturday night, not so much, maybe more people. watch out for little thing: you have to use concierge for ice which equals tipping. I know i sound cheap, but for me, i can get my own ice for free thanks. Oh, and dont think those bottles of shampoo and soap are free, if you read the fine print, they'll charge you 15$ for those! Come on, they're free at even the ceapest hotels. I was afraid to flush the toilet for fear of being charged for water(j/k). And after asking to not receive the USA today for $1.50 each day, I still got 2 copies which i returned to the front desk. I'm not one to dispute charges, but I was charged for an extra day of parking which I noted and the clerk gladly took off. Overall a nice hotel. I didn't think it was creepy at all and I was alone(i never travel alone either). I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Old and reminds me of some place that could be haunted.”
Reviews.Author: Melissa Masino
Reviews.Content: When you walk into your room, I think your first response will be...seriously, this is HUGE! For one person, I thought I had been misplaced. The room was a suite. I think it would've been better if I wasn't paranoid and actually stayed with someone else. Being alone in the huge room styled in the olden days was ..to sum it up in one word..creepy. Three of my colleagues and I were down at the bar discussing the rooms. We are three ladies, traveling alone and each in our own rooms. We were all talking about how creepy the rooms are and how we each may be sleeping with the lights and tv on. I heard noises at times....it all sounded like people running up and down the halls either above me or outside of my door. There were never any voices, just running footsteps. This happened a few times, and it never lasted very long. There are mirrors above the beds that serve no purpose. It's not like you can do your makeup in the mirrors. They are old, and they make the things in the room look strange. There is also a normal mirror in the bathroom and then on both sides, there are two mirrors with candle looking lights in front of it. These are the lights for the bathroom. The mirrors are not something you can see yourself in. It's just really strange. If you like the old feel, this may be the place for you. On the up side, the staff is extremely nice and very willing to help!!! The maid service, the front desk, the concierge, the valet, doormen, restaurant staff, all EXCELLENT! If I hadn't been alone, I may have given this another notch. Location of hotel--it's in the business district, so if you're near here on the weekend...most things are closed. Be very careful is you're walking alone..lots of homeless people and some are straight up crazy! There is a police station and a jail in walking distance too. If you're walking towards the grassy knoll, which is about four blocks away, be careful if you go alone.

Reviews.Title: “High marks all around”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: I don't usually give five stars but this hotel deserved it. The room was nicely appointed, with tons of pillows. While neither the room or the bathroom were huge they were adequate size. It was, by far, the quietest room I have stayed at in years. The hotel staff were very nice, efficient and helpful in every request. Perhaps the only change I would make is that the bed was sort of hard, but that is trivial compared to the plusses this place has. The hotel is about 100 years old and has that "classic" old hotel look. It has obviously been refurbished and they maintained the traditional wihle upgrading it. The meeting rooms were, again, quiet and the service was remarkable. Although I did not personally have dinner in the French restaurant downstairs several people I was meeting with did and they said it was elegant and worth every penny. For a business meeting it would be hard to beat this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great place... BUT....”
Reviews.Author: isaHolanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at this hotel. I cannot be more pleased to stay in such a wonderful place. We arrived at the room around 20:00 and there was some noise coming from a construction next to the hotel, but it stops around 21:00. We were in the 16th floor and at 6:00 the noise in the construction started and it doesn't stop until 11:00 when we leave the hotel. It was terrible. It was really insane that somebody starts to work with a drill at that time in the morning and didn't stop. So, the last hours of our staying there we didn't enjoy at all, and we didn't have the rest that we were expecting to have in such a nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: rubysophie
Reviews.Content: My husband and myself had the very great pleasure to stay at this hotel for 3 nights, oh how I wish I could have stayed longer. From the moment we arrived very early in the morning, after a very long flight, we were allowed into our room straight away. In other hotels you pay for this. The receptionist could see we were very tired and our check in was a breeze. We were informed the breakfast room was just about ready to open so we went to our room dumped our belongings, washed our face and down for breakfast. Again service here was fast,friendly and efficient. We had had nothing decent to eat for the best part of 12 hours [do not fly wth American Airlines] and breakfast was just what we needed. The staff were so friendly it was a delight to eat here in the morning. Breakfast was also very good. Upstairs we caught a few hours sleep and by 11am we were ready to face Dallas. And what and absolutely fantastic city this is. Friendly locals, a great transport system[so cheap] good restaurants - the little italian place behind the hotel is really good- ask for Jorg and Milano the owner- they will keep you right and do try the Mona Lisa salad-FAB! Brilliant museums within walking distance of this hotel not forgetting JFK memorial and of course the 6th floor museum where the fatal shot was fired from, but another museum that should be top of your list is the Holocaust museum. This museum was founded by Mike Jacobs a living survivor of the Holocaust and it is not to be missed. My husband found it upsetting and whilst so did I, my overriding thought was of the people who perished and what they must have sufferded at the hands of the Nazis, I felt I owed it to them to finish my tour of this mueum. I don't know what my feeling were when I came out, sadness I think, but I am glad I visited it. Back to the hotel and the staff. I have never encountered such friendly, couldn't do enough for us staff, than what we encountered in this hotel. The male concierge let us into the French room to take photos, the female concierge made enquiries about a visit to Southfork and supplied telephone numbers, [and asked how we got on when we came back], the porter told us where to go shopping and another one helped us with the phone system. Another one told us about the history of the hotel and when our Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh used this hotel back in the nineties. There is a photograph and plaque of the Royals in the lobby. This is truly a magnificent hotel, where the staff are very proud of it and its reputation. They are obviously very happy in the hotel, as I spoke to members of staff who had been there for 20 and almost 30 years. Rooms are well equipped and very comfortable. Good clean bedding and nice towels. Everything you would expect from a 5 star hotel and more. In a sentence - Good old fashioned hospitality at its best- and I would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Loud Airconditioning”
Reviews.Author: busybine
Reviews.Content: I ended up in this hotel by accident. Personally I wouldn't have choosen such a traditional historic hotel, but I was surprised that it had free WiFi and an oldfashioned but high-tech desk. Big plus! Even though I had one of the smallest rooms I still would consider this room big (two queen size beds plus seating, a desk and a huge walk in closet. Minus: the air conditioner. It was so loud that I even had to turn up the volume of the TV. The TV is by the way tiny and old (not a flat screen). I would have expected a better one. This hotel is more for older people who still love flower curtains and not for high tech fans.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't Have Been Better”
Reviews.Author: cjennt
Reviews.Content: I was intrigued to book a stay here after seeing the magnificent pics on this website and especially after getting an incredible discount on my stay thru Expedia. I am always attracted to romantic, historical hotels and always try to at least check them out when I'm in a given town. Upon arriving here, the valets treated me like royalty and helped me carry my bags and were only too happy to help, even when I didn't have any cash readily available for a tip. They seemed genuinely happy to make my two night stay as wonderful as possible. When I saw the gorgeous and super elegant lobby and common areas at check-in, I knew I had arrived! The front desk staff was as deferential and helpful as the valets and my check-in was problem free from the get-go. The room was meticulously clean and beautiful, not to mention huge, a whopping 550 sq. feet and it was only the deluxe, not superior room. The bathroom was elegantly up to date and very tastefully decorated in a tuscany, Italian marble theme. The rooms are appointed with antique lamps that look like cloisonne/Asian vases and I couldn't have felt more comfortable. Though the hotel dates from 1912, the electrical outlets work very well, unlike with some historic hotels and though I can't speak for the wi-fi or internet hook-up performance, everything worked!!! I ordered several room service items and they came promptly and the servers were very courteous and bent over backwards to please. I have to be honest, I had some trepidation in booking this hotel, as I had read many neg. reviews regarding the thin walls and "lack of privacy" due to poor insulation. Well, I am the original light sleeper and was prepared for hearing sounds of amourous couples, loud tvs and terrible street noise on Akard Street. I have to say that I spent two very quiet nights at the hotel, despite an apparent near full capacity. There was a girl's pre-wedding event going on and I thought, oh no, lots of partying into the night and noise. AGAIN, I didn't hear a thing from anyone, it seemed that no one else was even on my floor; though there appeared to be lots of cars in the garage. I have to say that this was a spectacular experience and you have to stay here at least once. Some nuttos who h ave reviewed this place, have said that it is dated and worn. Not only am I a light sleeper, I am also a hotel snob, and believe you me, this place is a tour de force; I have stayed in the world's best hotels and this one is near the top of the list. Elegance, courtesy, and an alluring history make this a wonderful place to stay. I got a tremendous deal on Expedia and would recommend that you check there for excellent package rates (I paid $205 for a three day car rental AND two nights at this hotel), you can't beat that. I was charged $48 for two days of parking my car ($24 per day), but they did NOT charge me extra hundreds of $ on my debit card, as others have said. There is an $80 per day "incidental expenses" charge which I didn't like, but apparently, since I prepaid the room, they did not actually charge me, go figure. John, the concierge is a wonderful asset to the hotel and I just can't say enough about my experience here. If this place is good enough for Donald Trump and Queen Elizabeth, believe me, you won't feel any less special here! AWESOME EXPERIENCE. P.S. I did not get a chance to dine at the French Room, as it was closed on the days I was there (closed on Sundays and Mondays). I will be sure to hit it up next trip. If anyone tries it, please let me know. What a knock-out that restaurant is, much like the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for kicking off our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Debutante24
Reviews.Content: I was nervous about booking this hotel at first because the pictures from the other reviewers really didn't do much justice for this place. From the looks of many of my fellow veiwers photos, the rooms appear to be small and plain. I was concerned that it wouldn't be special enough for the first part of our honeymoon and believed that we should splurge a little more at the Joule. However, I was pleasently suprised from the moment we left the check-in desk and went up the escalator! First of all, the lobby was much larger than Joule's and more impressive! It defined elegance with the dark wooden antique furniture and mirrors. Then I was happy to find that our room was at the corner of the building and was VERY spacious. What I didn't see in other's photos was how these rooms had huge windows lined up with a beautiful view of Dallas. The bathroom was roomy as well and decorated as nicely as our room. I can hear the television from inside of this bathroom with the speakers. We had a very delicious breakfast at their classy bistro. I recommend their chicken and mushroom sausage. We will return later to try out their legendary, but pricey French Room. Overall, this place looks better in person and it is close to the more impressive side of downtown Dallas where you are down the street from Neiman Marcus and some surrounding flourishing restaurants and businesses. I personally recommend the Dallas Fish Market across the street and will check out Charlie Palmer at the Joule next time. I also recommend visitors to go to the Urban Market for a delicious lunch and for snack runs at their grocery section. I would also stroll a bit further down to the Dallas Museum of Art and ride the old street cars to uptown just to make a good day out of your stay. I did miss having a pool on the premises and I had to deal with the inconvience of valet parking, but I certainly have enjoyed myself. I'm sorry that I didn't take pictures other than my dress on the chair and contributing to my own gripe.

Reviews.Title: “Grandeur without attitude...”
Reviews.Author: rosstucker
Reviews.Content: Grandeur without attitude This hotel is a total delight! From the welcome -- overwhelmingly chariming -- to the sustained politeness every step of the way -- this hotel is a winner! Our room was a very comfortable and large delight! (The only negative aspect was that there was a connecting door to the next room; that invited noise since we could hear their every word. However, they were considerate.) Breakfast was very good -- although a little expensive. There was an emphasis on the healthy side of the menu. The lobby is a work of grandeur -- but there was a welcoming attitude everywhere and no feeling of intimidation despite the baroque quality of f he decor -- and the charming piano music in the evening. Queen Elizabeth II was there in 1992 -- her picture was posted in the lobby. She was smiling. So were we...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Kynetongirl
Reviews.Content: Just spent 2 nights at the hotel for the Dallas leg of our road trip across the USA. We were really surprised at how beautiful the hotel is; amazing lobby and bar, tastefully decorated rooms and friendly, helpful staff. We paid approx. $140 per night over a weekend and thought it was great value. No breakfast included but went to the starbucks next door. The hotel is close to the six floor museum. We caught a taxi from the hotel to Gilley's nightclub which took only a few minutes. I would say that downtown is not the best area, we were approached by people asking for change quite a bit and we didn't feel safe walking around at night on the weekend as the area seemed deserted.

Reviews.Title: “If you could sleep in the lobby, it would be fine.”
Reviews.Author: 4travelVirginia
Reviews.Content: Rooms on the north side of the hotel get the music from the club on Main Street well into the early morning. Until I informed the desk, because I noticed barricades going up on the street, staff had no clue tabout the mardi gras parade one block away. They were therefore useless to assist in planning for parking and getting around by foot which affected our own activities. Rate was hardly a bargain and not so much as a paper under the door or a cup of coffee in the lobby. Forget valet for your car: call was answered only once in 5 separate tries so go down and wait. 49 cents/minute for internet time in the business center! Visit the lobby and stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Snoopy5608
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at the Adolphus for business and it is always superb. The staff are wonderful, especially the car attendants. Jimmy always helps unload our vehicles and remembers our names. Everyone seems to be tripping over themselves to help in any way possible. Hotel is stunning. Rooms are wonderful, large, roomy, plush and ornate. Every detail in the hotel is ornate and luxurious. Highly recommend to fellow business travelers for superb service.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: aysm
Reviews.Content: Back in the 90s I traveled a ton for business and the Adolphus was my favorite hotel, well it still is. Last summer I was lucky enough to go back to Dallas to hang out with some friends and I just had to stay at the Adolphus, no matter the cost. It was never a "cheap" hotel by any means, but it was, and is so amazing, that it is still worth the money. The old historic building is just gorgeous and the rooms are HUGE. It's really an "old southern classic" hotel. The service has not been equaled by any other hotel I've stayed in. Both restaurants are incredible, and you never know what famous person you're going to see there. So, if you've got the money and want real luxury with amazing service, don't stay anywhere else in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Surprise”
Reviews.Author: thedoglady
Reviews.Content: A few weeks ago we were en route to the ranch for a special weekend for my husband's grandmother that we had organized. We left Friday evening after work and when we got near Dallas, we were both very tired and it was 11:00 and we had two hours to go. My husband pulled up his iPhone and got us a reservation at the Adolphus. Walking into the lobby brought us back in time, in a good way. We stayed from 11:30 p.m. to 7:30 a.m. and there was a cool statue and gargoyle outside our windows. One quirk is that you have to ring up room service for a bucket of ice. We had a lovely breakfast and hit the road for a wonderful weekend, hoping to come back someday or, if we live in Dallas, to put up guests there. It was a very quiet night and we slept well. We look forward to seeing its treasures, including the infamous piano, next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Adolphus is our favorite hotel in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: ilovemyboys9404
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Adolphus at least 6 times per year!! We have stayed in most of the "nice" hotels in Dallas, as well as other major cities in the U.S. and the Adolphus is by far, our very favorite hotel. From the unique atmosphere, location and service, to the wonderful food and impeccably clean rooms, the Adolphus remains the nicest hotel in Dallas as far as my husband and I are concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff ... despite everything else!!”
Reviews.Author: Patricks_Dad
Reviews.Content: First off - this Hotel is not remotely located near to anything of interest to the traveller except 6th-Floor Museum. That maybe makes it a Hotel that trades on the Kennedy assassination as a tourist/traveller feature, which tourists/travellers maybe need to consider,. We checked in on Oct 11th '08, having booked this 3-nite stay as a highlight of our 12 night trip to Texas (in my own mind!). The room was hopeless. There was 3 of us (Mum/Dad/Daughter ... all adults, as indicated on e-mail booking, and phone call) - the 2 beds were poor (comfort-wise) the sheets were marked on one bed (looked as though someone had stepped on them in the laundry!) and the blanket on the other bed had a brown stain on it (not that! - would likely have been bleach), the ironing board and iron WERE filthy, and the shower gel container was half-full (why bother at all, we wondered - if you're gonna do it, then do it?). Anyway, a grumble to Reception got us another room - more space, but same crumby kind of beds. Throughout our stay, the staff were fantastic - valet, reception, bistro, rodeo grill, ... all great. We had the feeling that they were lions who were being led by donkeys !!!

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect for my stay”
Reviews.Author: motleyangel
Reviews.Content: I had a great time staying at the Adolphus around New Year. It was in an ideal location for my stay and the staff were very friendly, particularly the bellmen and a technician who came to help with the dvd player in my room (there was a slight problem with it but nothing major.) The hotel was very helpful when the airline temporarily lost one of my cases and made sure it was returned to me safely. One bellman in particular, who I believe may be the one noted in other reviews, was especially sweet, chatting to me and helping me out a lot. I'm bemused by the comments that you could hear things through the walls/ceiling as I didn't find this to be the case at all. I was on around the 14th floor I think, definitely quite high, and I didn't experience this. There may have been some noise through the windows but as I live on a main road back home in England I'm so accustomed to the noise of traffic and people at night that I don't really notice. It was certainly not distracting and did not affect my sleep at all. Room service food was pricey but this is true of many hotels and I only needed to use it once during my week long stay. The food was warming and hearty, and the lady who brought it was very polite. We ate once in the dining room (not the French room or the Rodeo Bar) and the food was fine. Overall I had a lovely stay. My room did not have a musty smell, and was bright and clean. The only negative point I would say is that we did have some experience of the extra charge anomalies that some reviewers have mentioned - the hotel tried to charge again for valet parking when the final bill was settled but these charges had already been paid on a daily basis. However it took just a minute for me to explain, the situation to be rectified and the bill to be correct. I would definitely stay here again if was suitable for my circumstances. I splashed out on a stay there because the location etc were helpful to me as a lone traveller (I am returning to Dallas next month and staying in different hotel because of a different situation) but generally speaking there are probably hotels with better amenities (pool etc). Overall I would admit that although it is lovely it's perhaps not 'luxury' in the way that word might imply but I did not encounter the negatives others have cited and thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant...Historical...”
Reviews.Author: melargo
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my wife to the Adolphus for a Mary Kay seminar from July 20th - 23rd. This was my 4th or 5th MK seminar and we have always stayed at the Adolphus, an elegant historical hotel located on Commerce St. in downtown Dallas. To my suprise the lobby was not crowded with MK consultants or directors attempting to check in as was the case during past seminars. The front desk directed us up to the mezzanene level because they were handling the MK check ins there. We were assigned to room 1606 which was very spacious and over looked Main St. to the south. The bathroom was also spacious and has marble on the floor. The shower was execellent. The king size bed was my only minor complaint because it was a little too firm for my taste. A heavenely bed would have been nice. All the employees from house keeping to the bell hops to the operator were superb. We were fortunate to obtain a very cool discount of $69/night through Mary Kay and the Adolphus was very convenient to the Dallas Convention Center where all the events took place. I would recommend this hotel for business and if you can afford it, maybe even a short vacation but not really for honeymooners.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay, Nice Amenities”
Reviews.Author: justjennifer
Reviews.Content: Definitely a luxury hotel. Nice linens and formal style accommodations. Spacious bathroom with nice toiletries. Very large walk-in closet with drawers for clothing items. Our room was a suite with comfortable, cozy seating for t.v. viewing. Room service was prompt and friendly (however, became ill to some bad shrimp cocktail--so I'd not recommend ordering that). French Room downstairs was lovely (peeked in, not properly attired to dine there that night). Ate a cafe nearby within the hotel. Food was ok, but not spectacular. If you're not used to city noise, then I would suggest asking for a room on the inside rather than facing out as I heard street noise most of the night during our weekend stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl7824
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adolphus for the first time back in May for a business meeting. As a meeting planner, I travel to many cities and stay at wonderful hotels. I have to say, The Adolphus has quickly become one of my top favorites. The location is great and near local attractions (the flagship Neiman-Marcus is just a block or two down the street). The staff is professional but shows that famous Texan hospitality and are always available. My bedroom was gorgeous and roomy. Meeting rooms were comfortable (the interior rooms were a little dark since there were no windows). Complimentary wireless in the lobby and throughout the hotel (oddly enough, we did have to pay for a connection in our onsite work office). Room rates were very reasonable. I hope to come back to The Adolphus many more times - not just for work but for pleasure. Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “clean, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: travel4workAA
Reviews.Content: This is a very historic, fancy hotel. The location is good and it was verey clean, but it is also old. This means that the walls are very thin and you can hear everything in the halls and the rooms around you. This hotel just gave me the creaps, too. Like I was in the Shining. Also not very handicaped accessible.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not all that”
Reviews.Author: kkbenton
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adolphus for 5 nights while working downtown. The hotel is very nice and the staff was friendly. The room was huge and decorated in a sort of antique-looking style. It seemed a bit dated for a highly rated hotel. Pros - nice room for the price on priceline - $130. Convenient for working downtown. There's a starbucks next door. The rooms were also very quiet and the bed and linens comfortable. Cons - I was charged for items from the mini bar when I didn't use anything - I couldn't get it resolved because the direct line to the hotel constantly gave a busy signal. Valet parking is $20/day plus tip and I had to go out to the garage to get my car - I thought the idea was they brought the car to the front to you. This is pretty much the going rate for parking, but it adds up as part of the total stay price. Most of the restaurants in that area only offer lunch service, such as Jason's Deli and Galilee. Unless you are looking for a $30+ sit down meal, there aren't many options. The Interurban cafe and Campisi's were the best options. Overall, I would stay here again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MacandL
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked four nights at the Adolphus for our wedding anniversary. The hotel is beautiful and the staff are amazing. We were in a standard room and it surpassed all expectations. For a historic hotel, this property provides an unbeatable experience. The only complaint, if you park on site, you have no choice but valet.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel - Traditional Style - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: CamJones
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well located down town and the rooms are comfortable with more traditional furnishings. Shower is a little old but still does the job. The bed is very comfortable and the staff very friendly... I found it humours when I rang down for a to see if they could send me up a UK-US converter to I could plug my computer in... well they had no idea what I was asking for.. but then the lady said she would send me up this funny looking plug with strange attachments... anyway it was the converter I was hopping for. We used the bar and the lobby lounge bar... All in all a nice business hotel with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Another hotel that just gets it”
Reviews.Author: LSBurdett
Reviews.Content: I booked a basic room at the Adolphus for a weekend based on TripAdvisor reviews and was highly pleased. This is another example of an older property that functions well and is not part of a large chain. The room itself was extra-spacious and everything was in working order. The bed was comfortable. The shower was hot with good pressure. I especially took note of how quiet the room was. I don't know if there just happened to be no occupied neighboring rooms but once I was in my room I felt like I was in a vault. The windows faced an interior court: no view, but for me much preferable to street noise. I had breakfast twice in their cafe and enjoyed it very much. The service was friendly yet perfectly efficient. I commend them for not jumping on the wasteful, poor-quality breakfast buffet bandwagon. I would much rather sit and order something than graze. I didn't eat in their fine dining room but from looking at the menu, peeking in the room and reading reviews it looks like it actually may be a place worth having a $100 meal. Other notables were swift elevators, a computer available for guests to check out online information or print out maps (although this was not working when I tried it), super-efficient check-out and free wifi (did not try to use). I don't usually use concierge services but the doorman helped me find a last-minute concert ticket and followed through as he said he would. All in all the Adoplhus provided a great stay and would definitely stay there again if I were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, probably not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Orchidwmn
Reviews.Content: On the surface this hotel is beautiful, even if slightly dated. The lobby and main floor are especially nice, and seem to decline slightly from there. My room was very large, and nicely decorated, but there were a few problems. My room had a bath with shower and a stand alone shower, which did not work. The shower in the bath was nice. The bed and linens were great, but the TV was small, and in a strange location in the room, so it could hardly be seen from the bed. The drawers in the bureau were broken and ill fitting. The hotel provided a robe that was nice, and the toiletries were great. The hotel is right downtown, so very convenient for business, but not alot of night life in this part of town. Even most restaurants are closed for dinner, so without a cab or car you will be hoofing it quite a ways to eat anywhere but at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What an experience!”
Reviews.Author: aimsTexas
