Reviews.Content: My best friend and I had a great time at this hotel. We happened on it for 4th of July weekend. We were told this was their slowest holdiay so they tend to really lower their prices! We decided to stay an additional night. This is a 5 star hotel and we had a junior suite w/ double bed room with a view for $99 per night. We splurged on room service which is wheeled in on a white linen table. I highly recommend the cornflake french toast! Because of the money we saved on the room, we ordered room service several times and enjoyed the hospitality of the staff a great deal. The room is so elegant and the bathrooms are beautiful. Our bathroom was marble and had speakers so you could hear the tv or music channel depending on what you chose. We also relaxed by watching a movie in the room and wandering through the interesting halls of the hotel. The halls zig-zag.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus was an experience of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: RandiBoles
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Adolphus was amazing. The staff was so helpful and the room was magnificent. I will never be able to stay at another hotel and be happy. The Adolphus has spoiled me.

Reviews.Title: “NIce hotel - but problems with my luggage”
Reviews.Author: imemine
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderfully old and elegant hotel in a good location if you do business in downtown Dallas. The staff are very friendly but there were some problems...It is also close to DART and some fine restaurants. We had dinner at Charlie Palmer which is very fine dining but a bit overpriced. The rooms are spacious and clean and I had no problems with noise. Unfortunately one of the bell captains gave my bag to another guest. Fortunately the other guest realized the mistake and returned it later that day. I checked the bag with a bell captain after checking out of my room in the morning. Upon returning in the afternoon to retrieve my bag it was discovered that the bag was missing. It seemed as if nobody on staff could determine why it was missing or give me an answer as to how the problem would be resolved. Everyone was scratching their heads. Finally, security was called and I gave him my contact info but he was unable or unwilling to tell me exactly what the hotel policy and procedures were in handling missing/stolen property. This attitude was similar from the manager on duty. I was upset not just because of the contents of my bag being lost but also the luggage itself which is a new $600 Tumi bag and no one at the hotel said to me: "Sir, we are going to find your bag and if we don't we will reimburse you for the loss of property." That's just common sense and good business. SO - if you don't have this kind of problem, then The Adolphus is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated is an Understatement”
Reviews.Author: keithty
Reviews.Content: This is the most overrated hotel I've ever had the displeasure of staying in. We booked a suite the night of our wedding (thank god it wasn't a honeymoon situation yet, and thank god we didn't get there until late in the evening). Here's the breakdown of the major suckage; 1 - one of the phones in the room didn't work 2 - the carpet was coming up in several places 3 - the wallpaper was peeling noticably, and there was a hole in the wall in the bathroom, about the size of a fist. Nice.. 4 - the toilet was old and goofy. Not sure why, but it was goofy. 5 - the tv internet didn't work. Wireless keyboard and mouse worked. but not the service, so it kinda defeated the purpose.. 6 - we called house keeping to ask for a toothbrush kit. They said they would send it right up. It never came. 7 - national cheerleader convention.. munchkins everywhere. noisy munchkins all over a hotel that sells itself on elegance and sophistication and history. Total nonsense. My advice.. Skip this joke of a hotel unless you get a 2-star price, and bring your 2-star expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel experience.”
Reviews.Author: NeonJungle
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Adolphus for a work conference February 3-6. I could not have been more satisfied with this hotel -- the staff was accomodating and so pleasant, the room was spacious and well-appointed, the bed slept like a dream, and the bathroom was quite large, with both a tub/shower combination and a stand-alone shower. The decor is beautiful; I enjoyed walking around the hotel, viewing the artwork, the notes and letters in a display case authored by previous guests, and reading of the history of the hotel. During our conference we had breakfasts and lunches provided by the hotel, and the food was so far above-par ... especially the Tres Leches dessert cakes. We also rented a suite on Sunday, which had a full-sized kitchen, pool table, large patio, and big screen flat panel television, to host a SuperBowl party for our group. Wonderful. We also dined as a group at The French Room, an equally wonderfully satisfying dining experience. Because we were a group, our meeting planner was able to negotiate a very reasonable rate. I can't rate this hotel highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Time in Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: Cornpopgirl
Reviews.Content: For a convention, The Adolphus had special rates. Knowing the prestige of this establishment, I snatched up the rate as quickly as I could. The concierge was friendly and informative, while the bellman was witty, funny, and .. After showing me to my room and helping me with my bags, he asked if I wanted to see the Presidential suite. Though I was a little hesitant, I nodded yes and can't begin to describe that suite. Back in my own standard room, it was spacious though I felt as if I were back in the Victorian era.. just as the theme of the rest of the hotel. In the middle of downtown, your just a few blocks of wherever you need to get to. Thankfully having lived in the DFW area for a few years, I knew how to navigate downtown and found easy access to the highways.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Line”
Reviews.Author: Posada20
Reviews.Content: I loved the Adolphus!! I stayed for 3 nights on a business trip (was supposed to be 4 but our meetings ended early). The room was beautiful and the bed was simply amazing! So comfy it was hard to get up each morning. The counterspace in the bathroom was a little limited, but certainly not worth complaining about. The entire hotel has a very classy, old world look and feel to it, but is not outdated at all. The staff was extremely pleasant and helpful. We ate one night at the Grill. The food was good...typical pub type food. Also ordered room service for dinner one evening and it was wonderful. I would definitely stay here again for both business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: izzybEdmond_OK
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Adolphus during OU/Texas weekend. Nice hotel, rooms are comfortable - beds/bedding great. Great location downtown, close to Cotton Bowl. Very quiet hotel, valet parking only. A cafe' type restaurant open for all three meals daily and a sports bar in basement. Also afternoon high tea, for which you must have reservations. I will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traildust
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with this old style GRAND HOTEL. Large room at a great rate, well appointed. Excellent staff especially Louis Ford in the Bristro Room, he provided "outstanding service." Food is great and you most try the The French Room also.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve Suite”
Reviews.Author: havingitall
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the Adolphus. It is hands down the most visually pleasing hotel I've stayed in. My friend and I and another couple booked a suite in order to keep from driving 30 miles to my home after our New Year's Eve Bash at the Ivy Lounge. Earlier in the day prior to checking in we called to confirm our reservations and were told that we would have a suite with a King bed which wasn't what the four of us had in mind. We were told on the phone that all rooms with two beds were taken and that we would have to take the King since it was too late in the day to cancel. After some friendly negotiation by the slick salesman of the group, upon arrival they put us in a room with two beds so we had a good sleep and because of the particular package we purchased got parking and the American breakfast in the Bistro of the hotel thrown in complimentary.

Reviews.Title: “great stay”
Reviews.Author: JeanneAr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a business trip to Dallas. Room was large and well appointed. Service was friendly. Lots of things too see in the hotel and aroun. The bathroom was tiny but very pretty. The only complaint I had was we were on the 8th floor with no view.

Reviews.Title: “Good night”
Reviews.Author: jenlion
Reviews.Content: We were at the hotel for a company awards dinner. Our room was really nice, with two beds, a sitting area, a desk area, and nice bath. The closet was as big as many bedrooms -- plenty big enough to get dressed inside! There were some odd things. Almost every detail is seen to... but then they have these weird soap dishes in the shower. Nice tile and then this cheap piece of weird plastic that falls out every time you touch the soap. Out of place. Same thing with the bathroom crown molding. Starts and stops in strange ways. But, if I'm noticing those details, it's because everything else is exactly in place. Staff was polite and everything we needed was taken care of. The event itself was done very nicely. The food was EXCELLENT -- how often do you get that at a dinner served to more than a hundred people?? Entertainment was good too. Didn't expect that at all, honestly. Extras are expensive. You really need to valet and that costs quite a bit. Stuff like that adds up. But, all hotels like this are that way! If I was looking to stay somewhere nice downtown, I'd stay here again if I wasn't so cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - but ensure it is right for you.”
Reviews.Author: Maxdax
Reviews.Content: Stayed five days during a company conference and experienced excellent service. The room was very nice and larger than most. Here are some tips: Tell them you DON'T want a room with no view (some rooms look at a brick wall/no light); you should know this is not a hotel for the young crowd (very traditional); finally, the parking is $20/day, but it is downtown and there are no in/out charges and they are prompt. Dined in the Bistro, with excellent food and service - very nice and somewhat reasonably priced. Room service was top notch and prompt. Overall, it is a fine, very upscale hotel with a very good location for the Convention Center (4 blocks down Field St.) and if it is right for you, it will be enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent food and huge room”
Reviews.Author: Isky
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. I was traveling alone for a meeting and got checked-in ahead of time. My king size room was huge. My single room rate was $165 per night. A Starbucks is directly across the street... beware, they close at 2pm on Saturdays. No ice or vending machines so prepare to call room service. A soda from the lobby gift shop was expensive, $2.50. I ordered food to the room twice and it was very, very good. Sunday buffett for my group was delicious - excellently cooked eggs and pineapple tasted as if it was just picked from a tree. Some of the elevators were smaller than others, so it took a little time to get to my room when our events let out. Older hotel, so not a lot of outlets for my music, phone and for ironing. Surrounded by large buildings, so not much of a view. Bathrobe was a nice touch and loved the huge magnifying mirror in the bathroom. Taxi to the DFW airport was $50 for two people. Taxi's readly available outside the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “A nice change from chain hotels”
Reviews.Author: inkwave17
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on business and received an upgrade to the "junior suite." My room was huge although most of the furniture was in the back half of the room. There was also a very large walk-in closet, minibar and full bathroom. The furniture made you feel as if you were staying in someone's home which was a nice touch. Overall, everything was very comfortable although the bathroom could use an update just for aesthetics. The lobby of the hotel is very impressive and all the staff were extremely pleasant and accomodating. I ordered room service breakfast both days of my stay and while the order was half an hour late one day (staff claimed this was due to computer glitch and were very apologetic), the food was very good and not as overpriced as it could have been. My one complaint is not really the hotel's fault - downtown Dallas is dead boring on a weekend. There were few places to eat and nothing to do in the area. However, overall I found the hotel itself had enough character to make up for this and broke up the monotony of staying in run of the mill chain hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Downtown Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jillellen80
Reviews.Content: My bride's maids and I stayed at the Adolphus the weekend of Sep. 8 for my bachelorette party. The hotel was very elegant and made us feel like we had been taken back in time to a far classier era. We had assistance with a sedan to take us to the Greenville district and were very happy with the price and quality of the transportation that was recommended. One of my bride's maids was VERY drunk when we returned at about 2:30 a.m. and the staff helped another friend wheel - yes, wheel - her to our room and made sure she was OK. Also, we had to fight with the cab driver that took us back due to my friend throwing up in his vehicle. The Adolphus staff helped us and ensured us that we were offerring a fair price for the ride and the cleaning of the taxi. The rooms were very spaciaous - we had 4 girls in one room and didn't feel cramped. The furnishings were very lovely. Also, check out wasn't until 1:00 p.m., which is much later than most hotels. Any OU/Texas people looking for a great room downtown, I would definitely recommend the Adolphus!

Reviews.Title: “Stuffy, old Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: scrateef
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one night (supposed to be four) at the Adolphus hotel, and while the property wasnâ€™t necessarily bad, I cut my stay short after the first night to find more updated accommodations. The hotel has a rich history, and it used to be downright fancy; however, its charm and reputation just werenâ€™t enough to keep me, and I wouldnâ€™t return. We booked the hotel through AmExâ€™s Fine Hotels and Resorts program, and this property is one that they should definitely drop from the list. The Adolphus has several things going for it: Itâ€™s in the heart of downtown; it offers a variety of room sizes/categories; it has a pleasant staff; the rooms are pretty cheaply priced; itâ€™s purported to have the finest dining of any hotel in America (at the French room). Oh, and the Queen once stayed there. The hotel is very proud of this fact (her picture hangs in the lobby), and Iâ€™ll be she enjoyed her stay many years ago. Unfortunately, I donâ€™t think the property has been updated one bit since then, so the hotelâ€™s royal appointment doesnâ€™t really matter anymore. We booked into a junior suite, which was nicely sized â€“ although really just one big room. The first room we took smelled of cigarette smoke, so we asked to be moved. The front desk was happy to oblige, and we moved to another junior suite with a completely different layout. It was smoke free, but it had a definite mustiness to it. The dÃ©cor of the room had a stuffy charm, but it also smacked of a fancy hotel from the late 1970s. It just didnâ€™t appeal to me. Even though it was clean and in pretty-good condition, I got the feeling that the furniture was well used, and it all just seemed old. The bathroom was decent sized and had marble surfaces for floors, counters, and the combination shower/bath. All fixtures were of good quality but, like the rest of the room, looked too old. The room had two televisions, which were concealed in armoires. Because we were in town to attend wedding festivities, we dropped off our bags, cranked down the a/c, and left for dinner. When we returned, we noticed that the room was not much cooler than when we checked in, and it felt quite muggy inside. Too tired to think about moving to another room, we turned in. At about 2 a.m., I awoke with a sore throat and a congested head. The air conditioner had been running nonstop, and the room had grown muggier without cooling down any. The air coming out of the vents felt so damp, and I could only imagine the mold spores that we must have been breathing. A few minutes later, rain began to fall outside, and I started hearing a dripping sound. One of the windows, which didnâ€™t open, was taking in water so fast that a pool had formed on the marble ledge and was overflowing down to the carpet. At that point, I jumped on to the complimentary wireless internet connection and booked another room at the W hotel. The front desk was concerned that we were leaving early, and they wanted to move us to a better room. But I knew that it would be more of the same and told them that the hotel just wasnâ€™t a good fit for us. I think that many people would enjoy the turn-of-the-century charm that the property has to offer, but it just wasnâ€™t the place for us. With a major renovation, the Adolphus might be able to compete with the other properties around downtown, but for now, itâ€™s too far past its prime.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Uncomfortable Bed”
Reviews.Author: Tradewinns
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, think 'Titanic' for decor. Very classic and ornate. Every single member of the staff was professional and helpful. We were greeted each time we returned with a warm 'welcome back' and the room service was wonderful and on time. The rooms were pretty and the Noble House spa soap was divine, in fact, I am going to order more online for my home. The only reason I rated the Adolphus a 4 instead of a 5 was because of our bed. It was too firm (think concrete floor) and the pillows were down, but they didn't have any support so your head would just sink to the mattress. I used my pillow from the decorative shams to sleep on because it had better support. Other than the beds, everything was great and the downtown location is wonderful. It is right next to the Magnolia (also a wonderful hotel - great beds, modern decor) and 1 block from Neiman Marcus.

Reviews.Title: “Grand old dame of Dallas hotels”
Reviews.Author: CaryAllison
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Adolphus the weekend after we stayed at the Westin City Center (see my review on that). We loved the Adolphus and would definitely recommend it for travelers who appreciate nice digs and full service. It's on Commerce, so it's in an older part of downtown--the old original urban core, I take it, so there are some characters on the street, for sure (doesn't bother us-we live i downtown Houston). The hotel is really lovely with tons of charm--old paneling and woodwork in the huge lobby, and they even do afternoon tea (no kidding--people make a special point of coming for it. It's as beautiful a hotel lobby as you'll ever see. Again, "gracious" is the world I'd use). It's an older hotel so it's not as perfectly tip top as the Westin--it has seen more mileage--but it's in a great old building and the rooms are fine--large, with monogrammed linens and very nice travertine bathroom. And, after all, for many years it has been "the" place to stay in Dallas--everyone from European royalty to U2 has stayed there. The staff was maybe the most gracious I have ever encountered in any hotel--I mean, the people cleaning the rooms have their hair done and are wearing jewelry. The Magnolia, which I have not stayed in, is next door, and has a Starbuck's in the ground floor which is very nice to know about, since I'm a muffin and latte sort of person. We did not eat at the famous French Room at the Adolphus which is apparently the highest rated hotel restaurant in the country. We didn't hang out at Walt Garrison's Bar and Grill either on the ground floor, but they serve nuts in a shell in a bucket and your throw your shells on the floor--yee haw! Either way, I would say that if you're in Dallas and you can swing a good deal, you have to stay here just for the experience--a truly grand old hotel with absolutely first rate service and historical presence.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the restuarant not the hotel”
Reviews.Author: guy999
Reviews.Content: I spent last weekend at the adolphus. I have already done a review with hotel management so I will write most of that here. My wife and I recently spent the weekend at the hotel. We had planned on having a nice retreat away from the house, we live in the North Dallas area. We checked in at approximately 4 o'clock in the afternoon without difficulty. I then discovered that my wife had called ahead and asked for chocolate covered strawberries to be delivered to our room and build to our room prior to our arrival. She called a couple of days ahead and asked for that to be delivered or around 330. Unfortunately it was not in the room when we arrived. Approximately 1 hour later and two telephone calls later to room service the strawberries arrived. We did call and they did say that they were very busy however I think that if you plan ahead this wouldn't have been something that would have been very difficult to do. In addition they do charge a pretty substantial amount of money for the cost and delivery of these so I wouldn't think it would be very difficult to accomplish that. Next we did have a dinner at the French room. I will try to write a separate review of the French room but this was the best part of the trip. I am trying to write this review about only the hotel. The restaurant was great we had an excellent dinner we enjoyed our waiter and all of the staff. To go back to the room, we had upgraded to a suite. Andunfortunately this hotel is quite old. They do not seem to have renovated their rooms in some time. The furniture was quite dated and in actuality the chair and Ottoman next to the desk basically felt like you are sitting on wood slats. Also typically when you get a sweet there is some room separation. The suites at this hotel however do not have that type of separation they have a dividing wall but the wall only extends up about 4 feet above the ground level thus not providing any real separation. The reason for this being the problem is because the fact that I usually go to bed earlier and get up earlier than my wife and the separation allows me to work on the computer or do whatever without disturbing the person who is sleeping. That was kind of the point of gettingthe suite. I feel that the bathroom was adequate however the colors are a little bit older and some of the furnishings are little bit older however as I understand it's the room rates are very reasonable. Unfortunately with the package that we got, one night in the hotel and dinner in the restaurant was approximately $660. We did have a great time at dinner however I don't know if this really feels like a substantial discount. I think that if you are staying in the downtown area and you get a good deal on this hotel that it is acceptable. There is a great lobby there is a great area to sit around if some of your friends join you. However the rooms are somewhat disappointing. I typically do stay at very high-end properties and I really thought that the Adolphus was in that same category however I don't think so anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great price-value. Very romantic.”
Reviews.Author: STC
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 27th Anniversary at The Adolphus Hotel & The French Room restaurant. Two years ago, we had done the same at the Mansion on Turtle Creek. Over the years, weâ€™ve been to The Mansion for lunch and dinner on several occasions, typically when family come to town, but never the French Room at the Adolphus. Well, let me say that our dinner and guest room accommodations were superb. Upon check-in, the front desk clerk asked if we would like to upgrade our $199 deluxe room to a junior suite for an additional $34.50, so we did. For $234, we thought our Junior Suite accommodations offered great price-value (see my pics). The hotel is beautiful with its dark wood paneling, antique furniture and accents. This is a very romantic destination. Our dinner at the French Room was also terrific. We met chef Jason Weaver and Sommelier Gregory Cheval was able to pair some great wines with our three courses. Iâ€™ve written a separate posting for the French Room, along with additional pictures. For three courses, paired with wines, our dinner for two, before gratuity, was $260. The following morning, we had breakfast in The Bistro. The service was snappy, and our breakfast was hot and tasty. We highly recommend the Adolphus Hotel and the French Room for a romantic evening.

Reviews.Title: “Always a good choice”
Reviews.Author: EscapesfromTexas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I often stay here and always enjoy good service. This visit was no exception. We were quickly and courteously greeted by the valet and front desk staff on arrival. The lobby has Old World charm, and the tiny elevators with wood and mirror inlays are lovely. The room was nicely appointed with quality linens and Terre Spa toiletries. Everything was in fine functioning order, and the minibar was well-supplied. Room service here has a reasonable selection, and in our experience, the food always arrives fresh and in a timely fashion. Room service personal are consistently professional. One minor glitch this trip--a dining credit was not originally posted to our account, but with a brief call to the front desk, this was quickly rectified.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissRyan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adolphus for 3 days in April 2007. I was impressed with the hotel overall. Many hotels claim to be 'historic' but really thats just a cover up for being a bit old and lacking in services, not so with the Adolphus! The Adolphus was great, room was big, and good value for money considering its location and the standard of the furnishings. Staff were extremely helpful and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel with atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: cavedogg
Reviews.Content: If you would like to stay someplace that has high end luxury with touches of charm from a bygone era, then the Adolphus is for you. Sure it has all the features you would expect of a high end hotel--great attentive service, spacious rooms, beautiful, tasteful furnishings, comfortable beds, etc. However, the Adolphus is unique in the way it preserves and pays tribute to its past. All throughout the hotel and the rooms you see wonderfully ornate reminders of yesteryear--chandeliers, lamps, mirrors, bureaus, clocks, lobby furniture, etc. This creates a great atmosphere of sophistication and luxury. If you have any question as to whether the Adolphus is a hotel that is luxurious enough for you, remember that Queen Elizabeth and Prince Phillip stayed here during their visit to Texas.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with great service”
Reviews.Author: ckeaton
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at The Adolphus with my wife while attending a conference. We splurged and got a suite with a balacony. The room was clean, comfortable, and had every amenity. The public areas are elegant and the entire hotel is very clean.. Everyone we interacted with was friendly and was ready to help with any need that we had. We did not dine in any of the restaurants but did order room service for a snack that evening and breakfast in the morning. Top marks for that service and food quality as well...

Reviews.Title: “great hotel...needs to improve breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Mr.GoodChicago
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Feb 5th through the 7th. The rooms are great,the staff is friendly, the location is central. My only observation is that this hotel needs to improve the breakfast. It was somewhat disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - A Meeting Planner's Dream”
Reviews.Author: cmkchicago
Reviews.Content: I planned a meeting for 120 people - the staff was excellent - I did not have a single problem that wasn't solved instantly. I was extremely happy with this hotel - the only complaint a meeting attendee gave was that their was no pool!!! (I guess you can't please them all!)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, historical hotel -- excellent food”
Reviews.Author: Belasaria
Reviews.Content: Our national sales meeting was held at the Adolphus in January. At first, I was leery of the hotel based on the reviews posted here. However, after four days of constant meetings, I was pleasantly surprised by the level of service and the overall feel of the hotel. First, this is not a brand-new hotel. There will be some quirks to it, which perhaps is some of its charm. Check-in was pleasant, although I was surprised that no one offered to help me with my baggage until after I had trekked up the short escalator to get the elevators for my room. I stayed on the 8th floor and was a bit confused trying to find my room. The halls are winding and, if you look at the evacuation plans posted near the elevator, it seems as if each room on the floor has it's own shape/size. I stayed in a double room, which was a nice size for a downtown hotel. What made it special was the walk-in closet. Since we had to share rooms with our co-workers, an extra changing area/storage space was most welcome. Sure, the carpeting was a bit run down, but the rest of the furniture was okay and spread out enough so it didn't feel entirely crowded. The bathroom was a decent size with plenty of towels. The counter was big enough for us to share with all our toiletries. Housekeeping did a nice job of keeping our room clean. Since I was on business, the internet was vital and it was nice to (finally) have wireless that didn't cost $$ per day to access. Our meeting rooms were in the grand ballroom as well as the mezzanine levels. Again, it is tricky to navigate the floors and the elevators, especially if you are lugging equipment (or even your laptop roller case) from session to session. If you are planning a meeting here, be sure to bring plenty of signs to direct your attendees to the right rooms. Again, navigation can get a bit tricky to the meeting rooms. The banquet staff was outstanding as was the food. For our three day meeting, it was the best hotel buffets (breakfast, lunch and dinner) that I have ever had! Everything tasted fresh and full of flavor, and the staff was very attentive in clearing dishes and keeping coffee cups filled. Except for the first day, when we had a half-morning general session and we kept running out of coffee in the meeting room, the service was on point. The business center was decently equipped and, thankfully, had an attendent. Everything was automated through a touch-screen terminal. You have to swipe your credit card and then select what you want to use (fax, copier, computer). You were charged by the minute instead of say, per page, which in some ways is better than being charged per page for a fax (I once spent $50 on an outgoing 50-page fax because it HAD to go). Incoming faxes, however, were sent to the bellstand instead of the front desk, and I had to wait several minutes until someone showed up and I could get my faxes. After that, they began delivering them right to my room. Since we were there during the NFL playoffs, we crowded into the hotel bar to watch the last few minutes of the football game. One bartender was super-friendly and helpful; the other bartender was obviously in a bad mood, since she ignored several of us until she was ready. Also, when I ordered a round of drinks, she informed me somewhat nastily that what I was ordering was very expensive. While on one level, I appreciated the alert that the drinks were expensive, but her angry attitude was completely off-putting. Our awards dinner was held in the French Room, which was rated as the #1 hotel restaurant in the US by Zagat. It was an incredible experience and the food and service were absolutely outstanding. Finally, check out was easy and the staff eager to help me with my bags (unlike when I checked in). Overall, I had a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Adolphus!!”
Reviews.Author: AdiMere
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Adolphus for 4 nights and received an absolutely impeccable service. The hotel is located in the middle of Dallas & approximately a 10-15 minute walk from the West End (tourist area). We ate at the Yo Ranch Steakhouse which had a great menu but was slightly overpriced due to being in the West End. Trail riding at the Beaumont Ranch was great, beautiful scenery and about Â£40 for 2 people for an hour of riding. I would also recommend visiting the Dallas Aquarium and the Sixth Floor Museum (old Texas Book Depository building). The Reunion Tower (Hyatt Regency Hotel) is also a must. The building is shaped like a microphone and the sphere on top (about 50 floors up) containing the bar & restaurant revolves so you can see across the whole city, very pretty at night. We didn't eat in any of the hotel restaurants as we wanted to eat out due to only being in town for 4 nights but there were 3 to choose from should you so wish to. We did have room service & the food was delicious & reasonably priced. Do not be put off by the high-class & extremely plush decor, there is no snobbiness in this establishment at all. The concierges & doormen assisted us with nearly everything on our visit, hiring a car, locating a ranch for trail riding, numerous suggestions of restaurants for every type of cuisine you can imagine - they are all worth their weight in gold & saved us a lot of time!! We stayed Fri-Mon and got the first 2 nights for about Â£65/room/night rising to Â£120/room/night for Sun & Mon, definitely value for money. I would advise anyone going to Dallas to stay at the Adolphus and will definitely be booking in again if we return to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ddsandy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business for 4 nights-room was wonderful and comfy. Yes, I had to call room service for ice. The lobby was gorgeous, and the concierge and bellhops were very helpful. Note: There is literally nothing to do in downtown Dallas at night. The West End is shrinking, and I was amazed at the number of empty store fronts, lack of places to eat or shop, and the number of suspicious looking people out at night. I would not recommend walking around after about 7PM. For those people who don't like to tip, stay somewhere else. The people that work here really hustle for their tips, and deserve it. I thought the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable but annoying niggles.”
Reviews.Author: ROBBINGHOOD
Reviews.Content: This is an impressive hotel. We arrived on Thanksgiving Day at about 6.00pm. The acclaimed French Room was closed so we cannot give a rating on that. The Bistro was open so we had dinner there. The Thanksgiving Day menu had finished at 6pm ( we got to the restaurant at about 6.30). Anyway, by asking nicely, the chef made an exception and we got our TDM, which was very good but frankly not memorable. The room was huge, more like a mini-suite and very comfortable. In this respect, the hotel was excellent value for the rate we paid and the hotel's location. Little niggles: 1. Some of the front desk staff were not the brightest kids on the block - all were polite however. 2. No ice in the room - has to be ordered from room service presumably because an ice machine in a corridor would be out of keeping with the hotel's standing. 3. We were travelling around Texas and left stuff in our car overnight so we didn't have to heave a load of bags to our room for one night. There was no access to the car except thru valet service, so every time we needed something we had to wait for the car and then pay a tip - so just make sure you take everything you need with you. Another little tip if you're travelling by road and you don't know Dallas (like us). The instructions to get to the hotel are accurate but in the Dallas freeway traffic we missed the turn-off and it was a nightmare to get to the hotel (which in retrospect was quite easy). Recommend you have a detailed map of Central Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Tea Service”
Reviews.Author: chefsandy
Reviews.Content: A friend came into town to visit for a girl's vacation and we decided to try the tea service at the Adolphus. It was an amazing experience and the Tea Captain, Michelle, made it such a wonderful experience for us! I'm not a "tea" person, but the teas she suggested were quite good, the accompanying sandwiches and sweets were delish and enjoying it all while surrounded by the gorgeous and historic Adolphus made the tea an event! I highly recommend putting on something pretty and planning on spending a long afternoon enjoying something totally different with your girlfriends, you'll leave feeling like a complete grown up.

Reviews.Title: “Really shows it's age”
Reviews.Author: TENNNtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really past it's prime. Maybe it was nice once but no longer. The air blows in through the windows and so does the noise. You can hear every vehicle that goes past. Very noisy lace with the roaring of buses and trucks. Light sleepers beware. Also, it just has an overall worn feeling. There is no ice. You have to call room service for it. The beds are not up to the prices. Just a short distance away is the much newer Westin City Center and it can be less expensive. The Fairmont is also much superior.

Reviews.Title: “why is it even a 5 star?”
Reviews.Author: hotbiatch
Reviews.Content: where is the pool people??? i don't want to have to walk across the street to swim (and pay to get in) after paying $319 for my room and waaay to much for valet and parking. its flipping ridiculous!! get with the program !!! ROOOARRR!!

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating, Aggrivating, Not Acceptable”
Reviews.Author: SGA105
Reviews.Content: I can take bad news and I can take good news, but I can't take being lied to. Front desk staff are clearly coached to tell their guests whatever they want to hear, true or not. A month before our trip to a family wedding I called and, after much discussion, was assured that our two rooms, reserved 4 months in advance, would accomodate our requirements...one room with a king bed and the other with two queen beds and a rollaway. Because of the time of the wedding, we were assured we could check in about an hour before the published check in time of 3:00. The morning of the wedding, I again called and they assured me that both rooms, as ordered, would be available at 1:00. We arrived at the hotel at 3:15 to find neither room was ready. After 15 or 20 minutes they did get us one room, but said that the rollaway would not be available for the second room, and they had no idea when the 2nd room would be ready. In a rush all 6 of us tried to iron clothes, shower and get ready for the wedding. My advice to those of you unfortunate enough to be staying at the Adolphus....don't trust a word they say. They will tell you anything just to get you off the phone. When I travel to Costa Rica I expect that and find it a bit charming...I don't expect this in the U.S.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: BIZZTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is historic, but they have done a wonderful job at keeping up the original charm with it's beautiful furnishings and decor. The staff was always gracious and went out of their way to serve the guests, except at check-in that took nearly 30 minutes at 6:00pm. James, the concierge was fantastic - he worked hard to point us in the right direction for restaurants and other things and he never missed. The parking situation seems odd - you have to pay $20 nightly to park your car, but you can't self park, they only have valet parking, so with tip, parking is $23-25 nightly. The food was great and the catered food to the meeting rooms was awesome. Get the fried chicken! The rooms are large, but beware of the 'inside rooms' which look into another hotel. The windows of my room looked out into a court surrounded on 4 sides by other buildings, so my room had NO natural light. NONE! Would I stay here again, yes - but I would not if I had the same room.

Reviews.Title: “The Adolphus keeps getting better!!!”
Reviews.Author: jacktripper
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I stayed at the Adolphus on May 26th for 2 nights and it was a most wonderful experience. We had stayed there in 2003 and requested the exact same room we had at that time, a Junior Suite on the 19th floor. Our request was honored and we had a very pleasant surprise when we got to our room. It was completely redone...and in grand style. The bedding was top notch. Beautiful high thread count sheets, personalized with "A" on the shams. The bathroom was beautiful. Granite tops with iron work scrolled posts. The living room area had a beautiful armoire that held a nice size tv. There is another tv in a small cabinet in the bedroom area. The furnishings have an antique feel. The shower had a lovely rain shower fixture. We had a very wonderful meal from room service at what we consider to be a very very reasonable price by our standards (New York standards). Our only problem is that the valet service is a bit slow. We called ahead to have our car pulled around and always had to tell them again when we got downstairs. The lobby is just beautiful and it is a step back in time for sure. Wish there was more to do in that part of Dallas, as much of that area is dead on the weekend, but all in all a wonderful experience. We will return again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Attentive Adolphus”
Reviews.Author: fand
Reviews.Content: The service at the Adolphus is the best I have experienced in a hotel -- and I travel for business almost constantly. Every staff member is brimming with helpfulness and kindness. Even the maid who came to clean my room asked very sincerely how I was enjoying my stay and wanted to know if she could do anything for me. The first time I stayed at the Adolphus I arrived after 11 p.m., exhausted after horrible flight delays, and I had to be in court the next day at 9 a.m. Seeing my travel frustration and exhaustion, the gentlemen at the front desk upgraded me to a suite. The hotel won my loyalty with that! Always busy on the road, I often order room service. One thing I love about the Adolphus is that you can order it all night long. So that awful night that I got in after 11 p.m., after hours of flight delays, having eaten nothing (thank you airlines, for that!), I was able to order a sandwich from room service. This last trip I ordered the cilantro roasted chicken from room service for dinner and it was SO GOOD! The beds are very comfortable, and my room was charmingly different in that old hotel kind of way. One caveat about this very old hotel, though. There is no way of saying this without sounding crazy, so I will just say it: I am pretty sure it is haunted. I will leave it at that, and say that even so, the service is so great I think I will always try to stay there while in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “good choice in Dallas”
Reviews.Author: MBNick
Reviews.Content: Located right in downtown it is a very attractive hotel. There are 3 restaurants, one a rodeo bar on the lower level, the Bistro on the main level and the top rated French room. There is an afternoon tea that you need to register for. Drinks are served in the classy upper lobby by the piano, with jackets needed after 6 pm. The rooms are very spacious, clean, and very nicely furnished. Beds and linens are above average. Only downsides in the room are 1 sink in the bathroom, and a small TV due to the furnishings. Rodeo bar good place for a beer and throwing peanut shells on the floor. The Bistro is nicely done, food is nothing special, wine by the glass ran $12-13. Servers and service are good. French Room gets rave reviews from many and while it is definitely upscale you probably won't leave feeling like you got what you paid for ($72.pp and up) Hotel staff is excellent and really focused on customer service. Only met one bellhop (Brook?)who was not up to snuff. Guess he felt $1.25 per bag was not enough. Over-all would certainly stay there again and would recommend.
